5:20.race_name: Tattersalls Ireland George Mernagh Memorial Sales Bumper

runners.name: Barley Lane
runners.comment: E50,000 3yo, from a strong family and has very capable 7lb claimer aboard
runners.spotlight: E50,000 3yo; fourth foal; half-brother to 2m hurdle winner Lady Bresil; dam unraced sister to high-class 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner Coney Island, from family of good jumpers Wichita Lineman and Rhinestone Cowboy; very capable 7lb claimer aboard.

runners.name: Boedic
runners.breeder: Mme Martine Malivet & M Loic Malivet
runners.comment: E175,000 3yo, half-brother to a French hurdle/chase winner, one of three for the owners
runners.spotlight: E175,000 3yo; third foal; half-brother to French 2m1f/2m2f hurdle/chase winner Bayaline; dam 2m5f-3m2f cross-country chase winner, half-sister to useful French hurdler/chaser up to 2m5f Bayokos; one of three for the owners.

runners.name: Colins Friend
runners.comment: Big price when tailed off on debut at Navan, can be left out of calculations
runners.spotlight: Big price when tailed off on debut at Navan, can be left out of calculations.

runners.name: Early Dawning
runners.comment: E60,000 3yo, Flat-bred dam unraced half-sister to dam of 2m4f Group 1 winner Princess Zoe
runners.spotlight: E60,000 3yo; seventh foal; closely related to prolific Turkish 1m-10.5f winner Tanerhan, half-brother to winners Parand (French 8.5f) and Pepper Power (German 8.2f); dam unraced half-sister to dam of 2m4f Group 1 winner Princess Zoe.

runners.name: Eliodam
runners.comment: E125,000 3yo; first foal, unraced dam is well related, may prove best of Gigginstown trio
runners.spotlight: E125,000 3yo; first foal; dam unraced sister and half-sister to French 2m1f jumps winners, out of 2m1f-2m4f hurdle/chase winning half-sister to high-class 2m3f-3m1f chase winner/dual Cheltenham Gold Cup second Djakadam; may prove best of a Gigginstown trio.

runners.name: Eternal Reward
runners.owner: Patrick M Farrell & Ms Margaret Mullins & Joe Lyng
runners.comment: First foal; dam won a bumper, sister to two winners, half-sister to another, in good hands
runners.spotlight: E16,000 (vendor) 3yo; first foal; dam bumper winner, sister to winners Themanintheboots (2m4f/3m hurdle) and The Brass Man (bumper), half-sister to useful 2m hurdle/chase winner Knickerbockerglory; in good hands.

runners.name: Four Wise Poets
runners.breeder: Mr Enda Crehan & Mrs Miriam Crehan
runners.comment: Cheap purchase, shaped well on debut at Leopardstown last month, experience should help
runners.spotlight: E9,000 3yo; first foal; shaped well when third behind a well-fancied pair on debut at Leopardstown last month; faces a tough task against much more expensive purchases but his experience should be an asset.

runners.name: Healys Pub
runners.comment: E34,000 3yo. fourth foal, half-brother to bumper/hurdle winner Spirits Bay; good pedigree
runners.spotlight: E34,000 3yo; fourth foal; half-brother to bumper/2m1f hurdle winner Spirits Bay; dam 2m5f chase winner, half-sister to useful 2m4f-3m hurdle/chase winner Silver Tassie, out of half-sister to top-class hurdler/useful staying chaser Paddy's Return.

runners.name: Im Slippy
runners.comment: E70,000 3yo; third foal, half-brother to 2m4f hurdle winner Al Kalila, dam placed
runners.spotlight: E70,000 3yo; third foal; half-brother to 2m4f hurdle winner Al Kalila; dam placed bumpers/2m6f hurdles, half-sister to French 2m2f Grade 3 hurdle winner Nikoline, out of 10.5f winning half-sister to useful 2m1f-2m3f jumps winner Chele.

runners.name: Intosomethinggood
runners.comment: Fine third of 16 in a Listed junior bumper at Cheltenham, ran out at same venue last time
runners.spotlight: Bounced back from a poor Wincanton run (hung badly left) and belied 100-1 odds when third of 16 in Listed junior bumper at Cheltenham (soft) on New Year's Day; failed to settle effectively and ran out on the bend after the winning post at the same venue in late January.

runners.name: Le Tatoue Madrik
runners.breeder: M Hughes Rousseau & M Emmanuel Julien Leclerc
runners.comment: E115,000 3yo; first foal; dam unraced from a good French family, interesting prospect
runners.spotlight: E115,000 3yo; first foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Niko Has (smart French 2m1f-2m7f jumps) and Nietzsche Has (1m7f-2m1f hurdle), out of sister to 2m2f Grade 1 hurdle winner Nirvana Du Berlais; interesting prospect for strong connections.

runners.name: Let Me Be Clear
runners.comment: Two runs in points, pulled up and third of four runners, not a likely contender
runners.spotlight: E7,500 vendor 3yo; fifth foal; unraced dam closely related to 7f 2yo Group 3 winner Thousand Words and prolific 1m4f-2m1f winner Wordiness; has run in two points, pulled up on debut, third of four on second attempt; not a likely contender.

runners.name: Little Boy Sivola
runners.comment: Twelfth foal; half-brother to five winners including high-class chaser Funambule Sivola
runners.spotlight: E36,000 (vendor) 3yo; twelfth foal; half-brother to five winners including Funambule Sivola (high-class 2m chase), Espiegle De Sivola (French 2m1f hurdle) and Jupette De Sivola (French 2m5f cross-country chase); dam placed in Germany.

runners.name: Look Me
runners.breeder: G A E C De L'Ombre
runners.comment: E45,000 3yo, fifth foal; dam unraced half-sister to three winners, represents top owners
runners.spotlight: E45,000 3yo; fifth foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Grand Soir (2m7f-3m1f hurdle), Quitto Bleu (useful French 2m1f-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Space Blue (2m2f/2m4f chase), out of half-sister to a French 2m5f Listed chase winner; represents top owners.

runners.name: Lord Of The Locke
runners.comment: E33,000 3yo, seventh foal; half-brother two winners, plenty of stamina in the family
runners.spotlight: E33,000 3yo; seventh foal; half-brother to winners Present In Court (bumper and 2m5f/2m7f hurdle) and Knacker Trapper (2m4f hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to winners Line Ball (useful 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Rocco (2m-3m1f hurdle/useful chase); plenty of stamina in the family.

runners.name: Lord Tobin
runners.comment: Fourth of six behind a stablemate at Punchestown, the owner's two others runners cost more
runners.spotlight: E85,000 3yo; soundly beaten fourth of six behind a stablemate at Punchestown; the owner's two others runners, Boedic and Eliodam, cost more.

runners.name: Sunshineway
runners.comment: E170,000 3yo, brother to three winners, half-brother to a Listed winner, likely contender
runners.spotlight: E170,000 3yo; seventh foal; brother to winners How About No (1m4f AW Flat, RPR 82; 2m hurdle), Galaxiway (French 1m 2yo) and Ussia (Spanish 10.5f), half-brother to 10.7f-1m4f winner Styledargent (inc Listed); dam unplaced 1m/8.5f in France; one of five for the stable, Patrick Mullins takes the ride.

runners.name: Celestial Tune
runners.owner: John Francis Ryan & Ciaran John Mooney
runners.comment: Picked up useful experience at Navan but was beaten 24l, major improvment required
runners.spotlight: E 80,000 3yo; ninth foal; half-sister to bumper winner Katie Connell; dam French 2m2f Listed hurdle winner.

runners.name: Luciole Des Bordes
runners.breeder: E A R L Les Bordes De Mornay & M Gerard Hanquiez
runners.comment: Cheap purchase relative to her stablemates in the line-up, not an obvious contender
runners.spotlight: E14,000 3yo; fifth foal; half-sister to French 2m3f hurdle/chase winner Isis Des Bordes; dam unplaced French 2m hurdle; cheap purchase relative to her stablemates in the line-up, not an obvious contender.

runners.name: Notmiwadi
runners.comment: Half-sister to two winners, dam an unraced half-sister to top-class hurdler Harchibald
runners.spotlight: E8,000 3yo; sixth foal; half-sister to winners Extrapolation (useful bumper and 2m1f-2m4f hurdle/chase) and Cats For Cash (2m3f hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to 1m2f-12.5f Flat and top-class 2m hurdle winner Harchibald.

runners.name: Uno Me I Like My T
runners.comment: E4,500 3yo; dam French 1m7f Listed hurdle winner, cheap purchase but found a good home
runners.spotlight: E4,500 3yo; second foal; dam French 1m7f Listed hurdle winner, closely related to smart 2m-2m2f hurdle/chase winner Fan De Blues, half-sister to useful French 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Etudiant; a cheap purchase but found a good home with Cian Collins.

runners.name: Champ Kiely
runners.comment: Has taken well to chasing after a long absence, easy task last time, Paul Townend rides
runners.spotlight: Smart novice hurdler two seasons ago; off for 21 months before jumping well to win a beginners' event from the front here on New Year's Day; led to two out when outsider of stable's three in Grade 1 at Leopardstown; not seriously challenged in landing the odds in a 2m Grade 3 event at Navan; Paul Townend's choice over Ile Atlantique.

quotes.race: Flyingbolt Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I was always going to keep it as simple as I could. Champ Kiely loves jumping fences. To be honest, I thought we built up nicely from leaving the back straight and every time he heard the other horse coming he pulled out loads. I was always in control - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Bellshill Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely did everything as it should have been done; he galloped and jumped. Paul [Townend, jockey] was very happy that he was far more relaxed over fences than he had been over hurdles, which will hopefully bring about more improvement. The two miles and five furlongs Grade 1 at the Dublin Racing Festival is a race we will probably look at. He could easily step up in trip now he's much more relaxed - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: The Royal Bond was a bit of a messy race but Champ Kiely was only beaten four-and-a-bit lengths so I believed he had something like that in him - Danny Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Fitzgerald's Woodlands House Hotel Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely was very good, he showed stamina at Galway and he backed that up with speed today. He ticks a lot of boxes and he quickened here off a strong pace. Not many can do that - Danny Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better At Galway Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was hoping Champ Kiely would win but didn't think he'd do anything like that. He's moved up a few places in our novice hurdlers for this season. That looked very good. He looks a real jumping sort. I know he is only starting his novice hurdle career, but I'm already looking forward to him going over fences. I think there was a lot of confidence behind the favourite, so to come out and beat a 102-rated Flat horse like that was very good. I'll have a chat with Michael [Masterson, owner] and go through all the rest of the horses for the year before making a plan, but he looks a smart type - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Athea INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely is a big boy for a small girl. He was in my hands the whole way but when I went for him it took him a while to quicken up and he's still a bit green. He was doing all the right things at home and please God he is another nice one - Jody Townend, rider.

stable_tour.quote: Unfortunately he met with a setback while out on grass this summer and is going to miss the first half of the season. I would imagine I might keep him hurdling and put off his novice chase campaign until next season. 13-11-23

He's not done a lot wrong since joining us, with four wins from five. The defeat was when fourth to Marine Nationale in the Royal Bond at Fairyhouse and that was a good run, only weakening after the last. He won his Grade 1 last time out when beating Irish Point to take the Lawlor's of Naas in early January. He's improving with every run and at the moment I think he'll be best suited by the Ballymore. 08-03-23

runners.name: Down Memory Lane
runners.comment: No match for the subsequent Brown Advisory winner Lecky Watson at Punchestown in January
runners.spotlight: Made a good start over fences when landing a beginners' event at Navan in November; jumping let him down somewhat in a Grade 1 at Sandown in December; made a bad mistake at the last when no match for the subsequent Brown Advisory winner Lecky Watson at Punchestown in January.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Down Memory Lane is a good horse and had a few small little problems last year. I thought it was a very good performance there today, he jumped great and galloped the whole way to the line - Gordon Elliot, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Future Champions Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Derek (O'Connor, jockey) said Down Memory Lane never walked on the ground and was beat after two hurdles. He jumped like he was laboured - Gordon Elliott, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Tayto Group Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Down Memory Lane never came out of a half-speed and I like what I saw there. We'll stick to 2m for now, he showed a lot of boot and a lot of class - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good horse, fast too. He's going novice chasing and we'll start him off in a beginners' chase, probably over two miles, once we get a bit of an ease in the ground. We didn't see the best of him last season. 28-10-24

runners.name: Firefox
runners.comment: Creditable third in the Drinmore over C&D, soundly beaten by Ile Atlantique at Naas
runners.spotlight: Course maiden hurdle winner last season defeating Ballyburn; ran well in defeat in Grade 1 novice hurdles at all three major festivals; chase record features creditable third Drinmore over C&D, same placing in Leopardstown Arkle (2m1f); in between, no match for Ile Atlantique in 2m Naas Grade 2; needs to raise his game following sixth in the Jack Richards at Cheltenham.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Firefox probably learned more today than in any novice chase with Henry's horse taking him on an jumping as well as him. Sam said he just gave him a squeeze coming down the hill and he picked up. I wouldn't be afraid of coming back in trip - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: TrustATrader Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Firefox ran a good race, there was no real excuse. He got the run of the race, he jumped well. He'll go chasing next season and be a proper two-mile chaser. The way he jumps a hurdle, you'd say he wants a fence. He's a good horse. It's always frustrating when you don't win but he ran a very good race so we're proud of him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Supreme Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm a bit disappointed because I got stopped up the straight. Firefox wouldn't have been far away only for that - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Kettles Country House Hotel Supporting Fingal Ravens GFC Raceday Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Firefox is a good horse. We thought he needed two and a half miles which is why we made the running. He could still go that trip, but Jack said he has so much boot and is so laidback and relaxed that everything comes very easily to him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Play Responsibly (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: He's good. We thought Firefox was a fair horse and were disappointed that he got beaten in his first bumper but he came on plenty from that. He's not going to be a horse until next year really. Whatever he does this year is only going to be a bonus. He obviously can't go to the Cheltenham bumper because he ran in a hurdle race. We'll probably go to Fairyhouse or Punchestown. We like him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran okay in the Irish Arkle, but no more than that. He's obviously in the Arkle, but we also have the option of the Grand Annual or even the new novice handicap if we decide to step him up in trip. I'm not quite sure what we'll do with him yet, but the one thing I can definitely say is that, wherever he goes, the better the ground the better his chance.  19-2-25

runners.name: Ile Atlantique
runners.comment: Beat Firefox readily at Naas, flopped in the Arkle at Leopardstown, questions to answer
runners.spotlight: Limitations exposed at Grade 1 level during last season's novice hurdling campaign; much more like it on his first two starts over fences; backed up Navan beginners' win when readily accounting for Firefox in a 2m Grade 2 at Naas in January; very disappointing in Arkle at Leopardstown, labouring by halfway; questions to answer.

quotes.race: Racing Post Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Ile Atlantique is a lot stronger horse since last season, which is a big help. We can go 2m or 2m4f with him now, so we will look at the Dublin Racing Festival and decide which way we will go - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Ile Atlantique has a real cut at his fences. I let him learn on the job too, I let him figure it out for himself once or twice. I could have let him out and wing everything but he learned a lot more the way things went today. He rides a much stronger horse this year. Last season he wasn't seeing out his races but I think he has just needed time and a fence will help there too. I like him a lot - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Gallagher Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ile Atlantique has run well but I think he's a better horse than the bare form. I think maybe going over fences and coming back to two miles we could let him use his stride and that might be better for him - Patrick Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I thought Ile Atlantique was very brave. Paul was very happy with him at all stages. He did all the donkey work and gave Daryl a tow the whole way, Daryl just really outstayed him late and the two of them stretched clear the whole way to the line. They are two good horses and the two of them handle good ground too. I said before the race that I thought it was the top novice hurdle run over the Christmas and New Year period in Ireland or Britain, and that it was going to tell everybody where they stood, so I am very happy that I had the first and second and that they all ran very well. Looking at that, Ile Atlantique could be a Supreme horse - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Both of the horses who disappointed at the weekend, Ile Atlantique and Supersundae, ran at Naas and I think Leopardstown came too soon. We won't do that again. This horse will probably go to Cheltenham, but we'll see. He wants softer ground. 5-2-25

runners.name: Kilbarry Saint
runners.owner: Mrs Con Okeeffe & Tadhg Osullivan & Anthony Okeeffe
runners.comment: Useful mare, yet to win a chase and not in the same league as several of these rivals
runners.spotlight: Best of five attempts chasing when a clear second behind a hot favourite in 2m2f Exeter mares' Listed novices' in February; well held in fourth in Naas contest in which Ile Atlantique beat Firefox; fourth of five behind Spindleberry over 2m6f here 13 days after her Exeter run.

runners.name: Spindleberry
runners.comment: Had race conditions in her favour when winning here in February, open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Point winner; won a maiden hurdle at this venue last year before fine second to stablemate Jade De Grugy in a Grade 1 novice here; reappeared in December to make winning chasing debut in 2m5f Cork mares' beginners'; confirmed a high standard of form when taking advantage of a significant weight allowance in a 2m2f mares' Listed event here in February.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Colreevy Mares Novice Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: For a mare with only one run over fences I thought it was a hell of a run in a Listed chase. We'll look at the WillowWarm Gold Cup, the Grade 1 for novices, here at Easter. Spindleberry seems to like this track. She's entered at Cheltenham but that might just come a bit soon after today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Spindleberry was brave for me at the last. She took a blow and will come on for it, and she'll go on a touch slower ground. I thought it was a good performance - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: HAY "How Are Ya" Campaign Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Spindleberry was fresh and was maybe going a bit too well early on. Coming off a break, that will knock the freshness out of her. She showed a very decent attitude to keep going considering how keen she was early on. She jumped super the whole way apart from the last, and I think she will improve away - Paul Townend, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She really stepped up in the Grade 1 mares' novice hurdle at Fairyhouse last spring and looked like winning it coming down to the last, only to be denied by Jade De Grugy. I think she'll be an even better mare over fences as she has the physique to do well at that game. 25-11-24

4:10.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Honeysuckle Mares Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)

runners.name: Air Of Entitlement
runners.comment: Fine effort to beat Sixandahalf at Cheltenham, trainer's The Big Westerner may be too good
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner; easy winner over this trip at Down Royal at Christmas when too quick for Ballybow, a subsequent Grade  winner over 3m; no problem with the shorter distance (2m1f) when beating the favourite Sixandahalf in the Grade 2 mares' novice at Cheltenham; trainer also saddles the Albert Bartlett runner-up The Big Westerner who may prove too good.

quotes.race: Ryanair Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Dawn Run Mares' Novices' Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: We knew Air Of Entitlement had the stamina and the New Course suits horses with that. We always worry about being too handy in that race, but Rachael was spot on. I thought they went a real good gallop and she gave her some spin. It was a little bit like Telmesomethinggirl a few years ago.  We weren't as far back as we normally are, but she stayed on really well. I thought when we winged the last we had a chance. I knew Keith (Donoghue on Sixandahalf) had been up there the whole way and historically that hasn't worked as we have had a couple that did that. I always say I prefer coming here fresh and happy rather than feeling that I have to justify myself coming here - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She won her bumper for us at Cork after Colin Bowe had her in point-to-points and she was good that day. She ran well at Punchestown afterwards but the softer ground at Cork suited her. We'll start off in a maiden hurdle over two to two and a half miles and she'll probably want a test of stamina. She's a nice mare with a high cruising speed. 18-11-24

runners.name: Aurora Vega
runners.comment: Smart mare, plenty to prove after mid-field finish behind Air Of Entitlement at Cheltenham
runners.spotlight: Daughter of multiple Cheltenham Festival winner Quevega, sister to the top-class Facile Vega; three-time bumper winner; 3-5 over hurdles this season, most significant success when beating Dream On Baby over 2m2f here in January; plenty to prove after mid-field finish behind Air Of Entitlement at Cheltenham.

quotes.race: SBK Solerina Mares Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I was really taken by that performance. I thought Aurora Vega would come on a lot for the last day but I was not expecting her to do that. She looks like one we might keep for the 2m4f Grade 1 mares hurdle here at Easter. That would be foremost in my mind - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I'd be hoping we might aim Aurora Vega at some good bumpers in the spring - the Dublin Racing Festival, Aintree and Punchestown - as there is good prizemoney - Patrick Mullins, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Aurora Vega is like her mother, quite small and short but she's a strong barrel of a mare. She's not the flashiest at home but I think she's probably better than her work and I think there's more there in the tank, she's one that will keep giving. I don't know what the plan will be now - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She pulled up at Wexford but the vets found she was clinically abnormal and had lost her action. I don't think it's going to be a major problem and she'll continue down the Mares' Novices' Hurdle route, hopefully. 25-11-24

runners.name: Dream On Baby
runners.comment: Second to Aurora Vega in a 2m2f Grade 3 event at this venue, faded in 2m6f Limerick event.
runners.spotlight: Left her bumper form well behind when bolting up over 2m7f at Thurles on stable/hurdle debut in November; marked drop in trip when third in 2m Listed mares' novice at the same venue; did well when chasing home Aurora Vega in a 2m2f Grade 3 event at this venue; faded quite tamely over an extended 2m6f at Limerick.

runners.name: Hey Sunshine
runners.comment: 3-3 over hurdles including a 2m4f defeat of stablemate Tareze, might prefer better ground.
runners.spotlight: Placed on both bumpers; took well to hurdling in the first half of this season; backed up debut Kilbeggan maiden win by landing 2m2f Downpatrick novice handicap in October; stayed this trip effectively when beating stablemate Tareze at Punchestown; might prefer better ground.

runners.name: Karamoja
runners.comment: Fair seventh at Cheltenham but will need to reverse form with winner, second and fourth
runners.spotlight: French import won a 2m3f maiden at Clonmel on her fourth start over hurdles; fair seventh in the mares' novice at Cheltenham but will need to reverse form with winner, second and fourth.

runners.name: Karoline Banbou
runners.comment: Fourth behind Air Of Entitlement at Cheltenham, softer ground and longer trip should help
runners.spotlight: Two wins and a Grade 1 second in AQPS races in France; made amends for an odds-on defeat on hurdles debut at Naas with a comfortable success over 2m on heavy ground at this venue in December; good run when fourth behind Air Of Entitlement at Cheltenham, beaten 9l; softer ground and longer trip could help her to get closer.

stable_tour.quote: Being by No Risk At All, she should be a sharp type. She brings some very good bumper form from France. 25-11-24

runners.name: Kmil Du Seuil
runners.comment: Form of her only French run is attractive, thrown in at the deep end after a long absence
runners.spotlight: Form of her sole AQPS start (in June 2023) has been well-advertised by the winner who beat Karoline Banbou twice and now boasts a 5-7 record over jumps; however, she is thrown in at the deep end now after a long absence.

runners.name: Kom Tu Voudras
runners.comment: Helps to make up the numbers for Willie Mullins, faces a huge task on Irish debut
runners.spotlight: Helps to make up the numbers for Willie Mullins; faces a huge task on Irish debut.

runners.name: Maughreen
runners.comment: Lost all chance at the start at Cheltenham, should not be out of place in this grade
runners.spotlight: Unchallenged to win her first two races at Punchestown, a soft-ground bumper early last year and, 12 months later, a heavy-ground maiden hurdle in which her jumping became more polished as the race progressed; denied a chance to prove her worth after a shambles of a start at Cheltenham; should not be out of place in this grade.

quotes.race: 50,000 Euros BetVictor Graduation Bonus Series Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maughreen put up a huge performance for a mare having just her second run. She went out and made her own running, jumped from hurdle to hurdle, made a couple of little mistakes including at the last when Paul was happy to let her fiddle it - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Flat Race
quotes.quote: Maughreen was very professional, settled great, quickened up well and handled the ground great. Her work had been good but that is probably better than what she had been doing at home. The owners are entitled to get a bit excited, especially with that pedigree - Patrick Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: She put in a huge performance the other day and jumped like a handicapper. She was taking on a very experienced horse in Familiar Dreams. Cheltenham is going to be a tough ask for a horse having her second run over hurdles, but since we started schooling her everyone said she was a brilliant jumper. She's our top mares' novice. 5-2-25

runners.name: Sixandahalf
runners.comment: Strong stayer on the Flat, pegged back by Air Of Entitlement at Cheltenham, strong chance
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner and very useful Flat stayer (third in the 2024 Irish Cesarewitch on good ground); jumped well when making a winning hurdles debut over an extended 2m2f on yielding to soft at this venue in January; travelled strongly to the final flight before being worn down late by Air Of Entitlement at Cheltenham; trip should suit, strong contender if handling the ground.

quotes.race: Ryanair Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Dawn Run Mares' Novices' Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Sixandahalf ran really well - jumped and travelled really well everywhere, and probably just could have done with something to lead her a bit further. I did think after jumping the last that she was going to go away and win. I suppose there was a target on my back then. She jumped brilliantly and didn't do anything wrong - she just got beat - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: SBK Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sixandahalf jumps really well and we couldn't have asked for better. She has an engine and a good attitude. Hopefully she will end up in the mares' novice hurdle at Cheltenham - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Mallow Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: She didn't feel like a bumper horse. Sixandahalf relaxed lovely and went to sleep, I left her there and had a bit of ground to make up in the straight but she came alive very quick and hit the line strong. She's plenty of gears - Gary Carroll, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Haier INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Sixandahalf has obviously improved from the first day when she was very green and I'm delighted with the way she picked up and quickened away. I thought if she ran well here that she might win a summer bumper, so I'm delighted - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She was only a breaker this time last year, so she's achieved an awful lot in a short space of time. You wouldn't believe she had her first career start in March but she's since been very good in her bumper win at Punchestown and also on the Flat. She was third in the Irish Cesarewitch and then went over to Newmarket but had a stone bruise. She had a break for three weeks and is just back in. I'm not sure where she'll start off yet but it'll be in a maiden hurdle and you'd be dreaming of the mares' novice hurdle at the Cheltenham Festival for her. She's not a big mare but is very gutsy. 12-11-24

She had a break for three weeks and is just back in. You'd be dreaming of the Mares' Novices' Hurdle. Her bumper win at Punchestown was very good and her runs on the Flat have been too. She was a very good third in the Irish Cesarewitch. She isn't a big mare but is gutsy and you wouldn't believe she had her first start in March. She's achieved an awful lot in a short space of time. 13-11-24

runners.name: Swing Davis
runners.breeder: M Claude Quellier, M Alan Quellier & Mme Svetlana Timon-Quel
runners.comment: Costly to follow before maiden hurdle win on latest, not a likely contender at this level
runners.spotlight: Point winner and subsequent 320,000euros purchase; made amends for previous failures with maiden win at Navan; not a likely contender at this level.

quotes.race: Pick Your Places At BoyleSports Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was there a long way out but I was staying on and I still had a fair chance. Swing Davis was unlucky to fall the last day and I was staying on well that day as well. Two and a half isn't a problem and she jumps very well so she'll jump a fence in time -  Sam Ewing, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: Smart young mare who couldn't have won much easier than she did at Loughanmore. That was her second point start for Denis Murphy. She was going as well as anything when she came down four out on her first point outing, too. Hopefully she's lovely. 28-10-24

runners.name: Tareze
runners.comment: Showed a good standard of form before Limerick fall, stable has two stronger candidates
runners.spotlight: Point winner; chased home the smart Bioluminescence on hurdles debut at Punchestown last winter; wide-margin Clonmel maiden winner in November having been left clear two out; creditable second to the smart stablemate Hey Sunshine at Punchestown in December; faller at Limerick last month; stable has two stronger candidates.

quotes.race: Ryan's Cleaning Apple's Jade Mares Novice Hurdle (Listed)
quotes.quote: Tareze is improving all the time. She is a big mare and is much stronger this season. That was a very good performance, she travelled well behind the pace and picked up well. She jumped super and I don't think she will have any difficulty dropping back in trip - Robbie Power, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tareze is still only five and will improve plenty although definitely wouldn't want the ground any better than that. Darragh said it was safe though so we were happy to go - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.name: Thatll Do Moss
runners.comment: Beaten at long odds-on at Ayr last time, this is highly ambitious against that background
runners.spotlight: Made a winning start over hurdles in 2m Ayr maiden in January; posted a useful effort when just denied in a Grade 2 at Sandown following month; beaten at long odds-on at Ayr last time; this is highly ambitious against that background.

runners.name: The Big Westerner
runners.breeder: Southeast B/S, O Hickey & L Gleeson
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner at 2m7f, arguably sets the standard with her second in the Albert Bartlett
runners.spotlight: Bought for Â£120,000 after a debut point win; impressed in winning her first two hurdle races; landed a 2m5f maiden at Punchestown before displaying plenty of stamina in winning a 2m7f Grade 2 at Limerick; arguably sets the standard with her second behind Jasmin De Vaux in the Albert Bartlett, rallied well having been hampered after two out; suited by soft ground.

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Spa Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with The Big Westerner; she ran a blinder. She just got into a little bit of trouble at the second-last, but ran really well. I very much hope she's a chaser in the making - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Lyons Of Limerick Jaguar Land Rover Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: The Big Westerner is a classy mare and shows plenty of gears. I was cantering turning in and and I thought she quickened up really well coming to the second-last. She has plenty more to offer. On soft ground I would say she will have no problem coming back in trip. She stays well but has plenty of gears - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Big Westerner looks a nice mare. She jumped well and travelled great. She was a bit slow at the last but she picked up and went away. She was still a bit green - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was good the first day at Cork but didn't really act around the inside track at Punchestown last time. He was only beaten four lengths by Salvator Mundi so he's not far off it and the Supreme is the plan. 7-2-25

runners.name: Venusienne
runners.comment: 33-1 when down the field behind Air Of Entitlement, no apparent chance on that evidence
runners.spotlight: Had subsequent winning stablemate Karamoja just behind when runner-up at Auteuil in September 2023; 33-1 when down the field behind Air Of Entitlement; no apparent chance on that evidence.

runners.name: World Of Fortunes
runners.comment: Has been a credit to her trainer with 4-6 record over hurdles, deserves a shot at this
runners.spotlight: Smart mare has won a bumper and four hurdle races up to 3m, including twice in Listed company; deserves a shot at this, though she was beaten 27l in sixth when taking on the geldings at Leopardstown on a previous Grade 1 bid.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was all down to Jordan Gainford as he told me how to ride World Of Fortunes and that she'd stay. He has her to look forward to in the better races in the spring - Brian Hughes, jockey.

quotes.race: Cheesestrings Irish EBF Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: World Of Fortunes is a lovely mare with loads of ability and is a nice one going forward. She can sharpen up a bit more - Jordan Gainford, rider.

runners.name: Crescent Moon
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Off the mark over hurdles in a C&D handicap two weeks ago; raised 14lb but respected again
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point and a bumper; well backed when easily got off the mark over hurdles in a C&D novice handicap two weeks ago; raised 14lb for that but has to be respected again.

runners.name: Whimsy
runners.comment: Won a 2m Gowran maiden easily; a fine third on the Flat since; this trip is a question
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner can be a tricky customer but deservedly got off the mark over hurdles when winning a 2m Gowran maiden easily; a fine third on the Flat over 1m4f since; this trip is a question but a chance if staying.

quotes.race: Lord Bagenal Hotel Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Whimsy finally got there. A big thanks has to go to Paddy Hanlon and Paddy Graffan the last day as if she had gotten away with it, she mightn't have started today.  I went down to the start to make sure. We wanted to make the running, but it didn't work out. Oakley [Brown, jockey] said she found another leg once she turned in. She loves that ground, so I was glad to see all the rain coming. It's brilliant to get over the line over hurdles and I thought the handicapper was a wee bit harsh putting her up 3lb for the last day, but I suppose I'll have to eat my words now. I didn't know what way she'd go being out the back but she enjoyed it Oakley said. We might get something at Fairyhouse for her and if the ground is heavy, it would be ideal - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.name: Collaborative
runners.comment: Course winner fell last time; has had time to recover so one to consider
runners.spotlight: Improving sort won a Navan handicap over this trip before taking a 2m novice at this course, both on soft; fell early on back at the former course since; has had time to recover so one to consider.

runners.name: Ben Solo
runners.comment: Solid in defeat the last thrice including over this trip; UK challenger should be involved
runners.spotlight: Point winner won a novice hurdle at Chepstow earlier in the season and has been solid in defeat the last thrice in similar company including over this trip; UK challenger should be involved.

quotes.race: Century Racing Club Free Horse Giveaway Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I was delighted with that. Ben Solo is a big baby and he's a really nice horse - he'll be a proper chaser next season. He'd been working well at home and he has a really good attitude. I thought two miles might have been short enough for him but he got away with it at a track like this. Ben [Jones] said he was green as grass so he should improve a lot from this - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really nice horse and will be very exciting when we go over fences next season because he's a brilliant jumper. We'll look to win a novice hurdle under a penalty and then possibly a nice handicap hurdle later in the season. 10-02-25

runners.name: Birmingham Alabama
runners.comment: Three hurdle wins; not at her best back at Wexford last time but is the type to rebound
runners.spotlight: Point winner took a Wexford maiden hurdle over this trip last summer and won handicaps at Punchestown (2m4f) and Leopardstown (3m) over the winter/spring; not at her best back at Wexford last time but is the type to rebound.

runners.name: Krabat
runners.comment: Is 0-20 over hurdles; his experience will be a help but others are more progressive
runners.spotlight: Sole win was in a beginners' chase back in 2022 and is 0-20 over hurdles; his experience will be a help but others are more progressive.

runners.name: Hes Gorgeous
runners.comment: Should be fitter today and yard amongst the winners so is considered on handicap bow
runners.spotlight: Maiden whose best run in four hurdle starts came in a Navan maiden last time over this trip after 55 days off; should be fitter today and yard amongst the winners so is considered on handicap bow.

runners.name: Must Go Now
runners.comment: Solid effort over 2m2f at Naas last time; up another 4lb but shouldn't be far away again
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when winning a C&D handicap on New Year's Day and a solid effort over 2m2f at Naas since; up another 4lb but shouldn't be far away again.

runners.name: Newtown Rambler
runners.comment: Disappointed when last seen in a Navan handicap; will have to be ready after his absence
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced; won a Sligo maiden hurdle over this trip on second hurdle start but disappointed next time in a Navan handicap; will have to be ready after his absence.

runners.name: Harbour Highway
runners.comment: Capable of better now in handicaps and any market support would be significant
runners.spotlight: Point and bumper winner hasn't got close to that level over hurdles in four maidens up to this trip; is likely capable of better now in handicaps and any market support would be significant.

quotes.race: Racing Next On April 9th (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Harbour Highway had shown plenty at home and Patrick [Mullins] had a sit on him on an away day. He was very keen to stick with him wherever he was going to run. He was impressive and galloped through the line, so hopefully he'll go on to bigger and better things. It's a few weeks to Punchestown and there is the winners' bumper there, and maybe even the champion bumper he could go to. We'll see how he comes out of this first - Emmet Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's back and we might give him an entry for this weekend. He's one to look forward to in staying novice hurdles. He was good when winning his bumper at Navan and had a disappointing run at Punchestown in Grade 1 company, but we can allow him one bad run and hopefully he can put that behind him. 25-11-24

runners.name: Stay Gold
runners.comment: Ran in snatches last time in first-time cheekpieces and coughed post-race; chance at best
runners.spotlight: Has displayed uneven form in six hurdle starts but best effort came over a similar trip to this at Punchestown last time; ran in snatches then in first-time cheekpieces and coughed post-race; a chance if at best with headgear left on.

runners.name: Granns Boy
runners.comment: Fourth to an improving type in a Wexford novice last time; a shout if ready on return
runners.spotlight: Flat winner won a Kilbeggan maiden hurdle over 2m3f last summer; a solid fourth to an improving type in a Wexford novice next time; handles this ground and a shout if ready on return.

runners.name: Attaboyarchie
runners.comment: Poor in a handicap and maiden the last twice and cheekpieces need to work
runners.spotlight: Yet to score in 12 hurdle starts but some decent efforts; poor in a handicap and maiden the last twice and cheekpieces need to work.

runners.name: Sticwiththeprocess
runners.comment: Beaten 15l over C&D last time off this mark and needs plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on sole point start and just a hint of promise in three maiden hurdles; a similar effort on handicap debut over C&D when beaten 15l off this mark by Crescent Moon; needs plenty of improvement but owner's retained rider is aboard.

runners.name: Burvea
runners.comment: Solid mare but beaten 10l over 2m5f at Ballinrobe last time; needs more
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m Wexford maiden hurdle last summer and some solid efforts in defeat since; beaten 10l over 2m5f at Ballinrobe last time; needs more.

runners.name: Young Lucy
runners.comment: Yet to score over hurdles but several decent runs; can improve from last time; noted
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner is yet to score over hurdles but several decent runs including over 3m at this course last time; this trip is fine and she can improve from that so is noted.

runners.name: Lynchy Boy
runners.comment: Weakening when fell two out on return at Gowran last month; needs his best
runners.spotlight: Finished in the frame in three maiden hurdles last year including over this trip; weakening when fell two out on return at Gowran last month; needs his best.

runners.name: Saffronandblue
runners.owner: Anthony Vaughan & O B P Carroll
runners.comment: Dual Flat winner hasn't shown a lot in four hurdle starts including a handicap
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner ran well in that sphere at the Curragh last month; hasn't shown a lot in four hurdle starts including a handicap.

runners.name: Kinturk Maggie
runners.comment: was beaten 15l on handicap debut last time; needs loads of improvement
runners.spotlight: A hint of ability in three maiden hurdles but was beaten 15l on handicap debut last time; needs loads of improvement up in trip.

runners.name: To The Wire
runners.comment: Point winner has been poor in three maiden hurdles; surely capable of better; watch market
runners.spotlight: Won a point in May 2024 but has been poor in three maiden hurdles over 2m; steps up in trip on return for handicap debut; surely capable of better so isn't ignored even 1lb out of the handicap; watch market.

1:52.race_name: BoyleSports, Proud Sponsors Since 2014 Novice Handicap Chase (Listed Race)

runners.name: Jesse Evans
runners.comment: Versatile gelding who has the class to make his presence felt off top weight
runners.spotlight: Versatile gelding who ran well on the Flat last time after a break; 1-3 over fences and didn't quite get home in a 2m4f Grade 3 on final run in this discipline; has the class to make his presence felt off top weight.

quotes.race: Galway City Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Jesse Evans was foot perfect the whole way round, indeed the mistake he made at Killarney is the only one he has ever made and it probably did him good. He is a good ground horse and my dream for him would be to come back next year for the Galway Plate - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Horse & Jockey Hotel Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jesse Evans is a nice horse and it was nice to see him quicken up the way he did. He likes goodish ground and we would have to think of a race like the Morgiana Hurdle for him now - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Flower Hill Maiden
quotes.quote: Jesse Evans did not do a lot when he got there, he would prefer a good gallop. He may well turn up in the Naas November Handicap - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Joe Bollard Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's now won his bumper and maiden hurdle so we'll give him a little time before he goes for something else. He jumps quick. I don't know how he will handle heavy ground but Sean said that was borderline quick enough for him. He'll go for a winners' race somewhere - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Kerry Petroleum Flat Race
quotes.quote: The horse travelled the whole way and picked up lovely; he is a smart horse and I was quite comfortable I would pass the leader and had plenty of horse under me - rider Mark O'Hare.

runners.name: Path Doroux
runners.comment: 2m4f too far in the Plate at Cheltenham; tough mark but he's back at the right trip
runners.spotlight: Third in last season's Grand Annual and the 2m4f of the Plate looked a step too far at this year's festival; stuck on a tough mark but back over the right trip he's entitled to have some say.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted, Path d'Oroux was banging on the door so many times last season and didn't win but got a lot of experience. It was a messy race, they went very slow and then turned into a sprint but he came out of it well. He's probably not good enough to mix it with the Grade 1 novices but at the same time he's experienced. In the early season in against some he may just have the upper hand. This was the plan for a while - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Corrib Oil Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Path D'Oroux will come on plenty for this. He's a nice one to look forward to. He's very laid back mentally and he should sharpen up for that. I suppose we'll got to Fairyhouse for the Royal Bond - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Buggyman (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Path D'Oroux is a nice horse. I'm delighted with that as we really liked him at home and I'd say it was a good bumper. He was a little bit keen and it didn't exactly go to plan. We intended to ride him with a little bit of cover and, while we couldn't get it, he still won and that's always the sign of a good one - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He had a good win at Cheltenham last month before finishing third in a graduation chase at Carlisle. He was placed at Leopardstown, Aintree and Punchestown and was a little bit unlucky not to land a big one. Hopefully he'll reap the rewards for it this season - he's still a novice as Cheltenham was his first win over fences. 12-11-24

He had a good win at Cheltenham last month before finishing third in a graduation chase at Carlisle. He was placed at Leopardstown, Aintree and Punchestown and was a little bit unlucky not to land a big one. Hopefully he'll reap the rewards for it this season - he's still a novice as Cheltenham was his first win over fences. 13-11-24

runners.name: Springt De La Mare
runners.breeder: M Hubert Pichon & E A R L Pichon P-V
runners.comment: Good mark on his RPRs and forget last time as was found to be coughing
runners.spotlight: His first two wins over fences included a defeat of this week's impressive Cheltenham winner Theatre Native; RPRs suggest he could be on a useful mark and forget last time as was found to be coughing.

quotes.race: Concept Colours Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Springt De La Mare jumped really well and it was a good performance. I was just saying to Keith there that we couldn't win a maiden hurdle with him, but he's taken to this better. He jumps really well and got through that ground well. He won his bumper and looked like he was going to be very smart, but he just lost his way a little bit in the middle part of his career. Hopefully, we're back on track. He doesn't qualify for some of the bigger handicaps yet with only two runs, so I'm not really sure where we go now - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse For Fundraisers Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Springt De La Mare jumped very well for his first run over fences. He looks like a real chaser. I wouldn't be afraid to go a little bit further with him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was very good in his bumper win at Navan last season before finishing third in a Listed race at the same track. He got a nasty enough fall in his maiden hurdle in January and we let him off then for the rest of the season. He's had a long break and is going to start off over fences when the rain comes. He's a point-to-point winner and a nice horse. 12-11-24

He was very good in his bumper win at Navan last season before finishing third in a Listed race there. He got a nasty fall in his maiden hurdle in January and we let him off for the rest of the season. He's going to start off over fences when the rain comes. He's a nice horse. 13-11-24

runners.name: Drumgill
runners.comment: Triple hurdle winner and now 2-3 over fences after an emphatic handicap win at Limerick
runners.spotlight: Triple hurdle winner and now 2-3 over fences after an emphatic handicap win at Limerick (2m2f, good) where his jumping was excellent; up 5lb in a hotter race here but firmly in the reckoning under Rachael Blackmore.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Drumgill went disappointing over hurdles but probably got sick of it. Philip Donovan rode him the last day and wasn't too hard on him and we freshened him up since. He is a brilliant jumper, loved that good ground and we thought he'd run okay - John Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: No Flies On Him
runners.comment: Essentially disappointing given his initial promise and he's now 0-5 over fences
runners.spotlight: Essentially underwhelming given his initial promise and made it 0-5 over fences when the disappointing favourite in a 2m4f Listed handicap at Navan in early March; would have a chance on his third at Leopardstown over Christmas but not sure the recent rain will have been welcomed.

quotes.race: TRI Equestrian Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: "I chose No Flies On Him as a three-year-old at the Derby sales when JP very kindly let me pick one out and he sent him for his education with Derek O'Connor, who did a fantastic job with him. He has a wonderful pedigree and he looks like a very promising horse. I've had a lot of swans over the last few years who have turned out as geese but I think this fella might stay a swan! He will have to be entered in Grade 1s after this and hopefully he might get there - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

runners.name: Conyers Hill
runners.comment: Got himself a bit too far back before running on into sixth in the Grand Annual
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler; off the mark over fences in a novice at Down Royal and got himself a bit too far back before running on into sixth in the Grand Annual (one place behind Jasko Des Dames); enters the reckoning.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Conyers Hill is a hold-up horse and tends not to find too much. He was sticky enough at a few of his fences, but he had to battle today and held the second to the line. He might head on to Cheltenham for the novice handicap chase - Paul Nolan, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power How Many Days 'Til Christmas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Conyers Hill jumped slick and well but he certainly doesn't do much when he gets to the front. He got a bit of confidence from Clonmel the last day. He came there travelling well and I thought he was going to get caught at the line but he battled on well - Paul Nolan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Conyers Hill is Conyers Hill! You know what you're going to get from him. He'll be dropped out last with the hope of cutting through the pack. That's the way he has to be ridden. Don't be surprised if he looks like winning turning for home. What happens from there, we'll have to wait and see.  20-2-25

runners.name: Jasko Des Dames
runners.comment: Excellent fifth in the Grand Annual and would have been closer without a late mistake
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdler who won his first two chases under positive rides and returned to those tactics when a highly respectable fifth in the Grand Annual at Cheltenham, his first handicap in this discipline; would have been closer than 7l without a late mistake.

runners.name: Release The Beast
runners.comment: Looked good at Limerick in December and he's a lot better than he showed last time
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and the winner of a maiden hurdle and a beginners' chase, looking good at Limerick over Christmas (2m1f, yielding to soft); not sure what happened in a novice last time at Punchestown (sent off favourite) but he's better than that and brings potential into handicaps.

quotes.race: O'Kelly Brothers Demolition Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Release The Beast is a horse we have always liked and this is his job. He is a different horse since he came back in this year and had a lovely run the first day. It was only a rated novice but he is definitely a nice horse - James Nolan, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Release The Beast has never disappointed us. It's impossible to assess other than it could not have been easier. We're excited by him - Paul Nolan, trainer

runners.name: Rainbow Trail
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Wheels have come off but he's back in distance after a break and could easily fare better
runners.spotlight: Won his first chase at Gowran in October and later ran okay in a Grade 3; the wheels have come off since (including a Naas handicap last time) but he's back in distance after a break and could easily fare better.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We probably won't do much more with Rainbow Trail now and he'll head over fences next season. He's honest, he jumps and he stays - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was a shame to see him come down at Punchestown in that Grade 3 novice chase and it would have been interesting to see how he got on. He already looks like he's going to be a better chaser than hurdler and two and a half miles looks his trip. 28-10-24

runners.name: Spinning Web
runners.comment: Improved to win twice at Thurles but on goodish ground; also up 9lb for last time
runners.spotlight: Already looking a better chaser than hurdler and seeks a hat-trick after back-to-back wins over 2m5f at Thurles, the latest a handicap off 9lb lower; had plenty in hand that day but the ground was good which seems ideal; softening conditions could find him out.

quotes.race: Junction 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Spinning Web has been woken up by hurdles and he adapted quickly at home. Hopefully that will make him brave enough to win over further on the Flat - Danny Mullins, rider.

runners.name: Hillsdale
runners.comment: Progressive 6yo and expect another positive ride; jumps well despite latest fall
runners.spotlight: Impressed in winning handicap chases at Naas (yielding) and Clonmel (yielding to soft) and had jumped well out in front before falling late on at Navan (2m7f), where he was headed but boxing on; expect another positive ride back at this distance.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Price Boosts All 28 Favourites At Cheltenham" Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Hillsdale is a quirky horse but Keith (Donoghue) did a great job. He battled today and he's a big horse who'll go chasing next season. The owner, Brian Pierce, is a great supporter of ours - Philip Dempsey, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Pronunciation
runners.comment: Her jumping was better when third of 11 in a 2m handicap at Gowran last time
runners.spotlight: Progressive when winning three hurdles on the spin last season; 0-5 as a chaser but her jumping was better when third of 11 in a 2m handicap at Gowran last time and she's on a nice racing weight.

quotes.race: Book Your Advanced Tickets Now Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Miss Pronunciation is starting to settle a lot better and that's bringing out the improvement in her. She loves that ground, her mother Adarma did too - Padraig Roche, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Play "Instant Spins" Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Miss Pronunciation came on a bit from Limerick and she is turning into a grand mare. She had a couple of setbacks early on and I would think it did her no harm. Hopefully she can keep progressing - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.name: Listentillitellyea
runners.comment: Twice third over fences this season but no easy task in this competitive handicap
runners.spotlight: Modest strike-rate over hurdles but has chases in him after twice finishing third this season; however, this is a tough race in which to get off the mark.

3:00.race_name: Sherry Fitzgerald Sherry Rated Novice Chase

runners.name: Ballysax Hank
runners.comment: Bumper winner and 2nd in two maiden hdls; off the mark over fences last time; a player
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner and 2nd in two maiden hurdles last year for former yard; got off the mark over fences last time at Downpatrick over a similar trip to this; looks a player; one of three runners for yard.

runners.name: Lightkeeper
runners.comment: Won Down Royal novice and Wexford handicap lately; has to be respected
runners.spotlight: A 114-rated hurdler but is already a better chaser; won a Down Royal novice and Wexford handicap lately over similar trips to this; has to be respected even off topweight.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden hurdle at Galway quite emphatically, but never went a yard at Tramore. He's better than that and hopefully we'll get him back on track soon. 28-10-24

runners.name: Linden Arden
runners.comment: Hurdle winner has won both starts over fences incl' a Limerick h'cap on comeback; chance
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner has won both starts over fences including a Limerick handicap on comeback/yard debut over a similar trip to this; raised 9lb for that but has a chance with more to come.

quotes.race: Corrib Oil Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Linden Arden flicked off the ground and hopefully he can keep progressing. We knew we had a good jumper on our hands and he was so good today - Brian Hayes, rider.

runners.name: Gaelic Arc
runners.owner: Mark R D Fleming / T Westropp Bennett
runners.comment: Grade 3-placed over fences but not at his best last three starts; experienced type though
runners.spotlight: Grade 3-placed over fences but a record of only 1-15; not at his best last three starts; an experienced type though and would have a chance if back to form.

quotes.race: Ballygowan Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gaelic Arc is a funny horse, difficult to train, and a horse you wouldn't have a punt on. He's going to be a lovely horse over a fence. The ground today probably suited him and was the key today. Niall Prendergast gave him a cracking ride and he'll go over fences now - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Gaelic Arc is a gorgeous horse. He goes on soft ground so we'll probably go for a winners bumper - John Ryan, trainer

runners.name: Broomfield Bijou
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner has won over fences and 2nd in a Grade 2; below form in a h'cap since
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner has won over fences and was second in a Grade 2 mares novice in January; was below form in a handicap since but could run well if back to her best.

quotes.race: Specialist Group Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Broomfield Bijou had been running in decent company. She's a well-bred mare and she is one to look forward to. She will get further and likes nice ground - Philip Dempsey, trainer.

runners.name: Backmersackme
runners.comment: Maiden over hurdles but several good runs; well beaten on chasing debut but can improve
runners.spotlight: Maiden over hurdles but several good runs, notably when just denied in a valuable Navan handicap over 3m1f; not as good since and well beaten on chasing debut but can improve.

runners.name: Antrim Coast
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner but way below that level in 3 chase runs; capable of better up in trip
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner has won at 3m; has been way below that level in three chase runs over about 2m; however, is surely capable of better up in trip and is respected; looks the pick of his yard's three runners.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden hurdle well at Punchestown before a good third back at that track in the spring and won over three miles at Wexford in May, but he had a setback after that. He's back cantering now but you won't see him until after Christmas. 12-11-24

He won his maiden hurdle well at Punchestown before a good third back there in the spring and won over three miles at Wexford in May, but he had a setback after that. He's back cantering now but you won't see him until after Christmas. 13-11-24

runners.name: Dutch Schultz
runners.comment: Two chase wins but below form last few starts; has to return to his best
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; two chase wins up to this trip including off this rating but has been below form last few starts; has to return to his best.

runners.name: Kudasheva
runners.comment: Beginners' chase winner last summer and decent h'cap run next time; back after a break
runners.spotlight: Point winner didn't score over hurdles but was a beginners' chase winner last summer and a decent handicap run next time; needs to be ready back after a break.

stable_tour.quote: She was a shade disappointing at Navan on Saturday and I was hoping she might run a bit better than she did. We'll try to find something similar for her next. 20-11-23

runners.name: Buachaillbocht
runners.comment: Three wins over hurdles last term; jumping issues over fences and way below that level
runners.spotlight: Three wins over hurdles last term and is rated 122 in that sphere; has had jumping issues over fences and been way below that level; first-time blinkers need to work.

quotes.race: David Trundley Artist At Punchestown Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Buachaillbocht has won three, he's going the right way and might win another one - Ted Walsh, trainer.

quotes.race: Join The Punchestown Members Club Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Buachaillbocht was better today than at Tramore, that track might have been a bit tight for him. It was atrocious ground there too and he just didn't travel. He travelled well today and stayed it out well. He was entitled to do that, he is only six and he's improving - Ted Walsh, trainer

runners.name: Ballykinlar
runners.comment: Some promise in a bumper and two maiden hurdles but has to find plenty more
runners.spotlight: Maiden after five point starts; some promise in a bumper and two maiden hurdles but has to find plenty more.

runners.name: Bear Profit
runners.comment: Second in a 1m4f Curragh handicap recently; can run well if his jumping is sound
runners.spotlight: Four Flat wins under varying ground conditions; made a satisfactory seasonal debut when second in a 1m4f Curragh handicap recently; can run well on hurdling debut if his jumping is sound.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bear Profit just arrived there. Things didn't go right at Listowel when he raced too keen. He's not a bad horse and got a lovely ride - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

runners.name: Bokamsin
runners.breeder: M Jean Arthur Contou-Carrere & M Yves Broca
runners.comment: Beaten 29l in a Navan bumper on debut last month; needs to make plenty of progress
runners.spotlight: Weak in the market when beaten 29l in a Navan bumper on debut last month; needs to make plenty of progress on hurdling debut; one of two runners for yard.

runners.name: Enge Hazard
runners.comment: Beaten 35l in a Navan maiden hurdle on comeback last month; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner in Scandinavia ran a cracker on Irish/hurdling debut at Punchestown in 2023; then went missing until beaten 35l in a Navan maiden hurdle last month; best watched for now.

runners.name: Good Deal
runners.comment: Hood added and the drop to 2m should suit; solid chance if jumping better than debut
runners.spotlight: Course bumper winner in January disappointed in that sphere next time after doing too much in front; made some mistakes on hurdling debut over 2m4f at this track last time but still a fine effort; hood added and the drop to 2m should suit; solid chance if jumping better.

runners.name: Icare Daubrelle
runners.comment: Third at Cork but pulled-up next time; better at Navan since but needs more to take this
runners.spotlight: Debut bumper winner in 2022 has endured two lengthy absences since; third on hurdling debut at Cork but pulled-up next time; better at Navan since but needs more to take this; hood added.

quotes.race: Jordan's Centra Supporting Kill GAA (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Icare D'Aubrelle has a great constitution for work, he has a great body and you can throw anything at him and it doesn't matter to him. He's not a horse that needs time, he's just a racehorse and I'm lucky to have him - Tom Cooper, trainer.

runners.name: Kaligo
runners.comment: Badly hampered last time so a better run than it appears; others still preferred
runners.spotlight: Two maiden hurdle starts; beaten a long way on debut but was badly hampered last time so a better run than it appears; others still preferred.

runners.name: Millrace
runners.comment: Local yard does well at this track so this debutant needs a market check; tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam well held in bumpers, half-sister to bumper/2m hurdle winner Dixie Lee, out of French 8.5f Flat and useful 2m2f hurdle winner; local yard does well at this track so this debutant needs a market check; tongue-tie.

runners.name: Net Boy
runners.breeder: Mme Clarence Signol & M Xavier Brelaud
runners.comment: Running well when unseating on hurdling debut before a lesser run at Naas; needs more
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in bumpers without winning; looked like getting into the places when unseating at Leopardstown on hurdling debut before a lesser run at Naas; needs more.

runners.name: Road To Ninety
runners.comment: By a decent sire and related to plenty of winners so worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; brother to useful 2m/2m1f hurdle chase winner Due Reward, half-brother to winners Katie T (bumper, 1m3f/1m4f Flat and useful 2m hurdle) and Pied Du Roi (2m hurdle/2m5f chase); by a decent sire and related to plenty of winners so worth a market check.

runners.name: Son Of Anarchy
runners.comment: Rated 118 so has a solid chance in what isn't the strongest of maiden hurdles
runners.spotlight: Point winner has run well on two of his three hurdle starts from 2m-2m5f on soft ground; rated 118 so has a solid chance in what isn't the strongest of maiden hurdles.

stable_tour.quote: It was hard not to be impressed with the way he won his point. He's a big, imposing horse, so we have given him plenty of time. We haven't rushed him. We're going to go straight over hurdles with him and he'll be ready to start off in a maiden hurdle in a couple of weeks; we just want some rain for him. I would say two and a half miles might be his trip. Everything we ask him to do, he does very easily, so he's one we're looking forward to. 28-10-24

runners.name: Tsavo Park
runners.comment: Ran to a similar level in two maiden hurdles and has to find improvement
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability in four point starts without winning; a similar level in two maiden hurdles and has to find improvement.

runners.name: Classy Cc
runners.comment: Promise on hurdling debut but way below that level at Naas since and has to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Some promise in a bumper on debut last year and made a promising hurdling debut at Naas in December; way below that level at Naas since and has to bounce back.

runners.name: Emily Love
runners.comment: Solid runs in two bumpers; needs to find improvement to score on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Point winner has run respectably in defeat in two bumpers lately at Limerick over 2m and 2m4f; needs to find improvement to score on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Encosta
runners.comment: Flat winner; yard has been in good form lately and could run well on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Dual winner on the Flat stays 1m4f in that sphere but was below her best on recent comeback over a mile; yard has been in good form lately and could run well on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Hey Babbs
runners.comment: Well beaten in two bumpers and can't be fancied on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; well beaten in two bumpers and can't be fancied on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Menas Miracle
runners.comment: A bit better at Tramore last time; way more needed today
runners.spotlight: Point winner was poor in a bumper and on hurdling debut but a bit better at Tramore last week; way more needed today.

runners.name: Mystic Milly
runners.comment: Tailed-off in a Tramore maiden hurdle on recent debut and passed over today
runners.spotlight: Tailed-off in a Tramore maiden hurdle on recent debut and passed over today.

runners.name: Nita
runners.comment: Three-time Flat winner in Germany and makes hurdling debut after an absence
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; three-time Flat winner in Germany and makes hurdling debut after an absence; could run well if jumping soundly.

runners.name: Not Even Maybe
runners.comment: Lowly-rated Flat maiden has been placed up to 1m1f; best watched on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Lowly-rated Flat maiden has been placed up to 1m1f; best watched on hurdling debut for a new yard.

runners.name: Rizedda
runners.comment: Pulled-up on sole point start last autumn but can surely do better; market may reveal more
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; pulled-up on sole point start for Colin Bowe last autumn but this well-bred mare cost 80,000euros as a 3yo and can surely do better; the market may reveal more.

runners.name: Walk On Annilog
runners.comment: A decent effort on hurdling debut at Naas recently but plenty more needed
runners.spotlight: Promise in bumpers but became regressive; a better effort on hurdling debut at Naas recently but plenty more needed.

runners.name: Jessies Dreamgirl
runners.comment: Not much to show for three AW maiden runs and can't be fancied on hurdling debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; not much to show for three AW maiden runs and can't be fancied on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Back To Cali
runners.comment: Just a hint of ability in four point starts; can't be fancied on hurdling debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; just a hint of ability in four point starts and can't be fancied on hurdling debut.

runners.name: Lisscarney
runners.comment: Well beaten in a Sligo bumper in 2022 and best watched on return; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; well beaten in a Sligo bumper in 2022 and best watched on return.

4:45.race_name: Paddy Kehoe Suspended Ceilings Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Individualiste
runners.breeder: S A R L European Bloodstock Management

prev_owners.owner: Marcel Gadbin, L Gadbin & Mme Annie Cabanis

runners.comment: In winning form over fences this winter and he's rated 11lb lower in this discipline
runners.spotlight: Out of the handicap and 100-1 when pulled up over fences at the Cheltenham Festival; two wins over fences during the winter and he's rated 11lb lower in this discipline; could go well.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: If anything Individualiste probably travelled a little too easily. I thought he got left there [in front] a little bit soon and he probably idled a little bit but when Charlie [O'Dwyer, rider of the runner-up] came to me I always felt like I was holding him. His confidence seems to be getting up and hopefully he can keep improving - Keith Donoghue, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He'd been off the track for over 18 months before reappearing at Newton Abbot last month and understandably got a bit tired after travelling well for a long way. He's sure to come on for that and is up to winning handicap hurdles round the smaller tracks. 05-11-23

runners.name: A Mere Bagatelle

prev_owners.owner: D F O'Rourke & Ms Diane O'Rourke

runners.comment: Made all at Downpatrick but hit very hard by the handicapper for that and looks vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Has bounced back well from two falls and was never headed in a Downpatrick handicap hurdle three weeks ago (2m2f, good; fine on softer); hit very hard by the handicapper for that and looks vulnerable.

quotes.race: Oyster Tavern Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: A Mere Bagatelle won nicely, jumped well apart from a few minor mistakes and I tried to keep it simple. Once I got to the front I wasn't going to take him back on a sharp track like this - Shane Fenelon, rider.

quotes.race: Entegro Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: A Mere Bagatelle jumped brilliant. I have no plans but we'll see what happens, I have the Galway Blazers in the back of my mind because he will gallop all day - John Joseph Hanlon, trainer.

runners.name: Battle Of Ridgeway
runners.comment: 10lb higher than for his clearcut Gowran win; was back over fences last time
runners.spotlight: Back over fences last time and had previously won a big-field Gowran handicap hurdle by some 9l; however, that was off 10lb lower and this is a harder assignment.

quotes.race: HPR Fleet Management Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Battle Of Ridgeway looked the winner here the last day coming to the second-last the last day over fences. He just didn't get home after running with the choke out but he was way more relaxed today stepping back in trip. He's a real chaser but was always a moral to win a race over hurdles off his (12lb lower) mark. The boys wanted a runner today and it was the only suitable race so it's pot luck he's run over hurdles. We'll probably go back over fences as he's a natural chaser - Martin Hassett, trainer.

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Battle Of Ridgeway surprised me. I thought he would need the run. We've always liked him. He'll go back over hurdles. he#s well handicapped over hurdles - Martin Hassett, trainer

quotes.race: Camida The Source Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Battle Of Ridgeway has just been immature. It's hard to do it first time in a handicap and maybe he is going to be the horse we thought he was - Martin Hassett, trainer

runners.name: Lady Bluebird
runners.comment: Won a maiden 12 months ago but no worthwhile form in the meantime
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden 12 months ago but no worthwhile form in the meantime; hard to trust in a first-time tongue-tie.

runners.name: Magic Day
runners.comment: Second in a Wexford maiden and the winner wasn't disgraced at Cheltenham on Thursday
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante from a top yard and probably her best run yet when second in a Wexford maiden a month ago (2m, good to yielding); the winner wasn't disgraced at Cheltenham on Thursday.

runners.name: Goodie Girl
runners.comment: Looking good to go in again when taking a heavy late fall at Leopardstown the final time
runners.spotlight: Dual winner and was looking good to go in again when taking a heavy late fall at Leopardstown the final time (2m4f, yielding); that was her second tumble on the trot but every chance provided her confidence hasn't been knocked.

quotes.race: Protection & Prosperity Financial Services Supporting Louth GAA Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was straightforward from Goodie Girl. I brought her here on Monday but brought her home as I thought the ground was a bit too quick for her. I walked the track the morning and I was happy with it. Patrick said that she travelled well, jumped well. She was a nice mare last year and hopefully she'll come on from the run - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Try Racing TV For Free Now At racingtv.com/freetrial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Goodie Girl is progressive. She was tough and finished out the race well. She should improve. She's tough and hardy and I like her - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

runners.name: Reflectionist
runners.comment: Dual winner in 2023 but hasn't been in the same form since returning from an absence
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back handicap hurdles in May 2023; hasn't been in the same form since returning from an absence; 25-1 when falling mid-race last time.
