quotes.race: Regeneron Ireland Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: I travelled better than I did at Punchestown, it's good ground. Reflectionist has loved the ground, he's won a bit more impressively today because of it - Sean Flanagan, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Drop The Anchor
runners.comment: Exposed 11yo who runs well now and again but he's never the percentage play
runners.spotlight: Exposed 11yo who runs well now and again but he's never the percentage play; no closer than 12l in three races since visored.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Hurdle (Extended Handicap Hurdle) (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Drop The Anchor didn't wing all the hurdles so he had to be tough and he needs a test at the end of the race. He's not a big horse but really tough and he needed time. He's got it now - Pat Fahy, trainer

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "Where The Nation Plays" Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: It's a great pot to win and he won his bumper here on similar ground two years ago. The non-runners were a big help and he's done it well, I'm very happy with him. It was his first run back, but funnily enough, he can run well after a break. Simon [Torrens] claiming 5lb from a low weight was great. That was his first ride for me and I'm delighted. I'll look for something similar, although he could go up in trip if the ground isn't as soft next time. We'll speak with the owner and see - Pat Fahy, trainer of Drop The Anchor

quotes.race: Irish Daily Mirror Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's great to get him to win, he was a bit disappointing last year at different times. He jumped well today, I'm delighted with him because he was sticky at Galway. He went down to the first and jammed on last time over those Easyfix hurdles, which can happen sometimes. At Listowel he was very big at a few of them too and in a handicap you can't afford that. Pat Fahy, trainer of Drop The Anchor.

runners.name: Gordons Aura
runners.comment: Joined this yard out of a claimer and was well held in a Gowran handicap
runners.spotlight: Became frustrating for Gordon Elliott after winning a maiden; joined this yard out of a claimer and was well held in a Gowran handicap in October; off since.

quotes.race: Bulmers Bundle For Easter Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Gordons Aura took a bit of a look in front but once he was joined he put his head down and battled. It wasn't easy but it worked out well - Jordan Gainford, rider.

runners.name: St Deniss Well
runners.comment: Won his final hurdle race; 11lb higher now, though still 16lb beneath chase figure
runners.spotlight: Chasing in his last three races and did win his last hurdle start at Down Royal in December (2m1f, good to yielding; first-time blinkers), exploiting a much lower mark in this scene; 11lb higher now, though still 16lb beneath chase figure.

quotes.race: Follow On Instagram @bluegrasshorsefeed Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: St Denis's Well had a bad run the last day in Leopardstown, but it didn't suit as they hacked and he just stays all day. He's not ground dependent, he was just too weak to handle the soft. He has strengthened up now and he can handle it. Good horses will go on any ground - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

quotes.race: Gormanlough Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: St Denis's Well made one little mistake and Jack said it was his own fault as he should have kept going forward on him. He did it easy and he might run under a penalty on Tuesday at Down Royal - Ian Donoghue, trainer.

runners.name: Imadpour
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C

prev_owners.owner: Denis O'Mahony & Daibheid McHugh & Desmond J Kelly

runners.comment: Bellewstown winner last week; now 9lb higher but has the wind in his sails
runners.spotlight: Won as a 2yo on the Flat (heavy); now getting it together over hurdles and he comfortably saw off six rivals at Bellewstown last week (2m1f, good); 9lb higher for this trickier assignment but has the wind in his sails.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Gleneagles Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Imadpour did that well. He handled the ground well but probably got there a bit soon. He will improve with time - Ronan Whelan, rider

runners.name: Its Not Over Yet
runners.comment: Might be on a harsh mark but with rain forecast better is expected this afternoon
runners.spotlight: Below her best the last twice but had won her previous two races and the forecast rain is in her favour; might be on a harsh mark but better expected this afternoon.

runners.name: Money Heist
runners.comment: Given too much to do when 6-4 for a 3m handicap at Leopardstown the last time
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler who won twice over fences last season; sent off 6-4 favourite for a Leopardstown handicap hurdle last time and was given a bit too much to do; was only beaten 5l and this could be more his trip; respected.

quotes.race: Jossestown Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Money Heist has loads of scope and when I needed good jumps at the last two he came up for me. He travelled a lot easier here and at Naas. If the handicapper isn't too hard on him he could go in again - Keith Donoghue, rider.

quotes.race: Sign Up To GavinLynchRacing.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Money Heist jumped everywhere apart from the last. He loves that ground. He travelled very well in the cheekpieces and he will stay further - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Galway Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It didn't look the strongest of races and it's nice to get Money Heist's head in front. He's in again at Downpatrick on Friday (in a 2m5.5f handicap hurdle) so he may go there - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He won a handicap at Galway and got 10lb for it. He wasn't able to back up that win a few days later at Downpatrick but it may just have come too quickly. We'll freshen him up and I think he can be still be competitive off his revised mark. 27-10-22

runners.name: Quornofamonday
runners.comment: Won a 2m5f handicap chase in February off 1lb lower and has comparable hurdle form
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m5f handicap chase in February off 1lb lower and was found to be lame after pulling up a month ago; has comparable form over hurdles and he's not dismissed.

runners.name: Washington Parks
runners.comment: The market suggested that better was expected on his recent handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Maiden runs weren't devoid of promise and the market suggested that better was expected on his recent handicap debut; could be an improver.

runners.name: Aurea Fortuna
runners.comment: An 11-race maiden but has some competitive form in handicaps; may need good ground
runners.spotlight: An 11-race maiden but has some competitive form in handicaps and ran as though his latest race after a break would bring him on (first-time tongue-tie); seems to like goodish ground so the recent rain rather dampens enthusiasm.

runners.name: Butty O Brien
runners.comment: Dual handicap winner but difficult to know what to expect after 434 days away
runners.spotlight: Progressive handicapper last season and should be on a fair mark; however, difficult to know what to expect after 434 days away.

quotes.race: Ardmulchan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were very happy coming here today. Eoin knows her so well, he's been schooling her for years and gets her jumping. Butty O Brien was able to dictate and I thought she was impressive. There's a meeting here in about three weeks which we might come back for - Pat Magee, trainer.

quotes.race: Buy Your Navan 2024 Membership Now Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Butty O Brien was very game but she got a class ride from Eoin. She has had little niggly problems but it's great to get off the mark with her today - Pat Magee, trainer

runners.name: Queen Nel
runners.comment: Hasn't been running badly in handicaps but she's not ahead of her mark
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner for a different yard; hasn't been running badly in handicaps but she's not ahead of her mark.

quotes.race: Best Of Luck To The Irish At Cheltenham Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's a nice surprise. Queen Nel is not the quickest but in that ground she didn't need to be and she kept galloping. She's a home-bred so it's great. On better ground I'd say she'll go up in trip -  Ray Cody, trainer.

runners.name: Joya Del Mar
runners.owner: Mrs T Giles-Fahey & Miss S Mangan

prev_owners.owner: Miss S Mangan & Mrs T Giles-Fahey

runners.comment: Now 0-15 under rules but has hinted at winning potential and a good run last time
runners.spotlight: Now 0-15 under rules but has hinted at winning potential and kept finding to make the frame at Downpatrick (2m6f, good); each-way claims.

runners.name: Leahs Contessa
runners.comment: Lightly raced maiden winner; patiently ridden when an 18l sixth over C&D two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden winner; patiently ridden when an 18l sixth over C&D two weeks ago when just behind Aurea Fortuna; another who could raise her game.

runners.name: Pirate Island

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late M J Daly

runners.comment: Looked promising in his maidens but hasn't kicked on at all
runners.spotlight: Looked promising in his maidens but hasn't kicked on at all and pretty much tailed off the last twice.

runners.name: Aussie Warrior
runners.comment: Has lost his way since going close in two handicaps last summer and he lacks a recent run
runners.spotlight: Has lost his way since going close in two handicaps last summer and he lacks a recent run.

runners.name: Kinbara Hills
runners.comment: Off since Christmas when falling early in a Down Royal handicap; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; still a maiden and off since Christmas when falling early in a Down Royal handicap; still early days in handicaps but has to step up.

runners.name: Catchabird
runners.comment: Has run three good races for this yard, the latest her handicap debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; has run three good races for this yard, the latest her handicap debut; new trip but has races in her off this mark.

runners.name: Sprinkles
runners.comment: Limited on the Flat; some promise over hurdles and now makes handicap debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; limited on the Flat; some promise over hurdles and now makes handicap debut.

1:12.race_name: Dermot Casey Tree Care Maiden Hurdle
1:12.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING (Yielding to soft in places) Hurdle course - SOFT (Yielding to soft in places)

runners.name: Catch Fire
runners.comment: No show before fell on hurdles bow early this month; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars gelding a 1m4f winner on good ground for Francis-Henri Graffard last August; in rear until fell two out on hurdles debut at Limerick early this month, best watched for now.

runners.name: Costa Lou Rosetgri
runners.comment: Half-brother to French 11.5f winner Costalina Rosetgri; hooded for debut.
runners.spotlight: Cost 12,000Euros as a 3yo; third foal; half-brother to French 11.5f winner Costalina Rosetgri; dam runner-up 1m2f in France; hooded for debut.

runners.name: Eternal Echo
runners.comment: Decent level of form in bumpers of late, likely major player now sent hurdling
runners.spotlight: Decent level of form in bumpers, winning on debut at Naas and better effort in defeat when placed at both Leopardstown and Limerick; should make his mark hurdling and could be the one to beat in this ordinary maiden.

quotes.race: Christopher Dunne Memorial (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Eternal Echo is a nice horse and has shown a bit of pace at home. To give the filly a stone was a good performance. He could definitely win on the Flat - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.name: Hillstar Blues
runners.comment: Bumper form doesn't make him an obvious player but has some ability
runners.spotlight: Some debut promise in Punchestown bumper in February but took a backward step at Thurles following month; out of half-sister to very smart hurdler Shadow Leader so could well improve for switch to hurdles.

runners.name: Jacko Star
runners.comment: Encouraging Navan debut; likely improver, especially if settling better
runners.spotlight: Dam Jacksonslady won eight races for this stable and was third in the Galway Plate; promising hurdles debut in decent Navan 4yo maiden last month, despite running keen when fourth (third has won since); all the better for that, especially if settling better.

runners.name: Kool Runnings
runners.comment: Half-brother to 2m-2m5f hurdle winner Ballygeary; market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Vadamos gelding fetched 11,000Euros as both a foal and a 3yo; half-brother to 2m-2m5f hurdle winner Ballygeary; dam unraced half-sister to smart 2m/2m2f hurdle winner Blue Shark, out of half-sister to high-class staying jumper Sweet Duke; rare runner for the yard, market best guide.

runners.name: Living On Dreams
runners.comment: Short prices but ordinary form in two point-to-point runs last month
runners.spotlight: Cost 21,000Euros as a yearling and 18,000Euros as a 3yo; brother to 2m hurdle winner Kingdom Calling, half-brother to French winners Griviere (2m4f chase) and Jobartim (2m1f hurdle); dam placed in French 2m2f/2m3f chases; short prices but ordinary form in two point-to-point runs last month.

runners.name: Lord Talbot
runners.owner: Elaine Shevlin & David Boylan & Ms Denise Mccourt
runners.comment: Modest AW winner; doesn't look an obvious one to make an immediate impact hurdling
runners.spotlight: Modest on Flat, winning 1m2f Dundalk handicap in November but well held since; doesn't look an obvious one to make an immediate impact hurdling.

runners.name: Meteor Storm
runners.comment: Fair Flat maiden but nothing yet hurdling; tried tongue-tied
runners.spotlight: Earned a rating of 68 after three AW maiden runs for Ger Lyons; has struggled in three runs over hurdles; tongue-tie tried.

runners.name: Pourquoi Poi
runners.comment: Huge price and tailed-off on recent debut; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Huge price and tailed-off on recent debut; look elsewhere.

runners.name: Screaming Eagle
runners.comment: 73-rated Flat maiden for Andrew Balding; 42,000gns buy, watching brief for hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: 73-rated Flat maiden; best form was for Andrew Balding when placed on AW; 42,000gns buy last autumn and watching brief advised on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Struck Oil
runners.comment: Nicely-bred newcomer from respected yard
runners.spotlight: Poet's Word gelding cost 29,000Euros as a 3yo; fourth foal; dam bumper winner, half-sister to smart bumper and 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase winner Highway One O One, from family of Champion Hurdle winners Morley Street and Granville Again; top yard, has to be respected on debut.

runners.name: Three County Star
runners.owner: John P Coleman & M J Caffrey
runners.comment: Newcomer likely best watched
runners.spotlight: Shirocco gelding cost 12,500Euros as a foal; third foal; dam 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to bumper winner Love The Melody; newcomer likely best watched.

runners.name: Woodview Lad
runners.comment: Top yard have a more obvious contender in Eternal Echo
runners.spotlight: Mahler gelding cost 5,500Euros as a foal and 24,000Euros as a 3yo; brother to winners Dawn Sunrise (2m3f chase) and Dawn Raider (2m4f-2m6f hurdle/chase); dam unseated rider both starts in points, half-sister to bumper/2m hurdle winner Attack At Dawn; top yard have a more obvious contender in Eternal Echo.

runners.name: Yosemite Gold
runners.comment: 74-rated Flat maiden; no show on both hurdle runs at Limerick; new headgear combination
runners.spotlight: 74-rated Flat maiden in Britain for William Haggas; no show on both hurdle outings at Limerick, keen on first occasion; new headgear combination tried.

runners.name: Dark Oak
runners.comment: Recent Limerick third rates a major player on that form
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m4f maiden at Galway last September (rated 80); took a nice step forward on second attempt hurdling when a clear third at Limerick last month behind two market principals; definitely one to consider.

quotes.race: Sean Cleary Memorial Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Dark Oak has won a maiden now. We might go for a Flat handicap and then hurdling. She is very big and will be better in another year - Joe Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Tassarolo
runners.comment: Ordinary on the Flat (rated 64 on AW); likely best watched on hurdles debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; ordinary enough on the Flat (rated 64 on AW); likely best watched on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Lets Go Mans
runners.breeder: M Gerard Antone Delorme, Mme Valerie Elisabete Fuzy & Mme Le
runners.comment: No show on recent Naas debut, likely to need more time; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; half-brother to Willie Mullins-trained winning hurdlers Coquin Mans and Egality Mans; behind throughout on Naas debut early this month when a 33-1 shot; likely to need more time.

runners.name: Temple City
runners.comment: Fair Flat maiden in Britain; too keen on yard debut at Dundalk; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 76-rated Flat maiden in Britain for Karl Burke; too keen and paid the price on yard debut at Dundalk in January; switched to hurdles and can only be watched.

1:42.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING (Yielding to soft in places) Hurdle course - SOFT (Yielding to soft in places)

runners.name: Intellotto
runners.comment: First hurdles run in over a year and hasn't run since last August; may need this
runners.spotlight: 5yo is 2-4 hurdling, last run in this code when fourth behind Sir Gino in Grade 1 juvenile hurdle at Aintree a year ago; kept busy on the Flat last summer, winning Sligo maiden and good fourth in Curragh handicap best efforts; absent since August and may just need this.

quotes.race: Hazel Wood Maiden
quotes.quote: It was fairly plain sailing for Intellotto today. I just let him bowl away and he stayed at it good. He was only just doing what he needed to. He did roll around a little bit up the straight but, kept up to his work, he stuck his head out and got through the line well - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey.

quotes.race: Panoramic Restaurant At Limerick Racecourse Hurdle
quotes.quote: Intellotto has been well placed by Joseph and this was a nice opportunity. He is a progressive horse and on better ground he could do well at the spring festivals - Daryl Jacob, rider.

quotes.race: Paddy Power I Have No Idea What Day It Is 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Intellotto had a lovely run at Cork earlier in the year then had a setback, he missed the summer which was probably a blessing in disguise in hindsight. Simon (Munir) and Isaac (Souede) were happy to wait with him and come here, I thought it was a very nice debut and Daryl (Jacob) said he was pleased with him, he learned on the job but finished off the race strong. The logical move would be to come back here for the Dublin Racing Festival - Joseph O'Brien, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He'll start off in a juvenile hurdle next month and we'll take it from there. His form on the Flat looks nice and he's a fine, big horse. So far his schooling has gone well. 27-11-23

runners.name: Way Down South
runners.comment: Limerick maiden winner looks out of his depth here
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner off the mark hurdling in 2m3f Limerick maiden at Christmas but pulled up in Fairyhouse handicap when last seen in February; appears out of his depth here.

quotes.race: Cuchulainn Maiden Hurdle (In Memory Of Andrew McNamara)
quotes.quote: Way Down South can be quite hard on himself, so we said we'd jump him out in front and see how we get on. I'm delighted it worked out and he is a nice horse for the future - Gillian Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Dragon Of Malta
runners.comment: Fair Flat handicapper, handles all sorts of ground; very big ask on belated hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat handicapper, five turf wins on all sorts of ground; very big ask here on belated hurdles debut.

quotes.race: Ardilaun Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Dragon Of Malta's form is very solid and there were a lot of ducks in a row today. It is hard to get him early in the year but he comes to form in the autumn and that's just him - Pat O'Donnell, trainer

quotes.race: Galway Handicap
quotes.quote: Dragon Of Malta is a strange horse who comes to form at this time of the year. You would associate that mostly with fillies but he definitely was under the weather and lethargic early in the season. He is fairly buzzing now - Pat O'Donnell, trainer.

runners.name: Fils Doudairies
runners.comment: Former Grade 3 winner; regressive but could still hold his own in this company
runners.spotlight: 10yo who won two Grade 3s at Tipperary in 2023; returned from year's absence at Christmas and well below his best in five outings, some admittedly stiff tasks; bit more spark when beaten under 9l in County Hurdle last time; regressive but could still hold his own in this company and well treated by the race conditions.

quotes.race: Kevin McManus Bookmaker Grimes Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: He just beat Cash Back at Ballinrobe so Fils D'oudairies has come forward from that, hopefully he'll keep going. I was waiting for Sharjah the whole way up the straight but to be fair he galloped all the way to the line. He jumps and travels so I'd say he would be entitled to take his chance at Galway - Jack Kennedy, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Fils D'Oudairies gave a nice performance there and got a beautiful ride from Donagh. He was too keen last time and took a tired fall, Joseph was keen for to drop him in here and it worked well. He loves that ground and is a horse with a big future if everything goes right - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's won plenty of races and he's got plenty of options too. He looks a lot better handicapped over fences than he is over hurdles, given he has a chase mark of 137, so that might be an avenue we'll try to explore at some stage. 28-10-24

runners.name: Jigoro
runners.comment: Poor strike rate but runs well in these types of events so don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Hasn't added to Navan maiden win of 16 months ago but some fair efforts in small-runner conditions hurdles; tame handicap effort last time in January though; bit to prove.

quotes.race: Mervyn Gray Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a good performance from Jigoro and we knew he had improved plenty from the first day. Obviously there was a lot of talk about Tom Cooper's horse and I thought it was a good performance. Jack was delighted with him and said he'll stay further. He said a faster gallop would have suited him but he was very happy with the run. He could go for the four-year-old hurdle at Limerick over Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His form tailed off a bit in the spring, but he had put up some decent performances before that. He's going novice chasing and could be a dark horse . He's better than you've seen so far. 28-10-24

runners.name: King Of Kingsfield
runners.comment: Graded form; back from pacemaking duties with a big chance running on his own merits
runners.spotlight: Sole hurdles win came in Leopardstown maiden late 2023 but has run to a smart level of form in Graded company on several occasions; employed as a pacemaker in recent starts but running on his own merits here and big player.

quotes.race: Thorntons Recycling Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were riding King Of Kingsfield all wrong and the last day we changed our minds. He's been disappointing up until now as I always thought he was a proper horse but he might just come good now. The ground is key to him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Royal Bond Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Jordan (Gainford)was kicking himself and said he got there too soon. King Of Kingsfield will be a short price in a maiden hurdle the next time! - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: King Of Kingsfield is a good horse and will be a lovely horse with a summer's grass - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's always worked like a proper horse. He's going novice chasing and there could be a big pot in him at some stage. He's got bundles of ability and he jumped great when he won his point at Portrush a few years ago. 28-10-24 If we decide to go for the Champion Hurdle with Brighterdaysahead then he'll join her in that. 15-2-25

runners.name: Smooth Tom
runners.comment: Lincoln third should have set him up nicely for this; bit to find but could go well
runners.spotlight: Very useful dual-purpose performer; won first two attempts hurdling in 2023, has come up short in Graded company; fine comeback third of 27 in Irish Lincoln last month, however, and that should have set hm up nicely for this; no surprise if he played a role.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were going steady early on so I had to go to the front and get him to settle, he jumps so well - Cian Quirke, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Amateur Riders Derby (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Smooth Tom is a very versatile horse and I would say he'll stay further. I forgot to enter him in the Irish Cesarewitch and I think it would have suited him. We'll probably go for the Grade 3 hurdle at Down Royal a week on Friday. He likes small fields and he can pick up some more prize-money - Andy Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: Nua Healthcare Irish Lincolnshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Smooth Tom's main aim is the Galway Hurdle and we might go to Punchestown before then, probably for one of the handicap hurdles - Andrew Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Fishery Lane Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Smooth Tom is a nice horse. We were a bit worried about the ground. Andy was talking about giving him a rest, but we might take a look at Leopardstown over Christmas. He's going to have to step up now - Willie Slattery, assistant trainer.

2:12.race_name: O'Flynn Motors Mallow Mares Maiden Hurdle
2:12.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING (Yielding to soft in places) Hurdle course - SOFT (Yielding to soft in places)

runners.name: Cathryns Ruby
runners.comment: Encouraging debut run here last August never built on and reappears for new yard
runners.spotlight: Encouraging hurdles debut when remote third in 2m1f mares maiden here last August but well below that form both starts afterwards on softer ground, trained then by Ray Hackett; reappears from seven months absence for new yard.

runners.name: Colonia Victoria
runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran, Scea Bissons, Mr
runners.comment: Flat winner; eyecatching hurdles debut at Leopardstown last month; big player
runners.spotlight: Former German-trained mare; 1m2f winner in France; unplaced all eight runs in stakes races; encouraging hurdles debut when staying on fourth in decent 2m4f Leopardstown mares maiden last month (yielding); probably won't need to improve too much to play a leading role here.

runners.name: Divaboriva
runners.comment: Well-backed winning debut in Wexford bumper 11 months ago; interesting on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to winners Looksnowtlikebrian (useful 2m3f-3m2f hurdle/chase) and Rivabodiva (2m7f/3m hurdle); dam 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase winner; justified good market support on debut in 2m Wexford mares bumper (soft) 11 months ago, despite trouble in running; second has done her bit for the form and interesting now switched to hurdles (clearly runs well fresh); longer trip to suit.

runners.name: Former Flame
runners.comment: Chased home a clear winner over 2m2f at Clonmel last month; ground hardly ideal
runners.spotlight: Solid efforts in bumpers and came on nicely from hurdles debut effort to chase home a clear winner over 2m2f at Clonmel last month (good); seems to like a sound surface so won't want too much rain.

runners.name: Joshsue
runners.comment: Made little impact at Ballinrobe last July, tongue-tie fitted for return
runners.spotlight: Made little impact at Ballinrobe last July, tongue-tie fitted for return.

runners.name: Liscahane United
runners.comment: Weak bumper form and tailed off on both attempts hurdling; cheekpieces back on
runners.spotlight: Weak bumper form and tailed off on both attempts hurdling; cheekpieces back on.

runners.name: My Lady O
runners.comment: Newcomer probably best watched unless market suggests otherwise
runners.spotlight: Anodin mare is first foal of a maiden half-sister to French winners Miss Crissy (Group-placed 1m4f) and Eldacar (1m4f/1m7f); newcomer probably best watched unless market suggests otherwise.

runners.name: Nashville Notions
runners.comment: Needs to improve markedly on both previous hurdles attempts to feature here
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Find A Fortune; dam 2m hurdle/chase winner; modest in point-to-points and needs to improve markedly on both previous hurdles attempts to feature here.

runners.name: Nytol
runners.comment: Recent 3m Limerick efforts give her place claims at least
runners.spotlight: Placed in 2m5f Wexford mares maiden for Sam Curling two seasons back and having returned from best part of two year's absence, good effort on second run back when chasing home an all-the-way winner over 3m at Limerick last month; not quite at that level when fourth in similar contest since but place claims here.

runners.name: Our Lily Belle
runners.comment: Imperial Monarch mare likely best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Imperial Monarch mare is second foal of a once-raced pointer, herself a sister to bumper/2m1f-2m4f hurdle winner Rossdara, and half-sister to several jumps winners; likely best watched on debut.

runners.name: Shannon Bank
runners.comment: Bumper form appeals but tailed off on recent comeback run on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Creditable efforts all five bumper starts, sandwiched between a couple of decent types when runner-up at Down Royal last season the pick of the efforts; not without support but tailed off on hurdles debut last month after nearly a year's absence.

runners.name: Shell Be Kept
runners.comment: Limerick claiming hurdle second but ran no sort of race on yard debut in Wexford maiden
runners.spotlight: Nice bit of improvement to chase home a clear all-the-way winner in 2m5f Limerick claiming hurdle in January (heavy) on final start for Sean Allen; ran no sort of race, however, on yard debut in recent Wexford mares maiden on better ground.

runners.name: Silver Lafanta
runners.comment: Tailed off in bumper and similarly on last month's return in Navan mares maiden hurdle
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a bumper at Tipperary last July and similarly on last month's return in Navan mares maiden hurdle.

runners.name: Stylish Composer
runners.comment: Tailed off in Warwick bumper for Nicky Henderson and since changed yards
runners.spotlight: Closely related to point winner Cresthill and a half-sister to 2m3f/2m7f hurdle winner Corinto; dam unraced sister to useful 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase winner Bedlam Boy; tailed off (having forced pace) on only start for Nicky Henderson in Warwick bumper in February; first start for new yard.

runners.name: Time In A Bottle
runners.owner: Mrs T P Hyde/Mrs T Hyde/John O Roche
runners.comment: Bumper form on good ground makes her a player on hurdles debut; ground a concern
runners.spotlight: Some decent runs in bumpers, including second at Killarney last summer (good) and when last seen at Galway in October on similar ground; withdrawn once on soft ground so ground doesn't look ideal.

runners.name: Whatchukno
runners.comment: Tailed off twice in Limerick bumpers earlier in the season, can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Tailed off twice in Limerick bumpers earlier in the season, can only be watched now switched to hurdles.

runners.name: Loughrask Jet
runners.comment: Half-sister to Native Speaker; hooded for debut and market likely best guide
runners.spotlight: Jet Away 4yo cost 3,500Euros as a 3yo; half-sister to winners Native Speaker (2m4f chase/3m1f hurdle), Madera Mist (2m4f-3m4f chase) and Donny's Fortune (point); dam useful 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase winner; hooded for debut and market likely best guide.

runners.name: Teenage Kiss
runners.comment: Second in 4-finisher point last month for Derek O'Connor; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Homebred Walk In The Park filly is half-sister to winners Marshalled (useful 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Hands On (2m hurdle); dam maiden hurdler 2m-3m, closely related to winning hurdlers Off The Mark and The Living Beauty; favourite, no match for 9l winner on sole point-to-point at Ballycahane last month (4-finishers) for Derek O'Connor;  worth a market check now switched to hurdles.

2:47.race_name: Bar One Racing Easter Handicap Hurdle
2:47.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING (Yielding to soft in places) Hurdle course - SOFT (Yielding to soft in places)

runners.name: Pray Tell
runners.comment: Grade 3 novice winner here in December; out of depth latest but respected back in handicap
runners.spotlight: Much improved this season, winning handicaps at Kilbeggan and Listowel before career-best in winning 3m Grade 3 novice here in December (soft); never landed a blow upped to Grade 1 company at DRF but respected back in handicap company here, although trip on the short side.

quotes.race: Singletons Supervalu Stayers Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Pray Tell is a good horse and he has such a heart. He has been plagued with injuries but the last two years have been good. We have in him now since January and he could do with a few weeks on grass - Des Kenneally, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pray Tell had good form. I was worried about the trip, I dropped him back a lot, but I said I'd take a chance. He won well, he's a lovely horse. We might go for another hurdle, we'll see how he comes out of this - Des Kenneally, trainer.

runners.name: Goraibhmaithagat
runners.comment: Return to this trip to suit on handicap debut and potential remains
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner for Derek O'Connor last season; winning rules debut in 2m Navan maiden hurdle in December and chased home clear-cut winners both starts since when favourite in novice events, drop back to 2m at Naas on latest didn't really suit; back up in trip for handicap debut with potential for more.

runners.name: The Enabler
runners.comment: Well held in big handicaps since 2m4f maiden win; slight drop in trip to suit
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner scrambled home in 2m4f Leopardstown maiden hurdle at Christmas; well held twice since in valuable handicaps, latest in 2m5f Martin Pipe behind a stablemate; slight drop in trip to suit but more needed.

quotes.race: Grant Fit Out Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Enabler was good there today and just got a bit close to the last. I'm not sure what his trip is as he wasn't getting home over three miles and two miles looked too short, but he got the job done and that's all that matters for now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Future Champions INH Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The Enabler improved from his run at Punchestown, we have all the options for him and he looks very good. I wouldn't be thinking of going to Cheltenham with him. There's a winners' race at Naas in February and we might not do a lot more with him this season - Gordon Elliott, trainer

stable_tour.quote: I know he was beaten at a short price at Galway, but I wouldn't read too much into that as he needed the run to blow away the cobwebs. The winner never missed a beat and they pulled a long way clear of everything else. I expect him to leave that form well behind. 28-10-24

runners.name: Addragoole
runners.comment: Clonmel maiden win and narrow Wexford handicap defeat at 2m; steps up in trip
runners.spotlight: Several placings in maidens before 2m Clonmel win (soft); narrowly failed to follow up on better ground in 2m Wexford handicap and now steps up in trip; progressive.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go for the novice handicap hurdle over two miles at Leopardstown. He's been second five times but he's not ungenuine, he's just kept bumping into one. Hopefully, in a handicap now he's not badly treated. He's a big horse who should keep going in the right direction. 21-12-24

He's been a bit frustrating as he's been second five times now. He's still raw and green and mentally a baby, but he did things right at Gowran on Saturday, settling well, and is learning all the time. Hopefully he'll have his day sooner rather than later. 13-11-24

runners.name: The Big Doyen
runners.comment: Not as good a chaser this season; changed yards and reverts to hurdles off reduced mark
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper and hurdles winner for Peter Fahey but not as good a chaser this season; changed yards and reverts to hurdles off reduced mark.

quotes.race: Knockcroghery Flat Race
quotes.quote: The Big Doyen is a nice horse but one that wants an ease in the ground. We'll keep to bumpers for now but he's not one we will over-face and we'll give him a bit of time - Peter Fahey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a cracker at Cheltenham in the Grade 2. He has an entry in the Grade 1 Future Champions Novice Hurdle at Leopardstown over Christmas and he might go there before we head for some of the big handicaps in the spring. 27-11-23

H's been cantering away since winning at Punchestown and I wouldn't be against the idea of going straight to the Champion Bumper with him. There was a huge amount of interest in the horse after he won at Punchestown, but in fairness to the boys who own him they came back and said no amount of money will buy him. I wouldn't like to overface him before Cheltenham because h's thriving the whole time and I'd rather keep him plenty fresh than give him a hard race. H'll have a couple of racecourse gallops and that will leave him spot on for the Champion Bumper and you'd have to say h's a hugely exciting horse to have in the yard. 08-12-21

runners.name: Arctic Bresil
runners.comment: Disappointing of late in handicap chases; bit to prove now reverting to hurdles
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle win came here (2m1f) and most of racing since has been over fences, disappointing of late in handicaps; reverts to hurdles here with something to prove.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I don't think we need to rush and there is the Grade 2 Moscow Flyer Hurdle at Punchestown in the middle of January and that might be the race for Arctic Bresil. He has a lot of pace so we will stick to two miles - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We liked him a lot last season but he disappointed us in his last two runs. He goes over fences now and the aim is to get him out in a beginners' chase over the next few weeks. His schooling has been really good and hopefully fences will help him fulfil his potential. 20-11-23

He made a bright start to his career when beating the highly rated Mercurey at Cork in December, which didn't come as a surprise as he'd looked a nice prospect. On the back of that we sent him to Sandown for the Grade 1 Tolworth but he simply never turned up and Rachael [Blackmore] pulled him up before the second-last. It was a very disappointing effort and clearly not what he's capable of. The plan is to bring him back at the Fairyhouse festival. 01-03-23

runners.name: God Of Thunder

prev_owners.owner: C Munro, Mrs M Gander And Partner
C Munro, The Late R Gander and Partner
C Munro, K Ivory, R Gander & Partner

runners.comment: Recent Limerick maiden winner; longer trip and rain-softened ground may test his stamina
runners.spotlight: AW winner on the Flat in Britain has been a steady improver over hurdles of late, most recently appreciating better ground to win 2m1f Limerick maiden going away; longer trip and rain-softened ground may test his stamina here on handicap debut.

runners.name: Tonaghneave Well
runners.comment: Competitive in handicaps last autumn; 5yo back from a break with potential for more
runners.spotlight: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner on good ground; has done well in handicaps, narrowly beaten at Navan (2m) and only faded late on when third over 2m4f at Fairyhouse in November when cheekpieces tried; 5yo back from a break with potential for more and slightly shorter trip to suit.

quotes.race: Xenon Security Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tonaghneave Well had the experience. I dropped my stick going to the last and he was having a good look so thankfully I held on. He was being a little bit lairy but experience probably won it for him - Keith Donoghue, rider.

runners.name: Well Dressed
runners.comment: Fairyhouse winner for today's rider but subsequent Naas run raises questions
runners.spotlight: Promise in maiden hurdles last season and off the mark when bolting up in 2m Fairyhouse opportunity handicap in January on soft; disappointing favourite following month in similar Naas contest, reluctant to post and fading quite tamely; upped in trip here.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Well Dressed faded at Navan the last day, she didn't get home. We dropped her back to 2m and it looked a winnable opportunity. Cian rides out for us and has a nice pair of hands. She's not in at Leopardstown next week - Eddie Harty, joint-trainer.

runners.name: West Away
runners.comment: Sign of return to form at Limerick 10 days ago; drop in trip may not suit though
runners.spotlight: Won 2m4f handicap here last season in testing conditions and took his form to new heights last summer on good ground, runner-up at Punchestown handicap before going one better at Roscommon (2m5f); encouraging run on second start back when getting similar ground at Limerick 10 days ago, staying on late into fourth; drop in trip may not be in his favour here.

quotes.race: Midsummer's Day With The Stars On Sunday, 23rd June Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: West Away got a very good ride from Dylan and it was good to reward him. He has developed into a good horse. He had been running in good quality races for the grade so it was great to win one. He could go to Cartmel for a big pot - John McConnell, trainer.

runners.name: Zoffanien
runners.comment: Recent Navan comeback run very encouraging; likely major player off a nice mark
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdles winner at around 2m; very encouraging comeback run at Navan last month when staying on third behind a revitalised rival (won again since) over 2m4f (heavy); better ground to suit and likely major player off a nice mark.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Road To Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zoffanien has run into one or two but did it well today. He had to, if he's going to Cheltenham he would have to have done that well today. Hopefully he will get there in one piece - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.name: Artic Lane
runners.comment: Effectively brought down at first at Wexford, only second handicap so may still improve
runners.spotlight: Thurles maiden win came at 2m on good ground; tough ask in Grade 2 on soft ground when blinkers tried and most recently effectively brought down at first in Wexford novice; only second handicap run so may still improve.

runners.name: Sequoiaspirit
runners.comment: Not an obvious one dropped in trip but don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Back to his best to land 23-runner 2m6f Navan handicap hurdle (yielding) in November; failed to back that up twice since however, latest in similar Thurles contest last month, following a short break; not an obvious one dropped in trip but don't rule out.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Bet 10 Euros Get 50 Euros Sign Up Offer" Tara Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sequoiaspirit is a cracking little horse. I was a bit worried about the step up in trip with the ground going, but he saw it out well. We always thought there was a nice race in him over hurdles, but it takes time to get to know him. Liam knows him well now. He's only a small horse and you would think that it would be mad going down the inside with him but he thrives on that sort of thing - Ray Hackett, trainer.

quotes.race: Muckross Handicap
quotes.quote: Sequoiaspirit is a fun little horse, is easy train, bounces out every morning and does whatever you ask him to do. I'll keep him on the Flat at the minute. He handles Dundalk so that is an option for the winter - Ray Hackett, trainer

quotes.race: Patrickswell Apprentice Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Sequoiaspirit is a very handy horse but his heart is in the right place. I wouldn't be too anxious to put a big weight on him and he'll pitch away on the flat for a while - Ray Hackett, trainer.

runners.name: Catos Revenge
runners.comment: Didn't quite stay 2m7f latest; back in trip here and don't rule out
runners.spotlight: 2m4f Limerick handicap winner last season (heavy) has had a relatively light campaign since, definite promise last time at Naas in February, just failing to stay 2m7f; back in trip here and don't rule out.

quotes.race: Grant Thornton Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cato's Revenge seemed to like it and was impressive. The horse is a big type, you'd like to see him over fences in time - Phidelma Elvin, rider

runners.name: Krak
runners.comment: Below best dropped in trip latest; return to longer trip for handicap debut could suit
runners.spotlight: Promising efforts to finish third over 2m4f at Leopardstown and extended 2m2f at Naas in maidens but not so good dropped in trip at Navan last time; return to longer trip for handicap debut could suit; also due to run at Fairyhouse yesterday (2.10).

runners.name: Natural Look
runners.owner: R J Whitford & Patrick James Walsh
runners.comment: Well below best the last twice but on an okay mark on previous efforts
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner for Declan Queally at up to 2m6f; solid efforts in defeat twice over hurdles for her current trainer but disappointing the last twice, let down by jumping at Naas on latest; just 2lb above last winning mark so don't rule out.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Instagram Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Natural Look was in season last time. She worked really well last week and we knew what scope for improvement there was with her. She was deadly to jump today - Declan Queally, trainer.

quotes.race: Paulstown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Natural Look deserved that. She was nearly brought down at Cork and we ran into a good one at Clonmel. We took a chance and I'm delighted we got our day. We'll find something similar - Declan Queally, trainer-rider.

3:22.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING (Yielding to soft in places) Hurdle course - SOFT (Yielding to soft in places)

runners.name: Donkey Years
runners.comment: Course winner, won off 6lb lower at Listowel in September, may be on a tough mark
runners.spotlight: Course winner last won at Listowel in September; last sighted finishing a remote second in a Limerick handicap chase in December; remains 6lb above last win; soft ground fine but may be on a tough mark back over hurdles.

quotes.race: Devon Inn Dan Sheehan Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Donkey Years has been a great servant and is so much better handicapped over hurdles, so it's great to get one with him. He had promised a couple of times and it's great to have him back with a bit of sparkle. I would love to have another crack at the Munster National - Eric McNamara, trainer.

quotes.race: Palmerstown House Pat Taaffe Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Donkey Years has been placed on his last three runs and he's been very consistent. I thought Mark (Walsh) was superb on him today. They went very quick early on, he kept travelling well and was jumping well.  When you go down to the last upsides one of Willie Mullins' you always think you are in trouble but thanks be to God he came out on top. I wouldn't mind having a few more like him, he's the best I have and is a lovely horse - Eric McNamara, trainer

quotes.race: Charleville Cheese Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Donkey Years must have had niggly problems as he is a five year old going on six but I only have him for four or five months and he is a fine big good looking horse and is a good horse. I don't know where we go next but we'll find a winners' race for him somewhere. It is nice to have a nice horse - Eric McNamara, trainer

runners.name: Prophets Corner
runners.comment: H'cap debut winner over 3m, didn't follow up at 2m4f, back up in trip now, could rebound
runners.spotlight: Won his handicap debut in fine style, beating Duffys Hodey by 8l at Punchestown (2m7f, soft); couldn't follow up off 7lb higher dropped back to 2m4f at Navan, weakening quickly late on; the step back up to 3m is a plus; could bounce back.

quotes.race: David Trundley Artist At Punchestown Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's my first winner on the track, I've had 24 in point-to-points. Prophet's Corner is a yard favourite and three miles is his thing. Once the ground gets into heavy territory, he's very good on it. He can go the same speed on soft as he can on hard. Darragh [jockey] is my brother, we keep it in-house and keep the costs down - Sean Allen, trainer.

runners.name: Getaway Charlie
runners.comment: No win since October 2023, good run over C&D latest, place chance if the rain misses
runners.spotlight: 1-14 over hurdles, the win coming over 2m7f in October 2023 off 109; bounced back to form when a 4.75l second on latest over C&D good ground; that wasn't his first good run here but the forecast rain is a worry, place chance again if it misses.

runners.name: Toor Khov
runners.comment: Beat a now 134 rated rival in a maiden last May, ran well off 1lb higher at Navan, chance
runners.spotlight: Beat the now 134 rated Pray Tell in a Tipperary maiden last May (3m, good to yielding); best handicap effort on penultimate at Navan when a 3.25l second of 18 at Navan (3m1f, yielding) off 114 and just 1lb higher now; off since below par run at Leopardstown in December; claims if fit after 113-day break.

runners.name: Emancipator
runners.comment: Heavy ground winner off 1lb higher in December 2023, okay chase run latest, rain a plus
runners.spotlight: Won on bottomless ground at Fairyhouse in December 2023 off 113 and just 1lb higher now; shaped okay in a Limerick handicap chase after a three month break last month; the forecast rain is a big plus for him; not discounted.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better @Fairyhouse Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Emancipator needs a lead and normally has to have his head landed on the line but I had to go on when I did, he kept his head when the other horse came at him - John Shinnick, rider.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Emancipator is a horse that we could have super fun with. We put him away for soft ground and the long break did him good. It didn't look a great race and he was a short price for a reason - Terence O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Sir Bob
runners.comment: Three-time course winner, won over C&D last March, testing ground ideal, not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Veteran is a three-time course winner, the latest coming over C&D on testing ground off 111 in March last year; 2lb higher now and has been mostly out of form since but he'll get his preferred underfoot conditions here; can't be dismissed.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cork Grand National Handicap Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was a little worried after five fences as Sir Bob was getting lazy and I thought he might lose his place, but his jumping just kept him there. Once he was there turning in, I thought we had a great chance. Staying is his job. We were happy with his first run back over hurdles and then a bit disappointed with him on his second run but the distance suited him today. He's an 11-year-old now so it's great to get it. The Troytown will probably come too soon so the Porterstown is more likely his next race and we might try him over longer distances over hurdles somewhere along the line. He's tough and he battled back after the last - Robert Tyner, trainer.

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Event Specialists Veterans Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Sir Bob is in bonus territory now, he handles that ground really well - Robert Tyner, trainer.

quotes.race: Ardmulchan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sir Bob had been running over fences and lost his way so we decided to bring him back over hurdles. It really seemed to smarten him up and he felt like a different horse. He wouldn't be the bravest horse in the world and the hurdles suited him well. I'm delighted to get his head in front - Mark Walsh, rider

runners.name: Chosen Thyme
runners.comment: 0-10 over hurdles but has run well in defeat, ground versatile, place claims at least
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner is 0-10 over hurdles; went close in a Punchestown novice handicap in February 2024 off 114 and 2lb lower now; decent effort in a maiden at Limerick latest (3m, good); testing ground fine and he has place claims at least.

runners.name: Joshuas Daylami
runners.comment: H'cap debut, won weak maiden at Punchestown, highly tried latest, probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; won a weak 2m7f heavy ground Punchestown maiden in February; outclassed in a Grade 3 novice on latest at Limerick; probably best watched off opening mark of 110.

quotes.race: 50,000 Euros BetVictor Graduation Bonus Series Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We knew stepping up in trip was going to suit Joshua's Daylami. We've done an awful lot of schooling down at Paddy and Jack Kennedy's, although Cian (Cullinan) said once she brushes up her jumping she'll be better again. There's the Shannon Spray Novice Hurdle (mares) in Limerick, we might just go there, or there's a novice handicap in Fairyhouse at Easter - Paul Fahey, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Insouciant Dallier
runners.breeder: M Michel Larobe, M Philippe Thiriet, M Vincent Le Roy & M Ma
runners.comment: Out of form since Sligo maiden second, pulled up in novice chase latest, cheekpieces tried
runners.spotlight: Placed in a bumper at Fairyhouse and a maiden hurdle at Sligo (25.5f, soft) in 2023; lost form since and no sign of a revival when pulled up in a novice chase at Tramore latest; hard to fancy with cheekpieces now tried.

runners.name: Rokathir
runners.breeder: M Francois Xavier Chaussonniere & Mme Doina Chaussonniere
runners.comment: Point winner, up 12lb for easy win on h'cap debut, unexposed, could be more to come
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; off the mark over hurdles on handicap debut at Punchestown (3m1f, heavy) in February when well backed; up 12lb for that but he did it easily and he's unexposed; could be more to come.

quotes.race: Book Your Group Deal Today Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rokathir travelled and jumped great. He fell the last day here (over fences) when I still though I had half a a chance and the winner went on and won again at Fairyhouse. He had a nice weight and coped with the ground well. He was a bit quirky when he first came but the penny is beginning to drop now. Darragh O'Keefe, jockey talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: West Is Awake
runners.comment: Last won in October 2023 off 8lb lower, out of form this season, pulled up latest, oppose
runners.spotlight: Without a win over timber since October 2023 at Fairyhouse (3m, soft) off 102 and remains 8lb above that mark; has been out of form this season and no signs of a revival when pulled up on latest; others hold stronger claims.

runners.name: Oneforgonzo
runners.comment: Has lost form since back to back wins last April, out of form over fences, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Won twice on testing ground last April in handicap hurdles at Naas (3m) and Ballinrobe (22.5f) off 87 and 99 respectively; has been struggling over fences this season; return to hurdles a plus but he's hard to fancy on recent form.

quotes.race: Buy The Centenary Of Naas Racecourse Book By Turtle Bunbury Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Oneforgonzo is a nice horse, in that grade anyway. Hopefully when he strengthens up and develops he'll go on to do something better - Sean Aherne, trainer

runners.name: Hes Home Again
runners.comment: C&D winner off 10lb lower on last hurdles start, no impact chasing, not discounted
runners.spotlight: 1-9 over hurdles, the win coming off 96 over C&D last March by 2.25l and 10lb higher now; sent chasing to no avail since, unseating on latest at Clonmel; return to hurdles and this venue could spark a revival; testing ground fine; can't discount.

quotes.race: Mallow Commercials CVRT Test Centre Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's Home Again was very disappointing at Leopardstown but it was very heavy ground and it's not as bad here. He's no superstar but I'm happy to get a win with him and it made the trip worthwhile - Eddie Cawley, trainer

runners.name: Idol
runners.comment: Bumper and h'cap hurdle winner, lacks a run, best watched on first run for new stable
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner for Willie Mullins; sole win for Sam Curling came off 97 in a mares' handicap hurdle at Punchestown in January 2024; lacks a run on debut for new yard and stamina to prove; best watched.

runners.name: Nelson County
runners.comment: Improved in h'caps, ground may have been too lively latest, return to soft a plus, go well
runners.spotlight: No impact in maiden hurdles but has improved for handicaps; good third off 104 at Fairyhouse (2m4f, soft) then may have found the ground a bit lively when a 7.25l fourth over this C&D latest; should go well back on a softer surface.

runners.name: Carlas Big Jim
runners.comment: Up 16lb for wins at Gowran and Clonmel last year, unproven at this trip, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won heavy ground handicaps at Clonmel (2m3f) and Gowran (2m4f) last February-March; cumulative 16lb rise halted his progress and remains 5lb above the last win; unproven at 3m; others preferred.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back On Every Race At Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Carlas Big Jim probably got an easy lead, but he acts well on that ground. Cal knows him very well and he says he jumps better when he's up there. We might run him next in a qualifier for the Full Circle Series at Cork - Louis Archdeacon, trainer.

runners.name: Irish Envoy

prev_owners.owner: D W McCorkell & Susan McDowell & J P Fitzgerald & G Howitt

runners.comment: 4lb below Punchestown hurdles win, best on good ground, watch on return from break
runners.spotlight: Is now 4lb lower than when gaining sole hurdles win in a 2m4f Punchestown handicap in October 2023; off since unseating in a handicap chase at Wexford last August; testing ground would be a negative; watch.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (Pro/Am) Auction INH Flat Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Irish Envoy was green and babyish and was barely ready for a run. I thought the advantages of running before Punchestown out-weighed the disadvantages. He'll go for the Land Rover now - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: John Storey
runners.comment: Won off 7lb lower at Fairyhouse, no impact two runs since, testing ground unknown, watch
runners.spotlight: Won off 94 at Fairyhouse (24.5f, yielding to soft) on New Year's Day; up 7lb and failed to trouble the judge in two starts since; untried on very testing ground and has to prove he can win off his revised rating; best watched.

quotes.race: Happy Retirement To Noel Fanning Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: John Storey got a very good ride. They went very quick early on and Danny just took his time. He ran a nice race at Punchestown last time. He's all stamina and he's tough. Hopefully he can jump a fence somewhere down the line - Liam Cusack, trainer.

runners.name: Cullig
runners.owner: Miss Patricia Coghlan & Diana Edwina Oakes & Guy Culliford
runners.comment: In-form mare, up 16lb for last two runs, moves up in grade, chance if handles the ground
runners.spotlight: In-form mare has improved for handicaps; won her first one over C&D (good) by 20l off 84 last month; beaten a neck in follow up bid at Navan (3m, good to yielding) off 13lb higher seventeen days ago; up another 3lb in a tougher race and likely very different ground now; chance if she handles conditions.

runners.name: Pointe A Pitre
runners.breeder: S C Racing Investment Society Ecurie Ris
runners.comment: Promise in third maiden, pulled up on h'cap debut, down 1lb, may need more experience
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit of promise in third maiden start at Fairyhouse (2m4f, soft) when a 7l fifth of 10; pulled up on handicap debut on latest at Navan; down 1lb but she may need more experience.

runners.name: Robyndeglory
runners.comment: Five-time winner on long losing run, mark falling but mostly out of form recently; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; five-time winner over timber but losing run stretches back to February 2023; well-handicapped on best form but hasn't looked like capitalising on falling mark; others appeal more.

runners.name: Aleish Lass
runners.comment: In form, won at Limerick and third at Naas, probably needs the rain to miss; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; in good form, winning at Limerick in March (22.5f, yielding) and close up behind Cullig off 5lb higher when third at Naas (3m, good to yielding); up in class and may not be as effective on testing ground.

runners.name: Plain Or Battered
runners.owner: David Norris & Fergal Norris & N Dooly
runners.comment: 1-15 over hurdles, 6lb above last win, beaten by Rokathir latest; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 1-15 over hurdles; 8.25l behind Rokathir latest at Punchestown in first time blinkers (retained); remains 6lb above last win and hard to see him turning that form around even off these revised terms.

3:57.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING (Yielding to soft in places) Hurdle course - SOFT (Yielding to soft in places)

runners.name: Asterion Forlonge
runners.breeder: E A R L La Forlonge
runners.comment: Beat one rival when taking this last year, good run on latest at Thurles, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: One of two for top yard; won this easily last year on testing ground but only faced one rival; ran respectably in the Grade 2 Galmoy Hurdle in January and got to within 5l of Hewick returned to chasing at Thurles on latest; top rated at 157 and should be hard to beat.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Asterion Forlonge is a good horse. We went a nice gallop, didn't hang around and it is nice to get another win with him - Sean O'Keeffe, rider

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Champion Stayers Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Asterion Forlonge ran a cracker, he stayed on great at the end and looks to be back to himself. He could well got to France for maybe the French Champion Hurdle. I wouldn't be averse to mixing it with him next season, but he has made a good case for staying over hurdles. He jumps them better and just tends to make a mistake over fences. I would say that is what will happen - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Rathbarry & Glenview Studs Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: We're delighted with Asterion Forlonge, he improved plenty for his run in Thurles and I think he'll improve plenty from today as well. He did everything right, he's had his issues and we're delighted to get his head back in front today. He's in the Stayers Hurdle at Punchestown and the plan at the moment is to keep him over hurdles for the time being - David Casey, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: EMS Copiers Novice Handicap Chase (Grade A)
quotes.quote: Asterion Forlonge was able to get it all together. Handicaps are just run at a different pace to graded races and he liked that nice ground too. I think he could improve an awful lot next year and he has the potential to be a very good horse - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Roche Group At Vista Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Asterion Forlonge will be going out in trip, anywhere from 2m4f to 3m. He jumped well apart from a couple of mistakes, but for his first attempt I was happy. He will improve - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a nice positive performance from him. I think he'll want much further in trip and I'll be going out in trip with him now. He had to do it the hard way, make all his own running there today, and was just running around in front. Hopefully we can sort that out before his next run - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Hill Fabrication INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Asterion Forlonge is a stayer and I ended up too far back on him. I got shuffled back and that was my fault and he did well to win. He had an injury last year and I'd imagine he'll go straight over hurdles now. He'll be a staying horse over hurdles and fences - Patrick Mullins, rider

stable_tour.quote: We'll probably stick more to hurdles than chases with him, but he could slot into a chase somewhere if the right opportunity popped up. 25-11-24

When he gets his jumping together properly he is going to be a serious player, but unfortunately he picks a fence or two to make a mess of. He made a couple of mistakes in the King George and even then he was still coming back at the final fence like he had a chance. I thought he ran a cracker at Leopardstown going to the penultimate fence and for no reason he just put down which lost him his position and then passing the winning post he finished fourth which wasn't a bad performance. I suppose I am hoping rather than expecting that we can get things right one day. He is a lovely horse, but you would not want to put a kid on him. I have found over the years that if you keep running these kind of horses, they will get the hang of it. I would imagine he will go for the Gold Cup but there is talk that he could go to the Ryanair. It is a possibility as he is a son of Coastal Path - which says stamina - but we may drop him back because he does jump well. Going flat out over a shorter trip may suit him and he may be better off being aggressive. We can all see when he races that he has Grade 1 ability, it is just that his jumping can let him down. 09-03-22

runners.name: Mister Policeman
runners.comment: 3-6 over fences, pulled up last twice, unproven at 3m, lacks a recent run, best watched
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; two-time hurdles winner is three from six over fences; back to back wins last year in a Punchestown novice (2m, heavy) Grade 3 novice at Thurles (2m2f heavy); pulled up both starts since over 2m4f and 22.5f so has stamina to prove and lacks a run; watch.

quotes.race: Pierce Molony Memorial Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Mister Policeman jumped fantastic, he loved it today and is really getting the hang of it. He got a lot of confidence from the last day and he has built on that again today - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Concept Colours Rated Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Mister Policeman is still learning to jump. I'm happy that he's coming along and he will go out in trip at some point. The should leave him nicely set up for the spring - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Irish National Hunt Chase CLG Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Mister Policeman got away on me a bit but I like the way he kicked in from the back of the last. His jumping can sharpen up and a faster pace would suit - Paul Townend, rider

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Bet 10 Euros Get 50 Euros Sign Up Offer Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mister Policeman is a lovely horse with a big future. He is fairly straightforward and will come on a lot for it. He could go out in trip too, he is very relaxed - Michael O'Sullivan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He does fantastic work at home. I know he won his race at Cork for us but, based on his homework, I thought he would win a lot easier than he did. He has huge ability and he'll go novice chasing this season. He can always go back hurdling if it doesn't work out, but chasing is the plan. I think he'll improve a lot from what you saw from him at Cork. 13-11-23

runners.name: Fil Dor
runners.comment: 2-15 over fences, gets 6lb from top two, pulled up in Grand National latest, needs revival
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner over hurdles; 2-15 in chases including a listed win in a two-runner race at Thurles (22.5f, good) in November; didn't run badly when tried over 24.5f at Fairyhouse in February but pulled up in the Grand National latest; gets 6lb from the top two here but needs to bounce back.

quotes.race: Racing TV Black Friday Offer 14 Euros Per Month Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward and fairly routine. It would have been a surprise if Fil Dor had been beaten as he was rated a lot higher than the other horse. He really showed some glimmers of his old form the last day in Clonmel, so hopefully it is onwards and upwards - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Fil Dor jumped very well. He lost his confidence a bit last year. He had a good blow but he galloped all the way to the line. There will be plenty of fun to be had with him over 2m4f - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Red Mills Trial Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Fil Dor is a smart horse who had a little blip the last day over fences and it's great to see him come back and enjoy it - Jordan Gainford, rider.

quotes.race: Boardsmill Stud Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Jack said it rode like a proper race. Fil Dor was foot-perfect apart from one down the back that he landed on top of it. You couldn't help but be happy with him and I'd imagine he'll go to Leopardstown at Christmas now (for the Grade 1 Racing Post Novice Chase) - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Knight Frank Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Even walking around the parade ring Fil Dor is so relaxed. The Dublin Racing Festival would be the obvious place to go with him now and if not then straight to the Triumph - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boost Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Davy (Russell} said Fil Dor was just so professional and was asleep the whole way. He gave him one dig and he did what he had to do. A bit softer ground would suit him better but it was a nice performance and he did it well. Lunar Power brought him a little left so he needed the good jump at the last. We will look at Leopardstown over Christmas but ground will be a thing so we will put him in Chepstow as well - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Value Cabs 3yo Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fil Dor is a good horse. I love the way he did it, he was so relaxed through the race and he will go on any ground. He will probably go to Fairyhouse next month - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's not going to be an easy horse to place but he came back in looking a million dollars and we'll hopefully get his head back in front. He has the option of hurdles and fences. 28-10-24

runners.name: Hascoeur Clermont
runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage De Clermont
runners.comment: 2-18 over fences and rated 121, trip and ground fine, tough ask on stable debut, watch
runners.spotlight: Has won twice over hurdles and is 2-18 over fences; rated 121 so faces a tough task on these terms; trip and ground fine but is best watched on first run for new yard.

quotes.race: Wienerberger Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I'm delighted. Hascoeur Clermont had a lovely weight there and I knew he'd love that ground so happy days. He was very keen but when he got the front at least he settled and jumped well. I don't know where we go from here. Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Glenman Corporation Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Hascoeur Clermont compensated for the last two days. We weren't sure about the ground but he handled it well. He will keep going in staying chases - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's in and out of form a bit and probably isn't well handicapped now but hopefully he'll have his day again. He won the amateur jockeys' handicap chase last year at Cheltenham's November meeting and he could go back to the track again at some point, maybe in December. 12-11-24

He's in and out of form a bit and probably isn't well handicapped now but hopefully he'll have his day again. He won the amateur jockeys' handicap chase last year at Cheltenham's November meeting and he could go back there at some point, maybe in December. 13-11-24

runners.name: Lonesome Boatman
runners.comment: Four-time point winner, rated 126, out of depth in Gr 3 novice latest, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Four-time point-to-point winner; rated 126 over fences; beaten 34l in a Limerick Grade 3 novice latest in first time cheekpieces (retained); hard to fancy in this company.

4:32.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
4:32.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING (Yielding to soft in places) Hurdle course - SOFT (Yielding to soft in places)

runners.name: Ask The Bookie
runners.comment: Regressed over hurdles, no improvement for switch to fences, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Regressed over hurdles and hasn't improved for the switch to chasing; unseated at Clonmel and beaten 33l at Tramore; others appeal more.

runners.name: Dancingondaceiling
runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles, okay effort when fourth in second chase latest, drop in trip is a worry
runners.spotlight: 2-3 and rated 121 over hurdles; fell on chase debut and finished an 8.75l fourth of 15 in a Naas beginners' latest (2m4f, soft) when behind Foxy Girl; both his hurdles wins came at around 3m so not sure this drop back in trip will suit.

runners.name: Harsh
runners.comment: Course winner over timber, decent first chase effort, ground versatile, has a chance
runners.spotlight: 2-13 over hurdles, including a win here, but out of form in that sphere since the turn of the year; well-beaten at Cheltenham and 16l behind Aspire Tower on his chase debut at Wexford just over two weeks ago; this is easier and he handles most ground; not without a chance.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Series Final Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Harsh like a big field and I thought he won well. The hustle and bustle suited him, he travelled and jumped great - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Maidenstreetprince
runners.comment: 0-7 over fences, has run well in defeat, trip too far latest, don't discount back in trip
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler is 0-7 over fences and rated 125; best effort in this sphere a 5.5l second of 14 in a beginners' at Ballinrobe (2m1f, yielding) last May; trip may have stretched him on latest at Clonmel; his experience is a plus and he's won on testing ground; not discounted dropped in trip.

quotes.race: Keith Lynch Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maidenstreetprince had a good run the last day and was getting a few pounds today. He was a bit free and there is room for improvement in his jumping. He stuck it out well. We'll see what the handicapper does - Charles Byrnes, trainer.

runners.name: Mirazur West
runners.comment: Rated 135, solid efforts in beginners' at Tipp and Thurles, soft ground OK; obvious chance
runners.spotlight: Rated 135 after three chase starts; solid efforts in beginners' at Tipperary and Thurles; outclassed when beaten 24l in a Grade 1 novice at Limerick in between those runs; likes soft ground and has an obvious chance for top yard.

quotes.race: Easter Festival Early Bird Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mirazur West is still learning. He settled a lot better today than he did at Leopardstown. He is well able to jump and is going the right way - Mark Walsh, rider.

quotes.race: Nursery Of Champions INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Mirazur West is a lovely horse and had been working well. He's a little more tractable than his brother Ferny Hollow was in his early days. He's a beautiful stamp of a horse and did everything right - David Casey, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well enough on his first try over fences at Tipperary on Friday, but he kept giving away ground by jumping to his right so we will try to find a beginners' chase for him going the other way around. He seems to prefer going right-handed. 25-11-24

runners.name: Pinot Gris
runners.comment: Dual-purpose, 140s rated hurdler, not bred for chasing but has ability, needs rain to miss
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose sort; chase debutant; rated 141 over hurdles and not disgraced in the County Hurdle off 143 when beaten 5.25l on latest; not an obvious candidate for chasing on breeding but he clearly has plenty of ability; best form is on good-yielding so probably needs the rain to miss.

quotes.race: Fishery Lane Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pinot Gris is a lazy and idle sort of horse. I'm not sure where we go with him, maybe in a handicap somewhere - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: New Pravha Suite Handicap
quotes.quote: Pinot Gris seemed like a big baby the last day and took a while to get going. He is still a bit raw over the road today but he came good for me when he met the rising ground. The cheekpieces sharpened him up plenty. I had a bad draw but he helped me early to get a good position. We'll see the best of him when he steps up in trip - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Blinkers worked the trick for him at Naas on Sunday as they made him concentrate. He wandered around up the straight in the Lartigue and it's a pity we didn't have them on him then. I'm not sure what the plan is with him now but we'll probably go for a handicap somewhere. He'll jump a fence in time. 12-11-24

Blinkers did the trick at Naas on Sunday as they made him concentrate. He wandered around up the straight in the Lartigue and it's a pity we didn't have them on him then. I'm not sure what the plan is now but we'll probably go for a handicap somewhere. He'll jump a fence in time. 13-11-24

runners.name: Pride Of Place
runners.comment: 105 rated hurdler, unseated when beaten after long layoff on chase debut, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Placed in one of six starts over hurdles and rated 105; off 424 days and beaten when unseating on chase debut at Clonmel last month; others appeal more.

runners.name: Run For Harry
runners.comment: 123 rated hurdler, jumped right and pulled up in second chase on latest, best watched
runners.spotlight: 2-14 over hurdles and rated 123; jumped right and reportedly went wrong when pulled up in second chase start at Wexford; this right-handed track will suit better but he can only be watched after that last run.

runners.name: Will The Wise
runners.comment: Point winner, rated 132 over hurdles, bred to be a chaser but this trip may be too short
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point and hurdles winner; rated 132 over timber and ran respectably in the Pertemps Final at Cheltenham on latest; bred for this game and likes soft-heavy ground but this may not be enough of a stamina test on chase debut.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Group Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I was very unsure how Will The Wise was going to handle the ground. I thought he could weaken coming to the last but he dug deep. He's also in the Albert Bartlett but we'll have to see what the handicapper does as well - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: 50,000 Euros BetVictor Graduation Bonus Series Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Will The Wise was good there today. He travelled and jumped and stayed going. Hopefully we are back on track with him and I hope he can step up in grade - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
