quotes.quote: Will The Wise is weak and will be a good horse when he gets to jump fences. The pace was very stop-start and he was only getting going at the finish - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We ran him in the Grade 2 at Navan this month but we were very disappointed with him. There was no obvious excuse for it, only maybe the ground. He'll have a couple of entries in maiden hurdles at Leopardstown and Limerick. He's a horse we really like and we'd love to get him back on track. 21-12-24

He's a nice horse who showed a good attitude to win his bumper at Punchestown. He'll start off in a maiden hurdle, potentially on Sunday at Cheltenham over two miles, or we could go to Cork the following week. 13-11-24

runners.name: Foxy Girl
runners.comment: 125-rated hurdler, good effort in second chase at Naas, gets weight from the boys, claims
runners.spotlight: 1-7 over hurdles and rated 125; much better on second chase start when a 1.5l second at Naas over 2m4f on soft (Dancingondaceiling 7.25l behind) and given a chase rating of 128; the drop back in trip shouldn't inconvenience her and she gets weight from the boys; claims.

quotes.race: Signsplus Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Foxy Girl has a fair bit of scope. She jumps quickly and put her head down. It's early days yet but she had good placed form and is one to look forward to - Mike O'Connor, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She runs very well fresh and can then disappoint, so we've tried a few changes with her. She's very well and will start off in a beginners' chase when we can get some ease in the ground. 18-11-24

She's a lovely mare who came to us from France having finished second on her only run at Auteuil. She was runner-up again on her debut for us at Thurles in early December but really came on for that run and won at Limerick in good style over Christmas. The runner-up, In Excess, franked that form with a good win next time out. Foxy Girl is in good order and the plan is for her to go for the Ryanair Mares' Novices' Hurdle. 01-03-23

runners.name: Lady Bresil
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner, beaten 68l on chase debut, best watched dropped back in trip
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; maiden hurdle winner has struggled in three starts since; beaten 68l on chase debut at Gowran (2m4f, soft) in January; best watched dropped back in trip.

5:07.race_name: Finbarr Quaid Electrical (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
5:07.going_detailed: Chase course - YIELDING (Yielding to soft in places) Hurdle course - SOFT (Yielding to soft in places)

runners.name: Big Ned
runners.comment: Leading Light gelding out of bumper winner, pulled up in point last month, needs more time
runners.spotlight: Leading Light gelding out of a bumper and hurdles winner pulled up in his sole point-to-point start at Ballyragget last month; from a good family so ought to be capable of better at some point but may need more time.

runners.name: Coup Detat
runners.comment: Ran well over C&D in October, beaten 31l latest in November, off since, best watched
runners.spotlight: Standout effort a 1.5l second over this C&D (good) in October; nowhere near that level in other three runs and was beaten 31l on latest at Navan in November; off since and probably best watched.

runners.name: Doctor Du Mesnil
runners.comment: Doctor Dino gelding, from family of Lord Du Mesnil, respected on debut for top yard
runners.spotlight: Doctor Dino gelding cost 55,000euros as a 3yo; first foal; dam French 2m1f chase winner, half-sister to French winners Invincible Dina and Ches Demonmirail, both by Doctor Dino, family of very smart staying chaser Lord Du Mesnil; interesting newcomer from top yard and respected.

runners.name: Dream Diamond
runners.comment: Promise in maiden hurdles, tailed off on soft in Navan bumper latest, watch up in trip
runners.spotlight: Placed in 2m maiden hurdles here and at Gowran on yielding ground in first two starts under Rules; tailed off on soft ground in a Navan bumper when last seen in January; best watched stepping up in trip.

runners.name: Eastbank Warrior
runners.comment: Placed in bumpers and maiden hurdles, has form on heavy, chance if fit after absence
runners.spotlight: Placed twice in bumpers and in a maiden hurdle; best effort in this sphere a 2.5l second behind the now 127 rated Blaze The Way at Thurles (2m, heavy) last March; off since third of 14 in maiden hurdle at Ballinrobe in August; chance if he's fit for his return and yard have a good strike rate in bumpers.

runners.name: Go To Town
runners.comment: 66-1 but not disgraced on debut at Navan, step up in trip should suit, could outrun odds
runners.spotlight: Sent off 66-1 and finished a 24l fifth of 11 on debut at Navan (2m, soft); this step up in trip should suit; could outrun likely odds.

runners.name: Jack The Lad
runners.comment: 120,000GBP purchase after UK point win, strip fitter for Gowran run, interesting
runners.spotlight: Wide margin UK point-to-point winner for John Dawson in December; bought for 120,000GBP at the Cheltenham sales later that month; beaten 15l on Rules' and stable debut in a 2m2f Gowran bumper last month; should strip fitter now; interesting.

runners.name: Kashchei
runners.comment: Mild promise in UK good ground bumpers and on hurdling debut latest, needs more
runners.spotlight: Just mild promise in good ground UK bumpers for Sam Drinkwater; similar story when sixth on Irish debut in a 2m3f Clonmel maiden hurdle (2m3f, heavy); should come on for that but needs more reverting to this sphere.

runners.name: Lacaduv
runners.comment: 185,000euros debutant out of Flat listed placed dam, tongue tied, check the market
runners.spotlight: Doctor Dino gelding cost 40,000euros as yearling and 185,000euros as a 3yo; second foal; dam Listed-placed 1m2f/1m4f winner (RPR 101), half-sister to useful 2m3f hurdle winner Montdragon; tongue tied for debut but in good hands and worth a market check.

runners.name: Mojoe
runners.comment: Outran odds of 20-1 on debut over 2m, this trip may suit, place chance in first-time hood
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 20-1 for his debut at Fairyhouse (2m, yielding) and showed definite promise, outpaced but keeping on for a 14.5l fourth of 10; this longer trip should suit and the hood goes on; place claims.

runners.name: Peekachoo
runners.comment: 66-1 and never figured in a Down Royal bumper in December, hood discarded, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Slipped up in sole point-to-point; 66-1 and never figured in first bumper at Down Royal in December and off since; hood worn that day is left off; hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Rinnaseer Dream
runners.comment: Cheaply bought Pour Moi gelding, related to winners but probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Cheaply bought Pour Moi gelding is a second foal; half-brother to 3m hurdle winner Bridie Whittle; dam unraced sister to 3m/3m1f hurdle winner Maggie Blue, half-sister to bumper/useful 2m-2m4f hurdle winner Hello George; yard not known for bumper winners; watch on debut.

runners.name: Son Of Alacoque
runners.comment: Westerner gelding, half-brother to useful bumper winner, check the market on debut
runners.spotlight: Westerner gelding cost 13,000euros as a 3yo; sixth foal; half-brother to winners Minsterforsport (useful bumper and 2m/2m3f hurdle) and Learntalot (2m6f chase); unraced dam from family of smart chaser Another Coral (best up to 2m5f); nicely bred and worth a market check on debut.

runners.name: The Gooses Acre
runners.comment: Big prices both bumper starts, beaten 26l when fourth latest, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Sent off at big prices both starts; fourth in a good ground 2m3f Limerick bumper latest but was beaten 26l; likely to encounter different ground here; others appeal more.

runners.name: Thedeviluno
runners.comment: Built on debut promise when close second latest, leading form claims, very soft an unknown
runners.spotlight: Built on debut promise shown in a 2m Fairyhouse bumper when a close second in a Wexford (2m, good to yielding) behind a well-backed Gordon Elliott horse on St Patrick's Day; leading form claims but very soft ground would be an unknown.

quotes.race: Racing TV Grande Course de Haies d'Auteuil (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (5yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I try not to miss an objective but all I can do is try and work in the right way. We had a virus in the yard which is why we didn't run Losange Bleu in the final prep race and we've only had a month to get back from that. I didn't have much doubt he would stay and we decided not to hold him up, but to step up from 3,900 metres to 5,100 metres in a Grade 1 is not something every horse could manage - Dominique Bressou, trainer.

runners.name: Jeu De Thaix
runners.owner: Mme Patrick Papot & Mme Daniela Mele

runners.name: Botox Has
runners.breeder: S C E A Hamel Stud

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Rendlesham Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Botox Has enjoys a flat track and has won very well. I think we'll probably bypass Cheltenham, he's in the Stayers' Hurdle but won't go there, and we might consider the Grade 1 at Aintree [Liverpool Hurdle]. We may also consider going to France in the spring and early summer, there's the French Champion Hurdle and others race there as well - Josh Moore, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The West Yorkshire Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Botox Has is unbelievable. What a performance that was. He was giving weight away to a lot of them. The one thing he has on his side is he's very tough. When push comes to shove he digs deep. I don't think he enjoyed the ground today. It's an unbelievable training performance (by Gary Moore) - he's an absolute genius. This horse has had his problems. He had a little niggly problem hence he didn't go to the Cheltenham Festival last season and he's been off ever since but he has got him back as good as ever and I'm very grateful - Caolin Quinn, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Stayers' Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Botox Has is a tough horse, I just tried to keep him on the bridle as long as I could. I was handy enough the whole way, I winged the last and he really stuck his head down and battled for me. The more you ask him, the more he gives you. He's still unexposed, there's still plenty of improvement in him - Caoilin Quinn, rider.

quotes.race: Masterson Holdings Hurdle
quotes.quote: Botox Has won nicely. He picked up quicker than I was expecting him to down the hill. He saw it out well. I was hoping it wouldn't turn into a test of speed, so I kept him as close as I could to Harry and he galloped out well. I was quite confident we could give Allmankind a race. We minded him after he won in December - and what happened, happened - but it wasn't the end of the world. He's not an overly big horse but he was developing all of the time - Joshua Moore, rider.

quotes.race: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: There was no pace in the race so Botox Has had to make his own running. To win by five lengths, having only had a length lead at the last, shows he's an out and out galloper and I think he's a better horse coming off a fast pace. It wouldn't bother me stepping this horse up to two and a half miles against older horses. The one thing he does do so well is jump - there aren't enough hurdles out there for him - Gary Moore, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He comes back looking better every year and it's the same again this time. He'll be better for his run at Cheltenham on Saturday, when the ground was a bit dry for him. Carrying top weight in a handicap for a small horse like him was too big an ask. He's a solid Grade 2 horse and we can pick our way through the season in races like the Rendlesham but we might well try him again in the Grade 1 Long Walk at Ascot in December. He's come out of Saturday fine. 29-10-24

I made a mistake of running him on good ground at Plumpton first time out and he then had a mishap on his first run over fences, at Cheltenham in November, so we reverted to hurdles immediately with a view to trying again next season. He has run very well in two Cheltenham handicap hurdles since finishing second and third. He is in good order and the plan is to go for the Â£100,000 handicap hurdle at Sandown on Saturday. 02-02-22

runners.name: Square Saint Roch
runners.owner: Charles Maquennehan, Ecurie Majestic Racing Eurl Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Mme Jean-Etienne Dubois & Mme Alexandra Millet

runners.name: El Clavel
runners.breeder: Haras D'Haspel & Terrains D'Avilly St Leonard

4:52.race_name: Le Vase d'Argent - 3rd Etape Defi du Galop - G Camprubi-Fee (Listed Race) (4yo+) (Turf)

runners.name: Dilawar
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C

prev_owners.owner: Haven't A Pot, D Macauliffe & Anoj Don

quotes.race: John Smith's Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely ecstatic. There's no better feeling than when a horse like Pride Of America, who takes a lot of training and managing, grabs a big prize like that. It's unbelievable and I'm thrilled for the owners and the whole team. This has been his target since March, but he does need a bit of cut in the ground. I couldn't imagine we were going to get it in the middle of July and no-one was doing a bigger rain dance than me - Amy Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Precision Facades Handicap
quotes.quote: Pride Of America was having a great time and when the other one got close he pulled up more - Amy Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Pareto Financial Planning Handicap
quotes.quote: Pride Of America is an improving horse who definitely likes this ground on the slow side as he's had a lot of problems - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

quotes.race: Boodles Raindance Handicap
quotes.quote: Pride Of America is a lovely horse, I'm very lucky to have been sent him. We've brought him back slowly and now he's repaying the owners' patience. As a young horse he was a 90-plus horse and he's firmly on his way back to that, it's exciting. Silvestre was brilliant on him. He and Silvestre are a match made in heaven because he loves to bowl along - I ride him most days at home and he tanks way round Newmarket like he owns the place. Today was plan A and we'll go back and think where we go next - Amy Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Bevan
runners.owner: Mme Steavie Doussot, Giuliano Loggia Et Al

2:35.race_name: Market Rasen Guides International Camp 2026 Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Micks Jet
runners.comment: In the frame in all five chases this year; likely contender once again
runners.spotlight: In the frame five consecutive times since switched to chasing this year, most notably when winning by 18l in first-time cheekpieces at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in January; should also be suited by today's trip-and-ground combination; likely contender again.

quotes.race: Visit Irish Bloodstock Sales With ITM Mares' Maiden Hurdle (Herring Queen Series Qual') (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was really good and a step back in the right direction. Micks Jet did everything well and nicely so hopefully it's onwards and upwards this season. She looked as good as she was last season so we're pleased with her. She's not an easy mare [to train]. Her jumping was a bit sloppy to start with and I think she's just come to herself, she's more of a spring mare. She's qualified for the [Herring Queen Series] final at Kelso so that might be something and the owners would like to go to the mares' meeting at Cheltenham. We could look at something good in between - Philip Kirby, trainer.

quotes.race: Spreadex Sports Get Â£50 Bet Bonuses Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elimination) (GBB)
quotes.quote: We were 50:50 about running Micks Jet this season, she's a shell. But she was very, very good and she loved that ground. She's got a big engine and she'll be a different horse next season. I'd say she's only half there. She could be serious - Philip Kirby, trainer.

runners.name: Concetto
runners.comment: Runs this track very well and is on a workable mark; respected
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (soft) last season and has twice finished second over 3m3f here this term (good to soft; including Lincolnshire National); also suited by good ground and current mark is workable; respected.

stable_tour.quote: A big, backward horse who did well over fences last season. He ran at Chepstow on Tuesday but he needs to go right-handed and we'll stick to that way from now on. He's one for the local Nationals as he jumps well and gallops forever. 01-11-23

runners.name: Morfee
runners.comment: Second off this mark at Plumpton two runs ago and didn't run badly in a marathon last time
runners.spotlight: Probably best known for his Plumpton exploits but should be fine on this right-handed track; runner-up off today's mark at Plumpton (3m1f, soft) in January and didn't run badly over a marathon trip there the following month; versatile regarding ground; no surprise if he features.

quotes.race: William Hill Daily Bet Boost Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I had to take a pull on Morfee early doors as I hit the front on him soon enough last time - James Best, jockey.

runners.name: Giovanni Change
runners.breeder: Sarl Elevage Du Haras De Bourgeauville
runners.owner: Readers & Wiggy, The 8 Amigos & J Burns
runners.comment: 0-9 over fences but went close at Wetherby in March and is very well suited by this track
runners.spotlight: Four-time course winner over hurdles; on the downgrade now and has 0-9 strike-rate over fences but lost out only by a neck at Wetherby (3m, good) last month and is sure to be suited by the return to this track.

quotes.race: Victor Lucas Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Giovanni Change is just the most genuine horse you are ever going to see. He has only got one eye, that is his fifth win now, his fourth at Market Rasen. He just won on the Flat at Ponterfract, what more can you ask for- Neil Readman, co-owner, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: MansionBet #morethanthenational Faller Insurance Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Giovanni Change has run some very good races in defeat in novices and a nice break has worked a treat with him. We've always thought he's a really nice horse, he has some good novice hurdle form that stacks up and hopefully we can pick up a nice race with him - Mark Walford, trainer.

quotes.race: Europe Hotel Killarney INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: We have actually had Giovanni Change a while but he's been a bit of a slow burner. He definitely wouldn't like it any quicker. I'm surprised by that and he will be a nice horse going forward for the future. The further he goes the better I'd say, and he might even make into a winter horse. I wouldn't be afraid of slower ground as he has a fair knee action - trainer Emmet Mullins.

runners.name: The Dream Goes On
runners.breeder: Dr Rdp Newland & Mr G Farmiloe

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Kate Farmiloe And Mrs L J Newland

runners.comment: Came good over hurdles last month and followed up on chasing debut; upped in trip today
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage mare who won over hurdles last month, after a break, and kept on too strongly for odds-on favourite on chasing debut at Plumpton (2m3f, good) a fortnight ago; moves up in trip today and could easily have a lot more to offer over fences.

4:55.race_name: Market Rasen Station Adoption Group Handicap Chase

runners.name: Pittsburg
runners.comment: In-form 9yo who followed last month's C&D success with emphatic win at Hereford
runners.spotlight: In-form 9yo who scored over C&D last month and followed up with an emphatic success at Hereford (2m, also good) ten days ago; commands respect in current mood.

runners.name: Vin Rouge
runners.comment: Pulled up on sole chase start (in 2023) and arrives here with all sorts to prove
runners.spotlight: Not seen over fences since pulled up on chasing debut in 2023; out of form over hurdles last summer and was pulled up when reappearing on the Flat in February (bled from the nose); comes with far too much risk.

runners.name: Grain Trade
runners.comment: Good fourth on handicap hurdle debut but well beaten twice since; chase debut today
runners.spotlight: Creditable fourth on handicap hurdle debut at Huntingdon (2m3f, good) in November but well beaten twice since; fitted with tongue-tie for chasing debut; needs to get career back on track.

runners.name: Royal Max
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant

prev_owners.owner: Mt Hughes, John Lawson, Stephanie Kaye

runners.comment: Came good over fences with clearcut success at Sedgefield this month; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Came good over fences with clearcut success at Sedgefield (2m, good) this month, after a break; that was a modest race but so is this one, and he has placed form over C&D.

stable_tour.quote: He looked precocious last season- an aeroplane- but things didn't pan out. We identified some issues with his breathing and ulcers. With that behind us, he could get back to what we thought he was. 24-10-22

runners.name: Zaras Universe

prev_owners.owner: Mrs C Hopper And David Carter

runners.comment: Not one to rely upon heavily but was second at Catterick in February and has won over C&D
runners.spotlight: Not one to rely upon heavily and would probably prefer ground slower than good but has a C&D win on her CV and returned to form with second at Catterick (1m7f, good to soft) in February; didn't run badly at Sedgefield last time (pulled up after penultimate-fence sprawl); a possible.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Zara's Universe won two last year and the handicapper has has given her a chance today, plus we've put that good young kid William (Maggs) on board. To be fair to Brian Hughes, he said to put the headgear on last time he rode her so we brought her down to two miles, put headgear on, and everyone's happy - Andrew Crook, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Jackhammer

prev_owners.owner: Dennis J Coppola & Mrs Dianne Sayer

runners.comment: Dual hurdle and multiple Flat winner; 0-10 over fences but on a tempting chase mark
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat in the autumn and might have needed this month's reappearance run (over hurdles); 0-10 over fences but has been given a chance by the handicapper and conditions here will suit.

quotes.race: Carlisle Bell Consolation Race Handicap
quotes.quote: Jackhammer has been running well for us over hurdles and at the start of the year we were struggling to find a rhythm and find races for him, but then he dropped into it at Perth and we had a nice couple of wins up there. He's been a great horse for us so we're delighted - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

quotes.race: Carlisle Bell Consolation Race Handicap
quotes.quote: Jackhammer was highly rated as a two-year-old so we knew he had the engine - it's just been a bit of a thinking process - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

quotes.race: Whitsbury Manor Stud EBF Stallions Blagrave Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: That's not really a surprise, although we don't have many first-time-out 2yo winners. We didn't have our first runner until Windsor on Monday, and that one ran quite well, and Jackhammer was working best of ours, although we don't have a grass gallop so that was a question mark. He's a big horse and a May foal, so there's no rush. He's one for next year, but I think he's pretty useful - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Getaway Jewel
runners.comment: Off since below-par run in December but is well handicapped and has ideal conditions here
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner (twice over C&D on good ground); did not get competitive on latest outing in December but was in fairly good form over hurdles/fences beforehand and looks interesting now returned to this venue, on a good mark and with conditions very much in his favour.

runners.name: Prospect House
runners.owner: Hard Held Partnership And Angus Racing
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both starts this year but can fare better now back on good ground
runners.spotlight: Safely held on both outings this year (chase/hurdle) but now 8lb lower than when keeping on for modest third at Catterick (1m7f, good) in December; gained his hurdling win here (in 2023) and will be suited by today's return to good ground; not out of this if perked up by change of headgear.

runners.name: Fast Deal
runners.comment: Shock 3m3f winner a year ago but that remains his only success after 58 starts
runners.spotlight: Caused 150-1 shock at Stratford (3m3f, good to soft) a year ago but that remains his only win from 58 career starts, and he was pulled up in C&D race won by Pittsburg last month; sports headgear for first time since one Flat run in blinkers in 2020 (well beaten).

3:45.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Away For The Night
runners.comment: Bettered underwhelming hurdle debut when fourth over C&D last month; place claims
runners.spotlight: Placed in course bumper in December and bettered underwhelming hurdle debut when fourth over C&D (good; behind Joining Force) last month; needs to improve again today but has place claims.

runners.name: Castanea Breeze
runners.comment: Placed in two bumpers but last month's C&D hurdle debut was very disappointing
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of his three bumpers (good to soft/soft) but jumped poorly and made very disappointing hurdle debut when last of five in modest C&D (good) maiden last month; difficult to enthuse over after that run.

stable_tour.quote: He's very much a work in progress. He's been immature mentally but he's improving with every run, finishing sixth on his first start in a bumper, then third on the last two occasions. Hopefully we'll give him a run over hurdles towards the end of the month, possibly at somewhere like Market Rasen over 2m4f. His schooling's been good and I think he's going to be a nice horse. 19-03-25

runners.name: Joining Force
runners.comment: Kept on well for second over C&D last month and has another big role to play today
runners.spotlight: Shaped with promise on hurdling debut in the autumn and stuck to his task pretty well when second over C&D (good) last month; that form already puts him on the premises today, and he has scope to improve again.

runners.name: Loch Frisa
runners.comment: No match for winner when second in modest C&D maiden last month; improvement needed
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability when fourth of seven at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) in February, his second hurdle run, but was no match for winner when odds-on for modest C&D maiden last month and needs the first-time visor to generate improvement today.

runners.name: Monty Bodkin
runners.comment: Bumper winner; both hurdle runs this season were promising, and he's a big player here
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground bumper winner for Ben Pauling last season; shaped with much more promise than eventual 25l defeat might suggest on stable/hurdle debut at Carlisle in November and was running big race before last-flight fall at Huntingdon (also 2m4f, good to soft) last month; leading contender.

stable_tour.quote: He had some good form in bumpers and looks like a nice horse to have in the yard. He jumps really well at home, looks like a stayer and we're looking forward to going over hurdles this season. 06-11-24

runners.name: New Invention
runners.comment: Raced a bit too freely but still made quite promising hurdle debut at Newcastle
runners.spotlight: From a good jumping family; raced a bit too freely but still displayed significant promise when fourth of ten at Newcastle (2m1f, good to soft) in February; likely to build on that performance at some stage; market may guide today.

runners.name: Presenting Milan
runners.owner: Mrs D Dewbery Mrs Dj Brown Mrs R Nelmes

prev_owners.owner: Mrs D Dewbery & Mrs D J Brown

runners.comment: Hereford bumper winner; not disgraced in Listed bumper last time; e-w claims here
runners.spotlight: Delivered on earlier promise when winning good-ground Hereford bumper in November and was not disgraced in Listed Ascot bumper (good to soft) the following month; makes hurdling debut after four-month break but ought to be suited by the step up in trip; considered each-way.

runners.name: Walden
runners.breeder: E A R L La Teerre Aux Duex Lunes Et Al
runners.comment: Placed in Huntingdon maiden in January but well beaten in a subsequent handicap
runners.spotlight: Twice in the frame over hurdles for new stable this season, latterly when third in Huntingdon maiden (2m, good to soft) in January; has each-way claims if in same form over this longer trip but last month's handicap debut was very disappointing.

runners.name: Raincloud
runners.comment: Ran well when third of five over C&D last month but the form is modest
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles; gave good account and finished ahead of two of today's rivals when third of five over C&D (good; first-time tongue-tie) last month but the form is modest.

runners.name: Charlie Baloo
runners.comment: Did not achieve a great deal when fourth of five over C&D on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Made low-key bumper debut last month and did not achieve a great deal when fourth of five in subsequent C&D maiden hurdle.

runners.name: Greatness Awaits
runners.comment: Two handicap wins this year; also ran well when second in recent seller; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Won consecutive 2m handicaps from the front in refitted blinkers in February/March (soft/good) and quickly rebounded from a lesser effort when second in Stratford seller (2m2f, good) three weeks ago; in the mix.

stable_tour.quote: A consistent run-of-the-mill handicapper. Coming back to 2m for those conditional hands and heels races suits him down to the ground and he's not far away from winning. 19-02-25

runners.name: Ikigai Star
runners.comment: Off since falling in December but was a dual 2m hurdle winner last year; a possible
runners.spotlight: Absent since fourth-flight fall in first-time cheekpieces (retained) in December but won twice over 2m on good ground last year and could plausibly have further improvement to come over today's longer trip.

runners.name: Zucayan
runners.comment: Placed all three starts since returning from layoff in February (2m-2m3f); obvious claims
runners.spotlight: Placed three consecutive times since returning from a break in February, most recently when second of 14 at Taunton (2m, good) last month; today's longer trip will also suit; obvious contender.

quotes.race: Racing To School Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Zucayan travelled very strongly and jumped the best he's jumped apart from two out, when he nearly took it with us. We always thought he had a good engine but his jumping didn't help in those novice hurdles - Nick Slatter, jockey.

runners.name: Sambezi
runners.breeder: Alban Chevalier Du Fau Et Al
runners.comment: Made big forward move from the rear when placed at Fontwell last month; 1lb lower here
runners.spotlight: Without a win since 2023 and no longer the force of old but made a big forward move from a long way off the pace when third at Fontwell (2m1f, good) last month and is another 1lb lower here; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: He had an improved run when eighth at Chepstow last time. He's dropped 1lb and we'll bring him back down to his own handicap level, where hopefully he can get his head in front again. He was running in a 0-115 race last time and it was encouraging. 18-12-24

runners.name: Aquitaine Boy
runners.comment: Placed twice over 2m4f since narrow win over that trip in January; a possible
runners.spotlight: Just held on at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) in January and was placed over that trip on last two outings; needs to prove himself on this right-handed track but will be fine on the forecast good ground; considered.

runners.name: Robbers Bridge
runners.comment: Dual winner in early part of season but this stable debut comes after a six-month absence
runners.spotlight: Won twice for Simon Earle in early part of this season (1m7f/2m4f) and is very versatile regarding ground but he disappointed when last in action and this stable debut comes after a six-month absence.

runners.name: Gms Prince
runners.comment: 0-15 over hurdles but has run well here on all three outings this year
runners.spotlight: 0-15 over hurdles but was third here twice at start of this year (2m/2m4f) and had every chance before last-flight fall over C&D (good) last month; recent 2lb nudge doesn't help but he ought to run well again.

runners.name: Red Trail
runners.comment: Well beaten all three starts for new stable this year; had wind op last month
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare with 0-11 strike-rate over hurdles; well beaten on all three starts for new stable this year (2m-2m4f) and needs recent wind op to have made a massive difference.

runners.name: Livano Bello
runners.comment: Placed in French claimer in September but only minor promise for new stable (three runs)
runners.spotlight: Placed in slow-ground claiming hurdle on debut in France in September but has shown only minor promise on his three starts for Micky Hammond (2m-2m1f); fitted with tongue-tie for handicap debut; needs to up his game.

runners.name: Takes Time
runners.comment: Has cut little ice in juvenile/maiden hurdles; 7lb wrong for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability on the Flat for David Loughnane but has cut little ice in three juvenile/maiden hurdles for current stable and is 7lb out of the weights for this handicap debut; significant improvement required.

runners.name: Macho Sun
runners.comment: Has basement mark on the Flat now and is yet to show any significant hurdling ability
runners.spotlight: Has a basement mark on the Flat nowadays and did not show any significant promise on his first three hurdling starts (1m7f-2m1f); makes handicap hurdle debut from 11lb out of the weights.

3:10.race_name: Watch On Racing TV Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Just Her Type
runners.comment: Went close on hurdling debut and last month's Wetherby fifth was perfectly respectable
runners.spotlight: Went very close on hurdling debut at Ayr (2m4f, soft) in January and put a lesser effort behind her when very respectable fifth at Wetherby (2m3f, good) last month, only fading out of contention on the run-in; raced a bit too freely last time so this drop in trip could be a good move in the short term; wears first-time tongue-tie; features prominently in calculations.

runners.name: One Colour
runners.comment: Dual bumper winner in 2023 but very disappointing on Flat/over hurdles since
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner (once here) for Rae Guest in summer 2023 but her subsequent Flat form for Max Young has been very disappointing and she was tailed off over C&D (good) when tried over hurdles in September.

runners.name: Plus Point
runners.owner: Tim Cottier And Razor Ruddock Racing 1

prev_owners.owner: Tim Cottier And Razor Ruddock Racing 1

runners.comment: Fairly useful on the Flat but last month's stable/hurdle debut was rather disappointing
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful on the Flat at up to 2m for Harry Eustace but made rather disappointing stable/hurdle debut when well-held fifth at Doncaster (2m, good) last month and will need to take a good step forward here.

quotes.race: Follow @attheraces On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Newbury was a sort of fact-finding mission and we were pleasantly surprised Plus Point was up to winning over a mile and a quarter. We hoped there was improvement up to a mile and a half but, especially against one of Sir Mark's without a penalty, it was a bit of a question. She did it nicely. We were very much on weather watch. I think probably it was a two-way swing in that Sir Mark didn't want rain and we did. The ground is very much as important a factor to her as the trip. This is her time of year now and I hope she continues to improve - Harry Eustace, trainer.

runners.name: Rightofway
runners.comment: Made promising bumper debut in 2023 but well beaten in both bumpers this year
runners.spotlight: Quite promising fourth of 16 in soft-ground Warwick bumper in November 2023 but returned from long absence with two down-the-field bumper runs this year and has a lot to prove on this hurdling debut.

runners.name: The Secret Pearl
runners.comment: Drops in grade after creditable sixth of 15 in Grade 2 novices' handicap at Newbury
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on heavy ground two starts ago (breathing issue reported) but bounced back with creditable sixth of 15 in Grade 2 novices' handicap at Newbury (2m4f, good) last month; should be okay back at 2m; big player.

runners.name: Chevelle
runners.comment: Showed ability on Flat in France but posed no threat on stable/hurdle debut in October
runners.spotlight: Showed significant ability (albeit without winning) on the Flat in France but posed no threat on stable/hurdle debut at Ludlow (2m, good) in October; had two wind operations during subsequent six-month break and returns with tongue-tie fitted; others look much safer.

runners.name: Icecap
runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive when 250-1 for stable/hurdle debut in December
runners.spotlight: A disappointing maiden on the Flat for Patrick Owens last year and struggled to get competitive when 250-1 for stable/hurdle debut in December.

runners.name: Ninna Collina
runners.comment: Not beaten far in three junior hurdles; a possible if today's faster ground suits
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in three junior hurdles, most recently when third of seven at Wetherby (2m, soft) in February, and has possibilities if suited by the faster ground here.

runners.name: Sharona
runners.comment: It's questionable what she achieve when second in small-field hurdle last month
runners.spotlight: Won three-runner Flat maiden (7f, soft; RPR 72) for Peter Chapple-Hyam in October 2023 but, after a long absence, it's questionable what she achieved when second in small-field novice hurdle at Catterick (1m7f, good; 1-16 favourite fell) for new stable last month.

5:30.race_name: Get Daily Tips At racingtv.com Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.name: American Empire
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mr G J Freyne
runners.comment: Beaten about 8l in bumpers at Lingfield (AW) and Catterick (good to soft)
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 8l in bumpers at Lingfield (AW) and Catterick (good to soft); may need more if he's to make it third time lucky but that's feasible.

runners.name: Click On The Link
runners.comment: Running well at his point of departure in both the Irish points he contested
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in his Irish points but was in contention when brought down on first occasion and held every chance when departing in the latest; clearly has some ability.

runners.name: Corra Bheinn
runners.comment: First run at Huntingdon was better than the second when ridden by a 10lb claimer
runners.spotlight: Both runs at Huntingdon; held up in a slowly run race on debut and was never dangerous, while when beaten further back there last month he was partnered by a 10lb claimer; should have a better effort in him.

runners.name: Exiguus
runners.comment: Finished a remote fourth of seven runners here two months ago when 28-1
runners.spotlight: Finished a remote fourth of seven runners here two months ago when 28-1.

runners.name: Ned Hill
runners.comment: Stayed on for fourth at Wetherby after finding some trouble in running
runners.spotlight: 170,000euros 3yo; had wind surgery and was tongue tied for debut at Wetherby where he stayed on into fourth after finding some trouble in running; should improve and his yard has won this bumper twice in three years.

runners.name: Crest Of Stars
runners.comment: Midfield in a Listed bumper at Cheltenham and that was an encouraging start
runners.spotlight: Well related; it wasn't a strong Listed bumper in which he finished midfield at Cheltenham but that was still an encouraging start; improvement is on the cards.

2:07.race_name: Play At The Races Stableduel EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Blue To Blue
runners.comment: Classy pedigree a mixture of speed and stamina; yard respected with 2yos; check betting
runners.spotlight: April foal; 46,000euros yearling; seventh foal; by Blue Point; closely related to 2m1f Flat (RPR 77) and 2m hurdle/chase winner Hazran, half-brother to winners Haziya (Listed-placed 1m; 102) and Hazalaya (7f/7.4f; 88); dam 7f winner (81), half-sister to Derby winner Harzand; pedigree a mixture of speed and stamina; market can guide for yard with strong 2yo record.

quotes.race: Play At The Races Stableduel EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that. Blue To Blue isn't a horse who shows loads at home. He's a nice horse and he was ready to run but he saves a bit for himself, the way he jumped a shadow in the first furlong and he ran on well once he got a smack behind the saddle, it's the first time he's ever had that. He can only improve for the run. I said to the owner before the race he'll be better over six furlongs - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Red Savitar
runners.breeder: Hellwood Stud Farm & R C Dollar
runners.comment: Â£75,000 yearling; speedy pedigree; tongue tied for debut; market helpful
runners.spotlight: February foal; Â£75,000 yearling; by Lope Y Fernandez; fourth foal; half-brother to winners including Purosangue (5f/6f 2yo including Listed; RPR 112) and Tropical Storm (5f 2yo Listed; 102); dam prolific 5f/6f winner (98), half-sister to useful 5f winner Tumblewind; sharp pedigree but tongue tied already; market helpful; holds some sales-race entries later.

runners.name: Somebody
runners.comment: Ran fast until fading on Leicester debut; should know more this time and last longer
runners.spotlight: He wasn't completely ignored in the betting (13-2) for debut behind short-priced Karl Burke newcomer at Leicester 16 days ago and ran fast to past halfway; should know more this time and last longer.

runners.name: Rotokura Belle
runners.comment: 66-1 for recent Redcar debut when showing plenty of pace but hung left closing stages
runners.spotlight: Sprint-bred filly; 66-1 for recent Redcar debut where she showed plenty of pace but hung left inside the final furlong and conceded ground; should be capable of better.

runners.name: Shetakesthegold
runners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
runners.comment: Outsider of three on C&D debut; signs of inexperience but also ability; can improve
runners.spotlight: Dam bred winners at 5f-1m, including on Tapeta; the outsider of three on C&D debut when showing signs of inexperience but also ability despite being well held by an impressive newcomer (second well beaten since); capable of stepping up on that, especially given experience of the surface; holds sales-race entries later.

runners.name: Rambuso Creek
runners.comment: Yet to fire for current stable but has lots of ability and return of headgear is a plus
runners.spotlight: Not short of ability but inconsistent for his former yard and he's yet to shine in two runs for new connections; dangerous mark and fully effective over C&D so can't be ruled out with cheekpieces now refitted.

runners.name: Jesse Luc
runners.comment: Four wins this year and placed over C&D the last twice; big player with Rossa Ryan booked
runners.spotlight: He has made fine progress this year, winning four times and placed over C&D on his last two starts; continues to climb the handicap but Rossa Ryan gets on well with him and he's high on the list.

runners.name: Swiss Ace

prev_owners.owner: The Bottom Liners & Mrs R Carr
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Should be well treated but he has been underperforming of late; best at 7f too
runners.spotlight: Should be making a big impact off this mark but there have been a few false dawns since November; all British wins over 7f and others appeal more for the win.

stable_tour.quote: We all know what aeat sire Kingman is but not everyone remembers Swiss Lake, who was a two-time Listed winner. Despite hereeding, Swiss Ace still has a lot to prove being without a win since December 2023. Finished mid-division at Redcar on Monday and should progress. 09-04-25

runners.name: Mattice
runners.owner: C Ward, B Kirby & B Valentine
runners.comment: 0-4 on AW but a repeat of any of those Tapeta runs would give him leading claims
runners.spotlight: Dropped away in the final furlong on reappearance at Doncaster (5f, good) recently; attracted support so the run might not have been needed but he's on a dangerous mark and AW record of 0-4 is slightly misleading as he's recorded RPRs of 89, 83, 72 and 74; fully effective at 6f and high on the list.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Bronze Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Mattice is only a three-year-old and there could be some good days for him in the future - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Sibyl Charm
runners.comment: Not built on February's promising 3rd in two runs since; wind surgery since latest; chance
runners.spotlight: Looked ready to strike when third at Newcastle in February but two subsequent runs have been disappointing; she's had wind surgery since the latest run and lurks on a dangerous mark.

stable_tour.quote: She did really well for us on the all-weather, then had a break and ran all right at Ayr and Carlisle since she came back. She wants top of the ground and I hope we're in for a dry spell as she has a couple of good options at York. 26-07-24

runners.name: Yoshimi
runners.comment: Three AW wins since October, the latest over C&D; 2lb higher; yard also runs Rambuso Creek
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins since October, the latest over C&D in January; up 2lb; stable also runs Rambuso Creek.

runners.name: Profit Street
runners.owner: D Jenkins J Glover R Odonnell J Short
runners.comment: On a dangerous mark but it's been a mixed bag this winter and others look safer
runners.spotlight: In and out on AW this winter; should be making a big impact off this lowly mark but that applies to a number of these.

runners.name: Madame Fenella
runners.comment: Perhaps needed the run when last seen in February; others have more pressing claims
runners.spotlight: Looked in need of the run at Newcastle in February; 7lb lower than for her last win but others have more pressing claims.

quotes.race: Raceday Afternoon Tea Sunday 9th July Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Madame Fenella always shapes as if she is going to get further but she's a proper six furlong horse. I might run her at Newmarket next Friday night under a penalty - Derek Shaw, trainer.

runners.name: Blackwaterfoot
runners.comment: Some promise in two AW runs but improvement necessary if he's to make a significant impact
runners.spotlight: Minor promise in his two runs (stable debut in February) but improvement necessary if he's to play anything more than a supporting role.

runners.name: Man Of Desert
runners.comment: Half-brother to a Derby winner; shaped nicely on sole 3yo run; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Derby winner Desert Crown; attracted some support (9-2 joint second favourite) on his Ffos Las debut last July (1m, good to soft) and shaped quite nicely with a view to the future; open to improvement but he'll need Nebras to underperform.

runners.name: Waiting For Tom
runners.comment: Two heavy defeats over further last September; can't be recommended
runners.spotlight: Two heavy defeats over further last September; can't be recommended.

runners.name: Nebras
runners.comment: Newmarket maiden winner on debut; seventh in Group 1 three weeks later; golden opportunity
runners.spotlight: Overcame inexperience to make a winning debut in a 1m maiden at Newmarket last October; pitched into the Group 1 Futurity at Doncaster three weeks later and came up short but he's clearly highly regarded and he's still entered in the 2000 Guineas and Derby; AW unlikely to hold any terrors and it will take a smart newcomer to lower his colours.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: John and Thady Gosden expected Nebras to finish second or third, so he's surprised us a bit. Whether he runs again this year we don't yet know - Teddy Grimthorpe, racing manager to the owner.

runners.name: Arctic Grey
runners.comment: 80,000gns yearling; dam a well-related 6f winner; tackles a smart opponent on debut
runners.spotlight: 80,000gns yearling; by Dark Angel; fifth foal; dam 6f winner (RPR 73), sister to 1m Group 2 winner Penitent and 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Supplicant; up against a smart opponent on debut.

runners.name: Rogue Millions
runners.comment: 130,000gns yearling; dam a Group 2 winner; entered in the Derby; check the betting
runners.spotlight: 130,000gns yearling; second foal; dam a 6f 2yo/1m Group 2 winner (RPR 110), herself from a good family; entered in the Derby; interesting prospect for the season and market confidence would look significant given he has a high standard to aim at.

runners.name: San Munoz
runners.comment: Some promise in two runs last autumn but plenty more needed to take this; has been gelded
runners.spotlight: Two runs last autumn (6f, soft and 1m, Tapeta) weren't without hope but he'll need to be a different proposition after a gelding operation if he is to take this.

runners.name: Typhoon Dancer
runners.comment: Bred to be useful on AW but this isn't an easy starting point
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to winners Excel Power (6f-1m including AW; RPR 108), Caspian Queen (Group-placed 5f-7f including 2yo/AW; 96), Barging Thru (5f-7f AW; 91) and Our Melody (5f AW; 64); dam unplaced 6f/7f (44); likely type on paper but this isn't an easy starting point.

2:42.race_name: Grace And Dotty Fedora's And Feathers Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Morlaix
runners.comment: On a losing run and off for a year; right down weights and has C&D form; new yard
runners.spotlight: Ex-David Simcock; losing run goes back three years and he's been off for a year but he has won on Fibresand here and was 22lb higher than today than when going close over C&D in 2022; likely to need a run or two but worth looking out for with the future in mind.

runners.name: Eva Rosie
runners.comment: Not had many chances at this sort of trip; two 1m2f Newcastle wins in 2025; respected
runners.spotlight: She's not had a lot of chances at this sort of trip and has been in fine form this year, winning her second 1m2f race at Newcastle more readily than the neck margin suggests; up 3lb; didn't appear beaten by the 1m3f trip here the time before and looks worth another go at it; good claims.

runners.name: Limmortale

prev_owners.owner: Ms Ciara Doyle & M C Grassick

runners.comment: Did well to win 1m2f Lingfield classified; lacked pace over 1m since; remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Overcame a troubled passage when getting up late to win a 1m2f classified at Lingfield on second start for this yard but he just couldn't pick up over the shorter trip at Wolverhampton (about 1m) next time; unraced here but acts on Tapeta and remains of interest with more suitable test.

runners.name: Irv
runners.comment: Weighted to win another AW race but below best at the end of 2024; returns from break
runners.spotlight: Weighted to win another race on the AW but he wasn't at his best when back from a break towards the end of 2024, including over C&D, and returns from another one today; others look more likely.

runners.name: Absolutely Not
runners.comment: Minor form since promising debut as 3yo and faded on handicap debut at about 1m; new trip
runners.spotlight: Promising debut last spring but she completed her qualifying runs with two minor efforts and, although worth a go at this trip on pedigree, she didn't look to be wanting to go any further when not finding much on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (extended 1m) in March.

runners.name: Sun Festival
runners.comment: Creditable classified runs at up to 1m2f; first 1m3f run for 2 years raises stamina query
runners.spotlight: Has been running creditably in classified events on Tapeta but he had no answer to L'Immortale's burst over 1m2f at Lingfield last month and this first 1m3f run for two years raises stamina questions.

runners.name: Aye Spyed
runners.comment: Had very few chances but never involved on handicap debut over 1m2f; now hooded
runners.spotlight: Only lightly raced but was never involved on handicap debut at Chelmsford (1m2f; 40-1) in November and needs lots more for the extra furlong and first-time hood.

runners.name: Sunset In Paris
runners.comment: Five AW wins; solid third in 1m2f classified latest; R Ryan 3-4 on him
runners.spotlight: Five AW wins at about 1m2f; fair fourth in Wolverhampton classified in February and no quarter given at Lingfield (1m2f) since, albeit L'Immortale would have been an unlucky loser; has 4lb weights turnaround and Rossa Ryan is 3-4 on him; still queries about this trip and surface switch.

runners.name: Rampant
runners.comment: Maiden; in good form; similar weights chance to Eva Rosie on 1m2f form; query about 1m3f
runners.spotlight: Not yet managed a win but in good form for this yard and in theory there shouldn't be much between him and Eva Rosie on Newcastle form (1m2f) last month; has more to prove on previous runs at 1m3f, though.

runners.name: Anticipating
runners.comment: Maiden; not yet looked like capitalising on a falling mark; has work to do
runners.spotlight: Maiden who has a race in her on best 1m3f efforts on turf for previous yard but she hasn't as yet looked like taking advantage of a falling mark, including in cheekpieces (retained) latest.

runners.name: Anificas Beauty
runners.comment: Three AW wins at 6f-7f; lightly raced now; trip query again after fading over 2m latest
runners.spotlight: Three Chelmsford wins at 6f-7f; lightly raced these days and the big step up to 2m here last time was always likely to pose a problem; seems likely to find this trip too far as well.

runners.name: Kittens Dream

prev_owners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton

runners.comment: Multiple winner at up to 2m but on losing run and doesn't beat many now
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner at up to 2m but he's on a losing run and doesn't beat many now; all to prove.

5:02.race_name: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Handicap

runners.name: Arc Shadowfax
runners.comment: Running with credit lately but still to prove his stamina over this far
runners.spotlight: Redcar maiden winner (6f, good) as a 2yo and has been running with credit lately, as when third of nine at Newcastle (6f) on his return to this stable last month; still to prove his stamina over this far, though.

runners.name: King Sharja
runners.comment: Finished a neck behind Thanks Dad on is reappearance over C&D; may reverse the form
runners.spotlight: Was back off his last winning mark when running Thanks Dad to a neck over C&D last month; unlike that rival he was returning from an absence so no surprise if he turns the form around; player.

stable_tour.quote: I thought hevery unlucky the other day at Southwell when he dwelt at the start and had to weave his way through, coming with a late lunge which nearly won him the race. As it is he had to settle for second. That race came after a long wintereak, so I'm hopeful there's much more to come. He likes the extended 7f at Beverley and he's feasibly handicapped. 09-04-25

runners.name: Rusheen Boy
runners.comment: 0-11 since winning twice over 6f here at the end of 2023 and is still 4lb higher
runners.spotlight: Often a front-runner; 0-11 since winning twice over 6f here at the end of 2023 and is still 4lb higher; has run well over this far, but below form lately and others make greater appeal.

runners.name: Thanks Dad
runners.comment: Held off King Sharja when getting off the mark over C&D last time; frame material
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who made all when off the mark at the 17th attempt over C&D last month, holding off King Sharja by a neck; may struggle to confirm form with the runner-up, but still frame material; stable also runs Royal Justice.

runners.name: Al Suil Eile
runners.breeder: Thierry De La Heronniere & Jedburgh Stud
runners.comment: Has won seven times here including twice on Fibresand, but looks best over 1m; visor on
runners.spotlight: Has won seven times here (including twice on Fibresand), the latest over 1m last month; does seem better suited to that trip these days, though, so has enough to prove from the outside draw with a visor belatedly given a go.

quotes.race: Boosts Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: I couldn't understand the price, we thought this was a penalty kick. Al Suil Eile was entered at Wolverhampton but this extra meeting came on and it was perfect for him. It felt like a gift really. He's been a star for us this year. He's taken a while and he's had his problems but this year his joints and everything are good. He'll come back to Southwell for a 0-70 on the Sunday night, March 10. It's treble the prize money and it's the same sort of race. I can't see the handicapper going too mad, a couple more pounds maybe and that will be fine. - Shaun Harris, trainer.

runners.name: Al Baahy
runners.comment: Has become expensive to follow and a record of 1-38 is hardly inspiring
runners.spotlight: Looks favourably treated on the pick of his form since returning in November, but he has become expensive to follow and a record of 1-38 is hardly inspiring.

runners.name: Lady In Havana
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.comment: 6lb below last winning mark and caught the eye on her recent return here; respected
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye when fourth of ten on her return from a break over 6f here this month and may have finished even closer with a clearer run; 6lb lower than when winning over C&D early last year; respected.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Lady In Havana has learned quite a lot but the penny is still dropping and hopefully we can have a nice, fun winter with her. Every stride she took the penny was dropping more and she'll be an exciting prospect for the team - Laura Pearson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Aspire To Glory
runners.comment: Has won two of his last three starts; a player from 2lb higher
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who has been in good form lately, winning on Tapeta at Wolverhampton (8.6f) in February and Newcastle (7f) last month (pulled his chance away over 1m here in between); a player from 2lb higher.

runners.name: Royal Justice
runners.comment: 0-8 and has been well held in three visits here; look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: 0-8 and has been well held in three visits here, finishing well behind Thanks Dad and King Sharja last time; look elsewhere.

runners.name: Balmy Breese
runners.comment: In the frame in a few 0-50 classified events at Wolverhampton this year, but is 0-27
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame in a few 0-50 classified events at Wolverhampton this year, but is 0-27; others more persuasive.

runners.name: Barneys Bay
runners.breeder: Highclere Stud & Mr Ilyas Emir Karadag
runners.comment: Inconsistent and has become very hard to win with (3-50)
runners.spotlight: One of his better recent efforts when beaten a neck over C&D in February, but is inconsistent and has become very hard to win with (3-50).

runners.name: Tilsworth Max
runners.comment: 0-14 under rules and doesn't look a winner waiting to happen
runners.spotlight: 0-14 under rules and although not beaten far at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) on his penultimate start, doesn't look a winner waiting to happen.

runners.name: Rainbow Mirage
runners.comment: Has won seven races, including four on the AW, but losing run up to 21
runners.spotlight: Seven wins, including four on the AW, but losing run up to 21 and her close third of 11 here (1m) in September looked a flash in the pan.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Handicap
quotes.quote: They went hard enough up front which suited Rainbow Mirage and I'm pleased to win on my first ride for the stable - George Rooke, jockey.

runners.name: Enchanted Way
runners.comment: In the frame in five of her six starts; should go well again
runners.spotlight: In the frame in five of her six starts and was only beaten a length into fourth of 12 on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last month; the first two haven't really advertised the form since, but she should go well again.

runners.name: Threatening
runners.comment: Open to progress now handicapping, but may not come into his own until tackling further
runners.spotlight: Not without promise in his last two starts in AW novices and open to progress now making his handicap debut after three months off, but he may not come into his own until tackling further.

runners.name: Dr Ali
runners.comment: In the frame in all three starts for this yard, but may be better over 6f
runners.spotlight: In the frame in all three starts for this yard since switched to AW handicaps, including when second of six at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) on his penultimate outing, but he may be better over 6f.

runners.name: Weve Got This
runners.comment: Makes her debut for her new yard after five months off; market should be informative
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in four of five starts for Craig Lidster last year, including when fourth of 12 over C&D on final outing; makes her debut for new yard after five months off and the market should be informative.

runners.name: Adelaide Bay
runners.owner: Mrs B V Sangster & Jane Chapple Hyam
runners.comment: Won well on his recent return at Chelmsford; 8lb higher but is capable of more
runners.spotlight: Didn't show much in four starts last year (well backed final outing) but having been off for six months and gelded he made a successful handicap debut in great style at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) 17 days ago; handicapper didn't miss him with an 8lb rise but Warren Fentiman's 5lb claim will help and he looks capable of more.

3:17.race_name: Grace And Dotty Fedora's And Feathers Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Lednikov
runners.comment: Often front-runner; two wins here this year; not ruled out despite a lesser show last time
runners.spotlight: Often front-runner and ridden since October by Elle-May Croot; last four wins have been at this track, two this year, and he's not ruled out despite a lesser show here 12 days ago.

quotes.race: BetUK's Acca Club Â£5 Free Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a furlong shorter today and Lednikov needed every stride, but Joey gave him a great ride. The horse is very genuine, he gives his best all the time, and he's versatile - Ivan Furtado, trainer.

runners.name: The Pug
runners.comment: Inconsistent but it's possible that the return here will receive a positive response
runners.spotlight: All three wins were in 2023, two over C&D; inconsistent since, for instance placed twice from six starts in the current winter/autumn campaign but none of those races were at Southwell and it's possible that the return here will receive a positive response.

runners.name: Trusty Scout
runners.comment: Most runs two winters back read well; promising return 13 days ago from more than year off
runners.spotlight: Most runs two winters back read well, including over C&D, and he made a promising return 13 days ago from more than a year off; shortlist.

runners.name: Lhebayeb
runners.comment: Front-runner at Wolverhampton last three starts, including for a win and a close second
runners.spotlight: Front-runner at Wolverhampton last three starts; ended a long losing run last month and probably bettered that performance when second 11 days later; there was a heavy defeat over C&D four starts back but she's back in the good books now.

runners.name: Ring Fenced
runners.comment: Cheekpieces twice in 2023, her only win on first occasion; now sports first-time blinkers
runners.spotlight: Sole win (19 races) was in January 2023 but she missed chunks of last season and continues to fall in the weights; wore cheekpieces twice in 2023, for her only win on first occasion, and now sports first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Nasim
runners.comment: 2nd in a 1m4f Lingfield classified on latest outing when tongue tied for the second time
runners.spotlight: It's more than two years since he ran at this track (has won here) and even longer since he won, but he's well down the weights and was runner-up in a 1m4f Lingfield classified on latest outing when tongue tied for the second time; considered for a place.

runners.name: The Ormer Gatherer
runners.comment: 0-18 before scoring by a neck in last-gasp fashion at 80-1 in 1m2f classified at Lingfield
runners.spotlight: 0-18 (including five starts on Jersey) before he scored by a neck in last-gasp fashion at 80-1 in a classified at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) four weeks ago on second run for David Bridgwater; that was also his second run since a long absence; 1m3f looks well worth a go and he's in contention.

runners.name: Making A Move
runners.comment: New trip needs to spark something if he's to get off the mark at this 11th attempt
runners.spotlight: Close third in 1m Newcastle classified in January and there was an echo of that in his latest run, but this new trip (he tried 1m2f once) needs to spark something if he's to get off the mark at this 11th attempt.

runners.name: Bay Of Naples

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Plenty of competitive shows at this track, latest three starts ago, but others appeal more
runners.spotlight: His three wins here were in the old Fibresand days and he's not scored anywhere since September 2023; plenty of competitive shows at this track, the latest three starts ago, and his usual tongue-tie (absent last time) returns but others appeal more for win purposes.

quotes.race: It's National Racehorse Week Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Bay Of Naples was suited by the way the race was run today. They got racing a long way out before coming back to him and he stayed on well ? he gets a bit further. Connor (Planas) hasn't panicked and gave him a lovely ride - Michael Herrington, trainer.

runners.name: Aeroplane Mode
runners.comment: 0-13; close third to The Ormer Gatherer in a 1m2f Lingfield classified and has place hopes
runners.spotlight: 0-13 overall, with a year off before this season; close third in a Lingfield classified (1m2f) on latest outing and he stayed on well, not so well as winner The Ormer Gatherer but there are place hopes.

runners.name: Exceptionality
runners.comment: 18-race maiden and he's not beaten many at big odds in recent outings
runners.spotlight: 18-race maiden who has yet to finish closer than 6l to the winner and he's not beaten many at big odds in recent outings.

4:05.race_name: BetGoodwin Sussex Champion Hurdle Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
4:05.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to soft in places; watered; Chs 7.2, Hdl 6.7)

runners.name: Daddy Long Legs
runners.comment: Ninth in the County Hurdle but he never threatened after losing his place mid-race
runners.spotlight: One of four for title-chasing Willie Mullins; his overall profile is hit and miss and, with this tight track in mind, it's worrying that he lost his position in the County Hurdle before running on into ninth; dropped a measly 1lb for that.

quotes.race: Horse & Jockey Hotel Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Daddy Long Legs being back to a flat track and quick ground suited him. He's in graded territory now. I don't know if he's good enough for those good Grade 1s but that's the sea he is swimming in now - David Casey, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Killashee Hotel Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Daddy Long Legs wasn't up to soft ground in the winter and looks in a different league on this ground. He is a good horse I think. With the pace he showed he could easily go back on the Flat - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Butty Bach Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: His last two runs, Daddy Long Legs just struggled on the really heavy ground. He'll be one to go through the summer and could be a high-class Flat handicapper. He possibly could be a Galway Hurdle horse - Patrick Mullins, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Killinan Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Daddy Long Legs is smart, he quickened well. He had been working well, he felt a natural from the first time I schooled him. He won as we hoped he won - Paul Townend, rider

stable_tour.quote: He's been busy this year and was fifth in the Morgiana on Saturday. We'll see how he comes out of that before making a plan for him. 25-11-24

runners.name: Absurde
runners.comment: High in the weights but every chance with a repeat of his third in the County Hurdle
runners.spotlight: Travelled best throughout when winning last year's County Hurdle at the Cheltenham Festival and was third in this year's renewal off an 8lb higher mark (few of these behind), having previously finished fifth in the Melbourne Cup; nudged up another 2lb but should cope with this tight track; Harry Cobden won last week's Scottish National for the yard; major player; often held up.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Sussex Champion Hurdle Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The plan was to jump in and get Absude settled as he's had a tendency to be keen in the past. They went nice and fast early, so I didn't have any problems there and he settled well and jumped brilliantly. I thought Harry Skelton would take me into the race, so I followed him everywhere and winged the third-last and it was just a case of keeping him insulated either side up the home straight.  When you're on a horse with so much class it's easy. He's got so many options, you'd have a lot of fun owning him.

quotes.race: Lexus Melbourne Cup (Group 1 Handicap) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Absurde ran a cracker considering he got shuffled back further than anticipated and Kerrin wanted to be. He had to ride the race presented to him and he rode a terrific race to get back up to be fifth. We'll keep coming back if we have the ammunition and I think Absurde will return. The owners are keen as they've had a wonderful time. We've bought a few new horses that might make into Melbourne Cup horses, so the quest is still on - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: BetMGM County Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: What a horse to travel the world and come back and put in a performance like that on that ground. It's funny because we hacked round, but that got them racing early enough because everyone was aware we were going so slow and wanted to get in a position. I thought Absurde would have the pace of them all on his Flat form and, if he handled the ground, he had a big chance, but the ground was a big worry. I was able to go out and take a chance and it's nice to be able to do that from time to time - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Lexus Melbourne Cup (Group 1 Handicap) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I thought Absurde ran a cracker. He was in a position to win at one stage coming up the straight but didn't see it out - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Ebor Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Frankie's shown us what he can do. I thought Absurde was beaten half a furlong down but I don't know where Frankie got the energy to get him up in the last 100 yards. He pulled it out of the fire, he was brilliant. I'll have to have a word with the owners, who couldn't be here, and we'll see if they're interested in going down [under] but I'm sure they'd love to go - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a long trip to Melbourne and ran great down there again. He might end up going out to Saudi Arabia for a valuable Flat race next. Maybe he still has a mark over hurdles which could see him repeat his exploits from Cheltenham last season in the County Hurdle. We'll see. 25-11-24

runners.name: Sir Gerhard
runners.comment: Not as good as he was but still capable and now running in his first handicap
runners.spotlight: Former top-notcher who has understandably lost some of his old zip at the age of ten, but didn't run too badly in a Grade 3 last time and cheekpieces are fitted for his first handicap of any description; can't be ruled out.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sir Gerhard is a very good horse and this was a nice race for him. He jumped well, especially down the straight, and had plenty of class back in trip - Sean O'Keeffe, rider

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee Available On Course & Tote.ie Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sir Gerhard has got his confidence back over hurdles and we might just stick to them for this season and go the Stayers' Hurdle route. It might be the way to go rather than sticking to fences. He jumped well at Naas up to the time he fell and it took him a while to recover from the fall. That's why we went this route and it's the route he will stay for this season. I thought looking at him going to the start that he looked big and well so I'm hoping there will be more improvement again - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: On the way round I didn't think Sir Gerhard could be jumping any better, he felt absolutely brilliant. Unfortunately he ended up on the ground. We'll have to see how he is but his confidence and everything did not need that - Paul Townend, jockey.

quotes.race: Daly Farrell Chartered Accountants Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: It'll be too soon to run again so Sir Gerhard will probably go there on today's run. I think we'll be going for a longer trip, he'd be going a couple of miles an hour slower than he would in the Arkle so there's the two and a half or three miles. He isn't in the National Hunt Chase. I think the three miles, the Brown Advisory, but you know me. He didn't impress me for the first mile and a half. I didn't know what to think. Paul (Townend) said to me after the race that he thought he was on a schooling day, he wasn't racing. After the fourth last when he sent him up the inside he said it clicked in and it was like turning on the turbo, he turned into a racehorse who wanted to race. From there it was very impressive and when Paul told me that, I thought it was a good performance then - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was absolutely delighted with Sir Gerhard and we thought this might suit him. He was a little freer than I thought he would be, but there was probably very little pace in the race early on. He was really lit up down the back straight but Paul (Townend) got him jumping at his hurdles and he won as he liked. He jumped like a professional today and he was just fantastic. He has plenty of stamina and he also has speed - he has everything - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Ireland Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Sir Gerhard was very green whereas at Christmas he was like a handicapper. He was all over the place heading out passing the stands on the final circuit, then Paul hit him a slap to try and get him to concentrate and he just took off. The second half of the race was good. The first half of the race was bad - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Thorntons Recycling Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Sir Gerhard is a very good jumper. I'd like to climb the ladder if I could but he might just have to go into a Graded race next, maybe the Dublin Racing Festival or something like that but I think he's up to it - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Champion Bumper (A Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sir Gerhard looks to be a natural. He's got a huge, long stride and Rachael let him enjoy himself. He was lugging out a bit with her and he's still a bit green but he's got a lot of natural ability. He's a fine, big, rangy individual, who should be made for jumping fences at some stage - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Flash Cashback "Future Champions" Flat Race (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Sir Gerhard handled the ground as good horses tend to do. His pedigree suggests he'll be better on some nicer ground, so roll on the spring - Jamie Codd, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: He is a nice horse. We might go to Navan now for that Listed bumper and see where we go from there - trainer Gordon Elliott.

stable_tour.quote: I have to admit I was disappointed with the way he ran in the Morgiana. I thought he would run a lot better than he did, so I was scratching my head afterwards. We'll probably mix it between hurdles and chases and, if the right chase popped up, I wouldn't be afraid to run him in it. But, as I said, he disappointed me on Saturday so we'll have to see how he is over the next few days. 25-11-24

He's a real Cheltenham Festival specialist, having won the Champion Bumper in 2021 and the Ballymore last year. He's had only one run this season when easily winning at Gowran Park on his chasing debut in January. But he's a real head-scratcher for me as his hurdles form is good enough to go anywhere, but at the moment I'd be thinking longer trips, as they go that bit slower. Over a longer trip they have more obstacles to jump and more opportunity to make a mistake. But I think with his lack of experience we could take our chance in the Brown Advisory. That's the way I'm leaning but a final decision has yet to be made. 08-03-23

runners.name: Tounsivator
runners.comment: Has struggled in handicaps since taking a notable scalp in a Grade 2 in December
runners.spotlight: Beating the top-class novice Romeo Coolio in a 2m Grade 2 in December (yielding) scuppered his handicap mark and he's struggled since, latterly when 50-1 for the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham last month.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Royal Bond Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I thought every horse that we ran had a chance if they ran their best race. Tounsivator might have had the fitness edge on them as he'd been running for us during the summer. The ground conditions probably suited him better today and I'm very happy with him. I'd imagine we'll go on to Christmas now - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Naas Racecourse Business Club Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tounsivator was a little bit keen coming from the Flat. To recover and win after standing on himself jumping the last was very impressive. There is plenty of room for improvement when he settles and jumps better. He will be dual purpose - Patrick Mullins, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Knickerbockerglory
runners.comment: Front-runner who wasn't beaten far in the Imperial Cup; this track should suit him
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in this 12 months ago on his sole previous visit to Plumpton (the only time he's worn cheekpieces); confined to only three runs in the meantime and wasn't beaten at all far off this mark in the Imperial Cup at Sandown, where it's never easy to make all; considered for title-chasing yard.

quotes.race: Seat Unique Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's great for Tristan and he gets on well with this horse. Knickerbockerglory has always promised to do well and he loves soft and heavy ground. We'll keep running in these handicaps over hurdles and hopefully he can have more success on this sort of ground - Tom Messenger, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a consistent two-mile handicap hurdler when the mud is flying. We're ready to run him and when it rains he'll be out.
