There's a Â£50,000 race at Sandown at the start of December that's got his name written all over it and he's also in at Fairyhouse in early December. He'd get further if we needed him to. 12-11-24

runners.name: Aurigny Mill
runners.comment: Came up shy off this career-high mark at Taunton and this is tougher again
runners.spotlight: Usually held up; has won two of his four starts for Robert Walford but came up shy off this career-high mark at Taunton (2m, good to soft) and this is tougher again.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetVictor Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I think they went too quickly, but I'm very pleased. Aurigny Mill looked the part - Robert Walford, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Boost Your Odds On Racing Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I've always thought Aurigny Mill was up at this level. This is the second run of his career that we have had a problem-free run up to. He had bruised feet all last season between every run, but we have got on top of all that. My son's partner rides him out most days and she said he was as good as ever, and she has got it right. Sean Bowen finished fourth on him in a bumper, and he said he would win loads of races, but he was backwards, and it took him time to get his breathing right. Fergus (Gillard) said he was off the bridle down the back straight, but he is settling now. He only had the hood on to help him settle. He is just a lovely horse - Victor Dartnall, trainer.

runners.name: Hansard
runners.comment: Only 1lb above his last winning mark but hasn't truly threatened this season
runners.spotlight: Only 1lb above his last winning mark but hasn't truly threatened this season and no better for cheekpieces the last twice, in the County Hurdle and then over 2m4f at Aintree; he wouldn't be the obvious answer here.

quotes.race: Bet In Race With Coral Intermediate Handicap Hurdle (Reg' As The Gerry Feilden) (Premier H'cap)(GBB)
quotes.quote: Hansard ran a very good race at Aintree last season, but is bigger and stronger now. I was slightly disappointed with him at Wincanton last time but he might have been beaten by a better horse, he was spot on today and looked sharper in the paddock, while his work had improved at home. He's a nice horse. There was pace in the race, which is what he wants as he's a strong traveller. He's in a valuable handicap hurdle at Ascot just before Christmas and he does all the right things so you'd think he could be a Graded horse, but he needs to improve again - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Looking Forward To HWPAs Tomorrow Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It looked a seriously hot race. When Hansard first went to Gary Moore's, the reports back were solid all the way through and I think we've got a very smart horse on our hands. Jamie Moore has done all the work schooling on him and has loved him from day one. He did so much wrong today and there's so much more to come from him. We might go to Kempton with him over Christmas [for a 2m novice Hurdle] and he's a very impressive four-year-old - David Crosse, owner's representative.

stable_tour.quote: He was meant to run in the County Hurdle last season but was a bit sore on the morning of the race. He needs soft/heavy ground and didn't get the opportunity to run again after that but he's a nice horse who has done well over the summer. We'll train him for the big handicap hurdles this winter and races like the Betfair Hurdle spring to mind. 29-10-24

He's been an absolute superstar. He won his first two over hurdles and ended up finishing fourth in the Grade 1 at Aintree in 2023. Last season he came back and was second in the Elite Hurdle. After that he won the Gerry Feilden and was fifth at Ascot in December. Unfortunately, he had a couple of niggles in the spring and has been off since. You don't quite get a full season out of him nowadays and he'll be trained a bit differently. He'll start in the Elite Hurdle again in November. He'll improve for that run and it should leave him spot on for a nice 2m handicap in December. The likes of the Betfair Hurdle, County Hurdle and then Aintree will also be on his agenda. Jumping fences might be an option as well. There's a bit more to come from him. 24-10-24

runners.name: Our Champ
runners.comment: Last year's winner off 13lb lower; good front-running sixth in the County Hurdle
runners.spotlight: 13lb lower when winning this 12 months ago and faces stronger opposition this time; however, he ran well from the front (as is his way) to be sixth in the County Hurdle and his running style is better suited to this sharper track; unlikely to get an easy lead but can see him hanging around to be competitive.

quotes.race: Foundation Developments Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger 2m Hurdle Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I came here pretty confident. I'm usually a pessimistic bugger but I rode Our Champ myself in a bit of work the other day with Aucunrisque and he went extremely well. We don't usually have them off the bridle but Aucunrisque was struggling and I weighed two stone more than the lad on him. There's loads of options for him. I might look at those novice Graded races as time goes on, he's a very experienced jumper and races like the Dovecote could be an option. He's got plenty of pace - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's doing great and will probably go for the Gerry Feilden Hurdle at Newbury on Coral Gold Cup day. He's done us proud. He was fantastic last time out at Ascot, so Newbury will be the aim as long as we get better ground still. I wouldn't want to run him on too soft; like Annual Invictus, he's a better-ground horse. After that we might look at something like the Betfair Exchange Trophy at Ascot next month. 25-11-24

He'll go for the County Hurdle and he'll run really well if it dries up. He's in good form and is in good order, but we'll want better ground with him than it was at Newbury for the William Hill Hurdle. If we get good ground at Cheltenham on the last day, he'll be handy and prominent and I'll be looking forward to a good run. 26-02-25

runners.name: Shes A Saint
runners.comment: Needs a strong pace at this trip, which she got when winning so well at Aintree; up 9lb
runners.spotlight: Smart novice who missed all of last season but looks better than ever judged on her comprehensive defeat of a well-backed novice in a deep handicap at Aintree (2m, good); reliant on a good pace at this trip (stays 3m) and she should get one here; 9lb higher than last time with Tristan Durrell again claiming 3lb.

quotes.race: Hallgarten And Novum Wines Handicap Hurdle (Conditional Jockeys'/Amateur Riders' Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I had a conversation with the two owners about an hour ago, and while I wasn't saying we definitely shouldn't run on the ground I wasn't convinced it was going to suit her. Deciding to run today is down to them and I take my hat off to them. I'm so proud of She's A Saint. It just shows what can happen when you give them a bit of time when it's needed. And she's got a great ride off Tristan [Durrell] as they've gone very hard in front - Dan Skelton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's taken her racing really well. She won the other day and was down at the last and then stayed on. She's got solid form behind Luccia. She'll be going and she'd have an outside chance. I'm happy with her. 12-2-23

runners.name: Spirit Daunou
runners.breeder: S C E A Du Moulin De Bel Oeuvre
runners.comment: Very solid effort when fifth in the County Hurdle and blinkers are tried this afternoon
runners.spotlight: Has got himself well handicapped again and he was always prominent when fifth in the County Hurdle; stays further than this so expect another forward ride and, with blinkers replacing cheekpieces worn for his last three races, he could have a part to play.

quotes.race: Racing Only Bettor Podcast Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Spirit D'Aunou was a four-year-old carrying a lot of weight out there so it wasn't going to be easy for him. He is still a baby learning and he is going to improve with racing and time. I'd like to think he would go to Ascot in early April for that (valuable juvenile) handicap there - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Times Is Out This Week Junior 'National Hunt' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: At Kempton Spirit D'Aunou didn't know how to go past the other horse and I was a little bit wary of that today because he is a baby. He's learned a bit from Kempton, jumped the well last and his experience from his first run and the 7lb has made the difference. How the form will work out I don't know but I'll take a win - Jamie Moore, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He won at the Tingle Creek meeting but felt the handicapper's wrath after that. We'll start him over hurdles at Ascot on Saturday and hopefully get the freshness out of him before going novice chasing. He's shown he stays two and a half miles well and has already schooled well over fences. We just need to take gas out of him and hopefully he can have a good season over fences. 29-10-24

runners.name: Afadil
runners.comment: Had turned a corner only to then flop at Aintree; the tongue-tie tried there is removed
runners.spotlight: Knows what these competitive handicaps are all about and had appeared to turn a corner with big runs at Musselburgh and Sandown only to then have a shocker at Aintree when reportedly never travelling; however, the first-time tongue-tie that joined his regular cheekpieces last time is now removed and that could be significant; possibilities despite being 2lb wrong.

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish County Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Afadil enjoyed the ground and was given a great ride by Freddie (Gingell). He'll have an entry in the County Hurdle but perhaps the conditional jockeys' race at Aintree might be the race for him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Remus Uomo Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought Afadil would win, we thought he was still quite nicely handicapped. He ran very well at Ascot, where we beat him with a 50-1 shot. He ran a bit free in front there so we dropped him in a bit today. He got a pound for Ascot, which I thought was okay, and he had a four-year-old's allowance. Whether he'll run again I don't know. The only possibility is the Swinton Hurdle. He's a tank of a horse and if he's in good form and we were happy, we could well look at it - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Invest Southwest Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Afadil will love the soft ground so I'd expect he'd go to Haydock and we'll try to keep them apart. He and Rare Middleton will get entries in the Triumph - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well when second at Musselburgh this month. He will be given an entry but would need the ground to be good to run and he's probably better on a flatter track, so Aintree may suit him better. 8-2-25

3:30.race_name: BetGoodwin Master Trainer Chris Gordon Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
3:30.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to soft in places; watered; Chs 7.2, Hdl 6.7)

runners.name: Unanswered Prayers
runners.comment: 3m3f winner earlier in season; on a competitive mark for trainer recognised in race title
runners.spotlight: Won over 3m3f earlier in the season and would prefer further ideally, but this is an easier race than Kempton's big February handicap over 3m he contested last time; on a competitive mark for trainer recognised in the race title.

quotes.race: SSS Super Alloys Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I loved the way Unanswered Prayers jumped. He's a three-mile chaser in the making and might well need some headgear in time to keep his mind on the job. He'd have loved a bit of company and looked around a bit on the run-in - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a really game performance from Unanswered Prayers and he's a gorgeous horse. I thought we were going to do it quite well from the second last but the other horse came back to him and it was a real scrap. I think there are two tough novices there. We might have one run with him this season, we'll see what he looks like. Looking forward to going chasing with him next season - Chris Gordon, trainer.

quotes.race: John Romans Park Homes Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tom gave Unanswered Prayers a peach and kept it straightforward. Paul Nicholls' horse [Flemenstide] looks a smashing horse but I thought we might have a little bit more toe when needed. I didn't think he'd go in the ground, I'd say good to soft would be ideal. We took the gamble and it paid off. I'm just trying to keep him all in one piece for chasing next season. I don't want to chuck him in a deep handicap, as the season goes on some of those novices can get a bit weaker so we might look to get a claimer on and go again under a double penalty. We want to choose an easy route this season - Chris Gordon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We might look at the cross-country race at Cheltenham in December. He's a really good jumper, as he showed in the Southern National, so I think he'll take to the fences well. My wife and I went cross-country with him and Aucunrisque and they both seemed to really enjoy it. At Fontwell he was lovely and he handled the trip really well. He's a funny character - he gets to the front and the brakes come on, so it can be a problem if he's left alone out front. But he stays well, which opens up a lot of options for him. 25-11-24

He had a nice win in the Southern National in November and then ran a blinder on ground that was very soft in the London National at Sandown. At Ascot in January over 3m they didn't really go quick enough for him but he still ran a nice race and finished well at the end. Then Freddie threw himself off him at Plumpton in the Sussex National, but at least he came back in and admitted he threw himself off him, and we couldn't blame the horse. He then ran in the old Racing Post Chase at Kempton on Saturday. It was disappointing as the ground went against him and he was pulled up, but we've had the flu jabs and maybe that knocked him a bit. He has entries in the Cross Country and the Kim Muir at Cheltenham but I don't think we'll be going there now. We'll try to find some better ground and ultimately look at the bet365 Gold Cup at the end of the season. He'd probably get some better ground there and you could see him running well in it. 26-02-25

runners.name: Hubrisko
runners.breeder: Scea De L'Aubay & Sc Couetil Elevage
runners.comment: Just one run of note for this yard following a long absence; now tries cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Formerly with Willie Mullins; had four runs for this yard following a long absence, easily the best when beaten 5l over nearly 3m at Musselburgh in February (good to soft); looking hard to predict and now tries cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Kenny Developments Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hubrisko jumped well and loves that ground. He quickened well and quickened again up the hill which is a good sign - Paul Townend, rider.

runners.name: Hidden Heroics
runners.comment: Current wellbeing is a worry and Harry Skelton is on the yard's other one
runners.spotlight: Nothing good to take out of his last three races, though the last two were over 2m4f and his last win was at 3m3f (off 1lb lower last summer); has the form to take a hand but current wellbeing is a worry and Harry Skelton is on the yard's other one.

quotes.race: Cheltenham & South-West Racing Club Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hidden Heroics jumped nicely, although he was a little bit out to his right. I ran him at Aintree at the start of the season and we dropped him in and he ran like a hippo with a hernia. It was awful. We said we will make the running over fences now and he is 2-2 and hasn't come off the bridle twice. We will find some more novice handicaps. I'm not going to step up dramatically in grade at the moment but come the spring time we might look at something like a Scottish Grand National - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.name: Hugos New Horse
runners.comment: Respected on his second here in December; just one run since when off his game
runners.spotlight: 5-12 over hurdles; pulled up in his second chase three months ago but had previously pushed a solid yardstick close over 2m3f here (good to soft) in December and that form offers him a chance; never excelled at this sort of trip over hurdles but there's stamina in the pedigree.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Master Trainer Chris Gordon Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hugos New Horse has just been waiting for the ground. At Windsor in January it was completely a no-go, so with some good ground this was always going to be quite a nice race and it's a good prize for him to win. We knew he'd get three miles and he just needed the ground, so we might keep him on the go for a bit. Last time he won it was at Ayr two years ago on quite fast ground, he's been a bit disappointing on and off since but that was perfect - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Quiz Clothing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance, Hugos New Horse is an improving young horse and is very strong late on in a race. He's won on all sorts of ground and ran well in the EBF Final last time. He'd had a setback ten days before and he probably wasn't quite at his best and I thought he'd go very well again today. He's in tomorrow and I haven't totally ruled out running him, we'll see how he is - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a tiny little bleed when running so disappointingly at Cheltenham last weekend. He got wound up beforehand and Harry sensibly looked after him once his chance had gone, so it's back to the drawing board. Whether it's this season or next, there are races to be won with him over fences - although with the changes to the racing programme it's harder to find opportunities for horses like him in novice chases - but I'm sure he's up to landing a decent handicap hurdle first. The Lanzarote at Kempton might end up a suitable target. He stays on strongly at the end of two and a half miles, suggesting he'll get three, and he's won on going ranging from heavy to good to firm. 05-11-23

runners.name: Major Fortune
runners.comment: Three chase runs; went close at Leicester but well beaten on either side of that
runners.spotlight: Effective at 2m1f-3m; won six times in the space of seven starts as a hurdler which scuppered his handicap mark; only had three runs over fences, going close at Leicester last month but well beaten on either side of that; others are safer.

quotes.race: attheraces.com Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Major Fortune and Catch Him Derry [his two winners]. They won a few races each last year. I thought they'd both need the run today and this was the first chance I've had to run them on some slower ground because it's been flooded down here the last few meetings. They were both very much suited by the ground, but hopefully they can continue to improve. It's early season form on a testing surface so I'm not sure what we'll do with them next, but they're going the right way - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Jill Taberner Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Major Fortune is just thriving. Where his ceiling is, I just don't know. Not many win five on the bounce, it takes some doing. The guys have been real patient with him and I must say my brother has done a good job with him. He's placed him really well and I'm lucky that I get to steer him - Harry Skelton, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: At The Races App Expert Tips Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Major Fortune is thriving at the minute. He's barely had a race. The whole way round we were going so slow, I was thinking at least he's not going to get a hard race if he does happen to win. Although it's three miles, we've dawdled round really - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Rand Farm Park Family Days Out Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Major Fortune was really good even though things didn't go to plan. I had a good chat with Noel Fehily and Dave Crosse as well as Dan and Harry (Skelton), they gave me some good advice and it paid off. The long run after the last helped him and he came home well - Liam Harrison, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: This race will really suit him. Quicker ground over a shorter trip last time didn't suit him at all. The step back up to what we know he loves will be a positive. 22-12-24

He was unbelievable last season, winning five races in a row. Things weren't going right for him to begin with but then, on Boxing Day at Market Rasen from jumping the last, the penny just dropped and he flew home. He went up in trip and won four more races. He just finds it so easy to go through heavy ground. On his last run at Ayr on better ground, he was just beaten by one of Willie Mullins' [Chosen Witness]. He will start at Newton Abbot in a 2m5f race on October 30 and if he was to win there we'd potentially look at the valuable hurdle race at Haydock next month. We feel the way he's come back in this summer, he's probably an even better horse. He'll jump fences but he's still got unfinished business over hurdles. 24-10-24

runners.name: Havaila
runners.comment: Course winner; good effort at Newbury last time behind one who got loose on the lead
runners.spotlight: In a first-time hood when much too good for his two rivals over C&D last month and then ran well under a penalty at Newbury (2m7f) when unable to reel in an unexposed winner who got loose on the lead; big shout off just 1lb higher.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Sir Michael Stoute's yard after four runs on the Flat. I have given him a bit of time and he should be ready in the next three weeks. He gallops like a real staying three-year-old, and I like his willing attitude to please, which is a big plus in any horse. 13-10-22

5:15.race_name: Phoenix Cycles Remember Ray Prior Handicap Hurdle
5:15.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to soft in places; watered; Chs 7.2, Hdl 6.7)

runners.name: King Alexander
runners.comment: Safely held in two hot handicaps since winning stable debut; will find this a bit easier
runners.spotlight: Safely held in two major handicaps since winning comfortably on stable debut at Fairyhouse (3m, yielding to soft) in January but is back in calmer waters here and will be suited by the forecast good ground; shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: I've plenty of time for this gelding, who had a constructive first season here, winning a bumper and twice over hurdles. He's been growing up physically and mentally all the time and could jump a fence, but I'd like to see what more he can do as a hurdler first. 30-10-23

runners.name: Emailandy
runners.comment: Won this race a year ago but very little has gone to plan since; tries new headgear today
runners.spotlight: Kept on strongly to win this race a year ago (good ground) but very little has gone to plan since; pulled up on chasing debut in February and now quickly reverts to hurdling; needs change of headgear to give him a significant boost.

stable_tour.quote: His third place in the EBF Final at Sandown last season was a strong piece of form, and I like the fact plenty tend to come out of that race and go on to do well over fences. He certainly has the size and scope for the job, so looks a good novice chase prospect. 04-11-24

runners.name: Electric Mason
runners.owner: Ktda Racing And Mrs Nicola Morris
runners.comment: Cut little ice on handicap debut at Cheltenham Festival but may still have potential
runners.spotlight: 2-6 since switched to hurdling in the autumn; cut little ice in Martin Pipe Hurdle on last month's handicap debut at Cheltenham but seems versatile regarding ground and may still have potential.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go for the Martin Pipe. I've done it slightly differently with him than my usual way. The half-owner has horses with Gordon Elliott and all roads lead to Cheltenham with him - he's very much a modern-day owner. So we've got him, shall we say, pretty harshly handicapped, but he's taken it well. It wouldn't have been a very impressive run when he won at Fontwell last time, but he's a lazy type. I said to Freddie to win it by the bare minimum and he did well, winning by a length and half. He'll go in the Martin Pipe off a mark of 132 and I'm looking forward to it. He seems to go on any ground but, if I had to choose for him, good to soft would be perfect. 26-02-25

runners.name: Mr Escobar
runners.comment: Useful Flat stayer; ready 2m1f novice hurdle winner; up in trip for handcap hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat stayer who did not need to improve to justify skinny odds in Sedgefield novice (2m1f, good) on latest hurdling start in November; ran as though something was amiss on AW in February but remains unexposed over hurdles and ought to be suited by the step up in trip on this handicap debut.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Proud To Support British Racing Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr Escobar wouldn't have been good enough to win a maiden hurdle in Ireland, so Patrick and Willie thought they might as well come here and try to win a maiden. He's a bit quirky. He didn't jump round one day at Killarney, he ran out before the [first] hurdle, so that's in the back of your mind going down to the first. I just thought the best of the ground was out wide, but it didn't matter and he would have still won anyway. It was nice to get it done. The track suited him, it kept him interested, and I was delighted with the way he jumped - Brian Hayes, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Mr Freedom
runners.comment: Runs this track very well and has slipped to a workable mark; can make presence felt
runners.spotlight: Gained two of his five hurdle wins at this track and was second in Sussex Champion Hurdle here (2m, good) just over a year ago; returned from seven-month break with encouraging third at Bangor (2m3f, good; form working out well) in March and has slipped to a workable mark; can make presence felt.

quotes.race: Howden Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Mr Freedom is a pleasure to have. People ask me what trip he wants and I don't know. What ground does he want? I don't know either. Cheekpieces on or off? It could be either. It doesn't matter what you do, he always gives his best. It makes him really hard to place, because we don't have parameters to stick to. You're just spoiled for choice, so we try and pick winnable races. Sometimes we get it right, sometimes we don't, but he hasn't done anything wrong this season - Sheena West, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow @attheraces On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Freedom shows virtually nothing at home, which is part of the reason I've just been able to keep going with him. I'd love to know where this horse gets ability from and where the speed comes from. You've actually got to go back four generations in this horse's pedigree before you can find a winner - Sheena West, trainer.

runners.name: Getalead
runners.comment: Enjoyed revival in the autumn (three wins) but ended 2024 with a below-par run
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed a revival in the autumn, winning three times (1m7f-2m5f, good/good to soft); still well handicapped on older form but didn't fire on latest outing in December and others here have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Busy Being Busy
runners.comment: Lightly raced and fast-improving 5yo who comes here after two emphatic wins at Fakenham
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and fast-improving 5yo who comes here after two emphatic wins at Fakenham (both 2m4f, good to soft); contests a deeper race today but latest 4lb rise does not look excessive; must be considered.

quotes.race: Volt Low Alcohol Ipa @ Fakenham Racecourse Handicap Hurdle (For The Walter Wales Cup)
quotes.quote: Busy Being Busy has been very tricky at home as he's very keen, but it worked out well today. I think the fierce pace around this track helped him - Stuart Edmunds, trainer.

runners.name: Mostly Sunny

prev_owners.owner: Desk Till Dawn And Wetumpka Racing

runners.comment: Back from break with some below-par runs but now well handicapped on early-season form
runners.spotlight: Won twice in early part of season and was subsequently placed off mark 8lb higher than today's in Summer Hurdle at Market Rasen (2m, good); well below that form since returning from break in February (four runs) but sports refitted cheekpieces today and a sudden revival would not surprise.

runners.name: Kells Priory
runners.comment: Out of form since last summer's hard-fought Kilarney win; headgear switched here
runners.spotlight: Battled on well to win 15-runner handicap at Killarney (2m4f, good) last summer but has been out of form since; ought to have coped better with the slow ground when pulled up at Gowran in January and needs change of headgear to perk him up here.

runners.name: Torrent
runners.breeder: Aston Mullins Stud & S Barrow Esq
runners.comment: Placed in three Grade 3 juvenile hurdles this season; a possible if this new trip suits
runners.spotlight: Placed in three consecutive Grade 2 juvenile hurdles in November-January and again ran well in juvenile handicap at Ascot (1m7f, good) last month; 2lb lower here and has each-way claims at least if suited by the new trip.

4:40.race_name: BetGoodwin Top UK Online Bookie Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
4:40.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to soft in places; watered; Chs 7.2, Hdl 6.7)

runners.name: Shakeyatailfeather
runners.comment: Penalised for winning with lots of authority at Cheltenham on Thursday; hard to beat
runners.spotlight: Stays 3m but she's not short of pace and travelled much the best en route to comfortably winning a 2m mares' handicap at Cheltenham on Thursday; didn't appear to have a hard race and should be hard to beat under a penalty; good ground seems the key to her.

quotes.race: Holland Cooper Mares' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Shakeyatailfeather would win at this meeting all the way through the winter but in the two and a half mile race. She wants better ground and being a mares-only card it was always going to suit her. We went to the race we were most likely to win - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.name: Heros
runners.comment: Remote fourth at Taunton continued this season's struggles; well treated, though
runners.spotlight: Headed to Taunton last time defending an unbeaten record there (2-2) but that remote fourth continued this season's struggles; too well treated to ignore but reservations for now.

quotes.race: Colin Crawley Mad As A Hatter Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heros had to battle and they went a good gallop. I was pleased the rain came this morning and I hope there's plenty more to come - Venetia Williams, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He was never out of the first three in his first season over fences and I think he can be effective over two miles and two and a half. He won't be ready until December but hopefully he can have another productive season. 23-10-24

runners.name: Taxus Baccata
runners.comment: 10l winner over C&D on chase debut and following defeat was only four days later
runners.spotlight: Won by 10l on C&D chase debut in March and it was only four days later when beaten under a 7lb penalty at Fakenham; has a further 3lb to deal with now in a deeper race but she should be better for a break.

quotes.race: Abba Party Raceday Saturday 4th May Mares' Open National Hunt Flat Race (Cat 1 Elim') (GBB) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Taxus Baccata pretty much made all in her point-to-point as well and she has a lovely attitude. I did feel like I was tying up in the last furlong but it's tiring ground, I've pressed on a long way out and it was a game performance - Conor O'Farrell, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Centara
runners.comment: Back on track when third in a small-field Wincanton handicap on his chase debut
runners.spotlight: Two Taunton wins as a novice hurdler included a handicap off only 1lb lower; quiet in two runs after wind surgery but got back on track when third in a small-field Wincanton handicap on his chase debut; likely to build on that.

stable_tour.quote: A big, backward horse who got too lit up and left his race at the start in the Grade 2 bumper at Aintree. We've been concentrating on keeping him nice and chilled at home and he could make his hurdling debut at Exeter on Friday. He's a promising individual. 05-11-23

runners.name: Siam Park
runners.comment: On a hat-trick and this keen-going front-runner should enjoy it around here
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on his chase debut in February and has since justified favouritism in good-ground handicaps at Taunton (2m) and Stratford (2m3f); up in the weights accordingly but he's a keen-going front-runner who should enjoy it around here.

stable_tour.quote: He was a non-runner at Wincanton as he had a bit of pus in his foot. He fell in a point-to-point but would've finished second if he jumped the last and the form of that race looks serious. The winner, Butcher Hollow, was sold for Â£200,000 and bolted up at Galway the other week and the third has run well too. He's a nice sort with a smart pedigree. I think we'll start off over two miles but he'll get further in time. 10-11-23

He's nice and a lovely prospect for Brocade Racing, who allow us all the time we need. It was a good run from him at Wincanton before Christmas when he finished fourth after just getting tired and then he finished third there last week. I thought he ran well and he travelled nicely. I think that's decent form and he improved from his first run, although he probably wants slightly better ground. 18-01-24

runners.name: Belgarum
runners.comment: C&D winner but might be on a harsh mark even if he returns to form after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Has won three Class 5 handicaps this season, the latest over C&D in September (good); below that level in his last three races and might be on a harsh mark even if he returns to form after wind surgery.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Belgarum will probably get another hike for that after going up 10lb for his last win. However, he's only a 6yo and is looking different to how he's ever looked and he's grown in confidence. He's on an upwards curve - Joe Tizzard, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Joe Cotton

prev_owners.owner: The Boundary Stables Partnership ( C R Barber)

runners.comment: Wasn't overly pressed to win in the first-time blinkers at Fontwell; 7lb rise is fair
runners.spotlight: The first-time blinkers will need to work again but he wasn't overly pressed to win over a similar trip at Fontwell and that was a Class 2 (on good); respected despite the 7lb rise triggering a career-high mark.

quotes.race: Smith And Western Chase Series Final (A Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm particularly delighted as Joe Cotton has been frustratingly consistent without winning. I was thrilled that the headgear seemed to make a difference. He runs on every single type of ground but I imagine we'll probably stop there, he's earned himself a holiday - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

runners.name: Scene One
runners.comment: Winless this season but on a good mark if the new headgear works
runners.spotlight: 2-11 over fences, the wins coming last season over 2m5f and 2m3f; some good runs this campaign without being overly threatening and cheekpieces are replaced by a visor after pulling up last time; on a handy mark if the new headgear works; good ground is fine.

2:20.race_name: Mayo Wynne Baxter Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
2:20.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to soft in places; watered; Chs 7.2, Hdl 6.7)

runners.name: Bob Bob Ricard
runners.comment: Not beaten too far at Newbury last time and this is an easier race than that
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-6 over fences; only beat two rivals for the last of those wins (2m) but he ran well in a useful chase at Newbury a month ago (2m4f, good) and this is easier than that; respected.

stable_tour.quote: He was a little bit frustrating over hurdles last season but got his act together over fences in the spring and summer. He was very unlucky when badly hampered by a faller at Cheltenham last month. He was just starting to motor but that stopped him in his tracks. He's absolutely fine now and there's a similar race back at Cheltenham this month or a choice of races at Newbury on Coral Gold Cup weekend. 06-11-24

runners.name: Alien Storm
runners.comment: Had a blip two runs back but otherwise consistent since returning from a break
runners.spotlight: Had a blip two runs back but otherwise consistent since returning from a break and was a clear second last time at Chepstow (2m, good); solid candidate off an untouched mark.

stable_tour.quote: He started the season off in style with an easy win at Plumpton in a 2m novice hurdle and was a one-length second to Attacca under a penalty at Kempton. I thought he would run well going back to Kempton at Christmas but he found the soft ground too much and could not pick up his feet in it. The experience will have taught him plenty and he will have plenty of decent opportunities in the spring when the ground dries a little. The handicapper dropped him 2lb to 123 and I think this progressive youngster is above standard and, like so many of his family, he will be better on better ground. 11-01-23

runners.name: Le Fauve
runners.comment: Lightly raced maiden who has to be of interest on chasing/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden but was placed in a Listed hurdle early last season and shaped encouragingly in a good race on his reappearance; disappointing when only 13-8 for a maiden hurdle last time (after wind surgery) but reportedly bled from the nose; has something to prove on ground this dry but has to be of interest on chasing/handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He travels really well through his races but I wasn't happy with the way he wasn't getting home, so he's gone off for a wind op and ultimately we'll see a much better horse when he goes over fences. I'm not giving up on him at all. 12-11-24

runners.name: Flamelco
runners.breeder: A Blin, Mme A Blin, Et Al
runners.comment: Responded for pressure to be second at Ffos Las; this does look a better race
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins this season, on good and soft ground; reportedly bled from the nose when second at Ffos Las (good to soft) where he kept responding for pressure; this does look a better race, however.

runners.name: Tactical Affair
runners.comment: The handicapper is doing his bit for the cause but others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner in Ireland; beaten between 11l and 17l in four handicap chases for his current yard and was no better for cheekpieces last time; the handicapper is doing his bit for the cause but others appeal more.

quotes.race: Racing TV Black Friday Offer - Join For Just 12 Euros PM For An Entire Year Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tactical Affair is a lovely horse and he will come on a lot. He's a fine big horse and only coming into himself - Jordan Gainford, rider.

stable_tour.quote: Ran reasonably well in the big sales bumper at Punchestown. He might start off in a bumper before going novice hurdling. 24-10-23

runners.name: Jolyjump
runners.breeder: Mrs D Saliou & Haras De La Haie Neuve
runners.comment: Inconsistent but contender if following one good run with another; cheekpieces are new
runners.spotlight: Worryingly inconsistent but has won over fences (1-6) and he steadied the ship with a second at Southwell a month ago (2m, good to soft); won't be far away with a repeat of that and the cheekpieces are new.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Jolyjump has always looked a nice horse and his jumping was super - Caoilin Quinn, rider.

runners.name: Miss Fedora
runners.comment: Out of the weights but two convincing wins over C&D already this year
runners.spotlight: It's not ideal being 4lb out of the weights but she's twice won convincingly over C&D this year and looks sure to give her running once more; gets on well with Ellis Collier.

1:50.race_name: ExTech Cloud Computing Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
1:50.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to soft in places; watered; Chs 7.2, Hdl 6.7)

runners.name: Calli Black
runners.comment: Not progressing over hurdles and has offered little in minor handicaps the last twice
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer but she's not progressing over hurdles and has offered little in minor handicaps the last twice; non-runner.

runners.name: Chique Angel
runners.comment: Uncompetitive so far over hurdles, latterly at Newton Abbot only yesterday
runners.spotlight: Ran well in a bumper here (good to soft) but uncompetitive so far over hurdles, latterly at Newton Abbot only yesterday.

runners.name: Jasmine Dairy
runners.breeder: J Dubois & Scea De La Vallee De L'Orne
runners.comment: Races with the choke out but has still finished runner-up the last twice; good form claims
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; front-runner who races with the choke out but has still finished runner-up the last twice, latterly behind a well-backed winner in a 2m4f handicap at Ffos Las (good to soft); this looks easier and Plumpton should suit her running style.

runners.name: Lady Darbanville
runners.comment: Failed to progress for Nicky Henderson and was sold on for Â£2,500 in January
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper here last season for Nicky Henderson and then runner-up over hurdles; however, she didn't go on from there and was sold for Â£2,500 in January.

stable_tour.quote: She won a bumper last season before making the frame twice over hurdles. She's had a very good summer and we can look forward to an exciting season over hurdles this time, with mares' races the obvious aim. She shouldn't take too long and will appreciate good ground. 22-10-24

She won a bumper for Nicky Henderson and finished second in a maiden hurdle behind a 125-rated horse of Paul Nicholls's. She's just the sort of horse who will suit our set-up. She's quite a buzzy filly who we can keep relaxed. We've had her for about a month and she has settled in well. We'll run her at the end of the month over 2m4f on decent ground and I think she's got plenty of potential off her current mark. 12-03-25

runners.name: Lady Kluck
runners.comment: Point/bumper winner; quiet hurdling debut but she could improve for a hood
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner; weakened into fifth in a field of six when taking on male opposition in her first hurdle at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) and will need to improve on that form; the new hood could help.

stable_tour.quote: I was surprised by how much of a blow she had after her debut, and she'll be a lot fitter when she's turned out again after the ground eases a little. 12-11-24

runners.name: Precious Jean
runners.comment: Has a useful pedigree but has little in the way of worthwhile form
runners.spotlight: Has a useful pedigree but has little in the way of worthwhile form, in three bumpers and a maiden hurdle.

runners.name: She Is For Me Boys
runners.comment: Won a weak Irish point but has joined a good yard and market support could be significant
runners.spotlight: Bought for 42,000gns after winning a small-field 3m Irish point by 2l on good to yielding; that's not strong form with the runner-up 1-10 in points and 0-10 over hurdles; still, has joined a good yard and market support could be significant.

2:55.race_name: Harry & Betty Savill Memorial Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
2:55.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to soft in places; watered; Chs 7.2, Hdl 6.7)

runners.name: My Friend Sean
runners.comment: Form figures of 81131 since fitted with this headgear combination; solid chance again
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 81131 since fitted with this headgear combination and had a nice bit in hand last time at Chepstow (2m, good); raised 8lb but Cameron Iles can claim 5lb instead of the 3lb he did last time; solid claims.

runners.name: Barrabool
runners.comment: Probably not on that bad a mark should the tongue-tie trigger a return to form
runners.spotlight: Won a three-runner maiden on hurdle/stable debut here in November (good); soft ground perhaps not ideal in her next two races but good to soft should have been okay at Kelso and yet that was her worst run yet; perhaps the tongue-tie can trigger a return to form.

runners.name: Officer Of State
runners.owner: State Of Play & G L Moore
runners.comment: Fair run last time but needs the cheekpieces need to give him a lift
runners.spotlight: 9lb higher than for his Fontwell win in November (2m1f, good) and was no match for the winner there a month ago; needs the cheekpieces to give him a lift.

runners.name: Ugo Bingo

prev_owners.owner: A K Hosie J P Romans W Van Der Horst

runners.comment: Found only one too good on recent stable debut at Fontwell; up another 3lb for that
runners.spotlight: Won twice earlier in the season and found only one too good on recent stable debut at Fontwell (2m1f, good); up 3lb and that gives him little margin for error, but can still make presence felt.

runners.name: Luna Effect
runners.comment: Bang there in Flat handicaps the last twice so returns to hurdles in some form
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden under both codes; bang there in Flat handicaps the last twice so returns to hurdles in some form and was runner-up here in October.

runners.name: Monsant
runners.comment: Signs were a little more encouraging when beaten 8l in a 2m2f Stratford handicap last time
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish gelding; the signs were a little more encouraging when beaten 8l in a 2m2f Stratford handicap last time and cheekpieces now go on; not dismissed.

runners.name: Denzil
runners.comment: Beaten in a seller last time and he's not well handicapped on that form
runners.spotlight: One of his yard's lesser lights and was beaten by one with a basement mark in a seller last time; his mark has dropped 6lb but it's still not generous.

runners.name: Kentucky Bluegrass
runners.comment: The return of a hood is no bad thing but he's unconvincing back from a break
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner at about 7f; has shown he can stay the trip over hurdles but was well held in two handicaps before struggling in a Perth maiden (first-time tongue-tie); the return of a hood is no bad thing but he's unconvincing back from a break.

runners.name: Jorebel
runners.comment: Has only contested two handicaps and he ran well for a long way in the latest at Uttoxeter
runners.spotlight: Has only contested two handicaps and he ran well for a long way in the latest at Uttoxeter (2m, good); wouldn't need a lot more to be right in the thick of it here.

3:41.race_name: Whitsbury Manor Stud / British EBF Lansdown Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)

runners.name: Adaay In Devon
runners.comment: Two Listed wins in 2024, including this race; Friday's rain a plus; good draw; big chance
runners.spotlight: Admirable filly who won twice in Listed company last season, including this race; handles any ground but Friday's rain certainly won't hurt; well drawn and she should make a bold bid for a yard going nicely.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Scurry Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The second is a good horse and I thought Adaay In Devon did well to give her 3lb. I thought we might get caught in the closing stages. She's very easy to train, a good-tempered filly, and she's still growing. We could have gone to the Commonwealth Cup Royal Ascot but she'd have to run a blinder just to finish fifth or sixth. I put her in the five-furlong handicap on Friday in case she was beaten but she won't go now she's got a penalty. We'll stick to the fillies' black-type races this year but distance wise could step up to seven furlongs. I expect she'll stay in England for now but she could go abroad next year. She's more than paid for herself - Rod Millman, trainer.

quotes.race: British EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C & D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The original aim was to win one of the bonuses as Adaay In Devon isn't very big. We never thought she'd win three. This was always the plan as we don't normally go to Carlisle, but she needs softer ground and there weren't many other options. Her handicap mark might be ridiculously high after that but she'll head to Goodwood later this month for a really valuable prize - James Millman, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Qual') (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Adaay In Devon was brilliant and all the way through she's been progressing. She stays well and liked that ground. Rod has suggested we come back here for a 100,000GBP race on September 27 - Michael Ludwell, part-owner.

stable_tour.quote: She's entered in the Stewards' Cup but will only run if it's soft ground. She's pretty versatile regarding ground but she's at her best on soft.  She's a very game horse, not overbig but she's quite powerful for her size. She's been a revelation- last season she was the only horse to win four bonuses. She made all to win a Listed race at Sandown last time and goes to York on Friday for a fillies' Group 3. 11-07-24

runners.name: Balmoral Lady
runners.comment: Made giant strides in the autumn when racing on slow ground; can progress again in 2025
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on good and faster early on in career but she ascended new heights in the autumn when faced with soft/heavy going, completing a hat-trick in handicaps before a fine second in a Doncaster Listed event (6f, heavy) when last seen in November; should progress again this year and the more rain to fall the better.

stable_tour.quote: I always believed in her, which is why I bought her back at the sales, and she won three 5f handicaps and was second in a Listed race. She's a lovely filly who's best at 5f or 6f but the ground is quite important to her - she needs a bit of dig in it. 16-04-25

runners.name: Electric Storm
runners.comment: Second to Adaay In Devon in this race last year; solid Group form after; still low mileage
runners.spotlight: Won both starts as a 3yo; chased home Adaay In Devon in this race 12 months ago (good ground) before winning a Listed race at Haydock one month later; solid efforts in Group company afterwards and she's one to consider with further progress a distinct possibility after just eight starts.

quotes.race: EBF British Stallion Studs Cecil Frail (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Electric Storm had some developmental issues as a yearling so really she didn't train as a two-year-old and only stepped up her training midsummer as a three-year-old. She's got the speed for five but she stays seven, I think six is probably her ideal trip. I think there will be further improvement there. We have three four-year-old fillies by Night Of Thunder - Cloud Cover won on All-Weather Finals day, Royal Dress won a Listed race at Goodwood a couple of weeks ago and now this filly has won a Listed race too - James Tate, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet/Breeders Backing Racing EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Electric Storm is a sweet little thing but she was very green and didn't like the kickback. I loved her attitude inside the last 150yds, she really put her neck down to the floor for me, and she's definitely something for connections to look forward to - Ray Dawson, jockey, talking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Frost At Dawn
runners.comment: Group 3 win in Dubai last year; yet to shine in 2025 and wouldn't want significant rain
runners.spotlight: Group 3 winner in Dubai last year; regularly highly tried since and the return to Listed company didn't spark a revival at Doncaster three weeks ago (6f, good to soft); seems happiest on good or quicker so significant rainfall would be a negative.

quotes.race: Nad Al Sheba Turf Sprint Sponsored By Emirates Skywards (Group 3) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I had the luck to have a good draw today, so I just played my card. It's the first time I've ridden Frost At Dawn. She's fast and I think she would travel even better over six furlongs - Mickael Barzalona, jockey.

runners.name: Miss Attitude
runners.comment: Running well in AW handicaps this year but she has more on her plate at this level
runners.spotlight: Good strike-rate, winning for the fourth time when landing a Class 3 handicap at Southwell last month (tongue tied for the first time); only fourth at Newcastle since though and looks up against it in this company.

stable_tour.quote: She's rated 92 and wasn't beaten far at Newcastle when fourth last time. The main goal for her this year will be black type. She'll go for the Listed Lansdown Stakes at Bath on April 20 and then she'll be campaigning in stakes races for the rest of the year. 02-04-25

runners.name: Over The Blues
runners.comment: Promise in Ireland last year; new connections won this race with a similar type in 2022
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish filly; useful form for Patrick Foley in her first season of racing last year, including a Listed second at Naas last July (6f, yielding); improvement is a must but that was the case when White Lavender, one with a similar profile, won this race in 2022 on her first run for these connections; betting useful.

quotes.race: Tinnakill House Maiden
quotes.quote: Over The Blues did that pretty well. She was green at the Curragh and she was keen after that. She gets six well and might even be good over five. With a bit of luck all she will do is improve. We might come back here next month for a Listed race - Pat Foley, trainer

runners.name: Pepsi Cat
runners.breeder: B Kennedy & Mrs Ann Marie Kennedy
runners.comment: Unlucky not to be placed in this race last year; promise on return 16 days ago; can pull
runners.spotlight: In the form of her life prior to finishing fifth in this race last year (would have been placed with a clear run); ended 2024 quietly but was back on the up when second to an interesting handicapper over C&D on seasonal return 16 days ago (fourth won last week); drawn wide and can race freely if not getting cover but no surprise to see her outrun her likely odds once again.

runners.name: Pure Angel
runners.comment: Running well on AW this year but faces another stiff task at Listed level
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice in 6f AW handicaps in January; ran well in the face of stiff task at Southwell eight weeks ago; likely vulnerable at this level.

runners.name: Sophias Starlight
runners.comment: Ended 2024 in fine form and shaped okay on her return; only fourth in this race last year
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who ended 2024 in fine form, winning Class 2 handicaps at Newmarket and Pontefract (both 6f, soft) before a good fourth at Doncaster in November (Listed); shaped encouragingly at Doncaster on her return three weeks ago, weakening when hampered inside the final furlong; well drawn to attack but she'll need to better her fourth in this race in 2024.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Premier Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Grant Tuer said Sophia's Starlight was in form coming here today and she loves that bit of juice in the ground. I don't think she's the easiest filly to keep right at home but she's had a bit of a freshen up and was tough today - Sam James, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Great St Wilfrid Handicap
quotes.quote: It's great for Grant (Tuer) and Nick (Bradley) as it was a big call to make with a three-year-old. Sophia's Starlight is improving and I felt like I was going to win easier. Danny (Tudhope) nearly got there, which quite annoyed me, but she was doing everything on her own. I always had the far side beat and she got everything out of her comfort zone a long way out - Sam James, jockey.

quotes.race: Winners Wear House Of Cavani Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We could look at something like the Sky Bet Sunday Series with Sophia's Starlight but first she is entered at Carlisle on Wednesday  - Grant Tuer, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: As a juvenile her first run was encouraging but her two subsequent efforts gave us no hint of what she might achieve as a three-year-old. She won on her reappearance at Wolverhampton in May, and since then she's progressed with virtually every run, so much so that she won the Great St Wilfrid at Ripon the weekend before last. I was at Newmarket and watched the race on my mobile phone in a stable box, so I didn't get a very clear picture of who had won. It was a wonderful race for us as stables of our standing need these big Saturday winners for exposure. That was off a rating of 89, 20lb higher than when we kicked off in May. I ran her at York last week and she made the running again but clearly they went off too fast. If you'd stopped the race at the three-pole, the front eight horses filled the last eight places. We'll wait a couple of weeks before looking for another race. There's a fillies' Listed race at Ayr coming up and that's the likely next target. It would be wonderful for her breeding page to get some black type. 30-08-23

runners.name: Vadream
runners.comment: On losing run of 16 but she's capable at this level and finished 3rd in this race in 2024
runners.spotlight: Well suited by good ground or slower; often ran well last year, including when third in this race on her reappearance, but her losing run now stands at 16; cheekpieces return today.

quotes.race: Howden Palace House Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I'd be lying if I said that I wasn't delighted by the rain. Vadream just loves it. She's a very good filly but she has to have her conditions and she got them today. I'd say (the Duke of York Stakes) is unlikely and will come a bit soon, we'll just run her where the conditions are right - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Cammidge Trophy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Vadream has always been a very talented mare but she's not the most straightforward. But she's always improved with racing, which is one thing we learned last year, and that is why we've given her a few runs on the all-weather. She loves soft ground and she loves six furlongs. She's always threatened to do something like that. She was frustrating last year, she ran too many times on quick ground - we know her a lot better this year and we'll stick to a bit of cut. She's in the all-weather championships on Friday at Newcastle, which is probably the only all-weather track where you could run her and go with a big chance. She's the sort of filly who could run again quickly so we'll look at that. Then she'll have a break and have an entry at York and possibly in Ireland. I hope we have a wet summer! - Charlie Fellowes, trainer.

quotes.race: John Guest Racing Bengough Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Vadream has always been a good filly and has been a bit unlucky this year. She's run in some proper races and hit the post a few times. This has been the plan for a long time and we felt it was a real chance for her to win a Group race - winning trainer Charlie Fellowes.

stable_tour.quote: I think she's run better this year than ever. She was just beaten a head in a Group 3 at Newmarket and has run really well in the Jubilee at Royal Ascot and the July Cup. The Flying Five has always been the plan, but she'll head to the Sprint Cup first, then go to the Curragh and Longchamp for the Prix de l'Abbaye. We really want her to be at least placed in a Group 1 and if it comes up soft she can do that. 11-09-24

Readers of this column will recall I've been a huge fan of Vadream from day one and, after a good three-year-old campaign when she won the Group 3 Bengough Stakes, things were rather quiet last season when she was placed in Group company without winning. However, she loves soft ground, and this spring has been right up her street as she won on her turf debut when taking the Listed Cammidge Trophy at Doncaster. Last time out at Newmarket the ground was still on the soft side and she delivered in the Group 3 Palace House Stakes in what looked a good race. I won't run her unless there is give in the ground and she will be entered for every 5f and 6f Group race throughout the season in the hope we will get her ground as she is a 20lb better filly on soft. She is not a difficult filly to keep fit ad she likes to be busy, so you can run her at the drop of a hat. I would love to think it would be soft at Royal Ascot with either the King's Stand or the Queen Elizabeth II Jubilee Stakes as potential targets. If it came up soft on the opening day she would have a huge chance in the King's Stand. 28-05-23

runners.name: Woolhampton
runners.comment: Won four handicaps last year and can make her mark at this level granted further progress
runners.spotlight: Better than ever in 2024, winning four 5f handicaps (ground ranging from good to firm to heavy); should appreciate the likely strong pace and could pinch black type this year granted further progress; only midfield in the 2023 renewal on her only run at Bath; stable also runs Adaay In Devon.

stable_tour.quote: She seems to be an Ascot specialist- she loves the place and goes there again for the big Â£100,000 handicap this week. After that, all being well, she'll go- like Amazonian Dream- for the sprint final at Windsor on August 12. She's done very well over 5f (and won a qualifier over 5f at Windsor), but for Â£75,000 we'll have a crack over 6f. 11-07-24

runners.name: Englemere
runners.comment: Three wins at two, including Listed; 3yos have won 3 of the last 9 runnings; can go well
runners.spotlight: Three wins as a 2yo, notably a Newbury Listed in August (5f, good); highly tried afterwards and ran some good races on a range of ground; 3yos have won three of the last nine runnings and a big run would come as no surprise on her return from six months off.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Englemere is very tough. She fluffed her lines a little bit at the start but we went very quick and for a filly to win with a penalty takes a bit of doing. She's a nice filly - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's not overly big but she really tries and we're probably going to start her back in the Lansdown Fillies' Stakes at Bath this month. Five and six furlongs come equally to her and she could turn up in a lot of those sprint stakes races. Her work has been more than acceptable to be running in that grade of race. 07-04-25

runners.name: First Instinct
runners.comment: Didn't stay 7f in Group 3 when last seen; earlier 6f wins most promising; yard in top form
runners.spotlight: Looked a good prospect when winning 6f fillies' events on her first two starts (good to firm and good to soft); stretched by 7f in Group 3 company when last seen in October; faced with a different challenge on her return to action but the stable are banging in winners and she still has considerable potential.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Â£40,000 EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: First Instinct has been faultless. I was a bit worried that the ground today might just blunt her speed but she fell asleep early - which was key I think - and showed that trademark turn of foot which she showed on her first run. I think she'll be even more effective on better ground - Tom Marquand, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Pearl Of Windsor
runners.comment: Two wins last year but had her limitations exposed at this level in the autumn
runners.spotlight: Won twice as a 2yo but had her limitations exposed in Listed company in the autumn; stiff task on her return.

runners.name: Queen All Star
runners.comment: Won two of her three starts and may do better yet; this a daunting challenge though
runners.spotlight: The winner of two of her three starts, more recently a 5f novice at Wolverhampton four weeks ago; not fully exposed but this is a significantly more daunting challenge.

stable_tour.quote: She's owned by Jaber Abdullah and won first time out at Â­Windsor last August before Â­finishing third at Â­Goodwood on her Â­second novice start. She really Â­improved over the winter and won first time out at Â­Wolverhampton over 5f last week. She'll be Â­running over sprint Â­distances this year. 02-04-25

runners.name: Running Queen
runners.comment: Followed Salisbury win last May with two 3rds in Listed company; unexposed; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Came to hand early last season, winning at Salisbury last May (5f, soft) before a good third in Listed company at York's Dante meeting; absent for 168 days prior to another good third in Listed company at Newmarket (6f, good); still unexposed.

quotes.race: Kingsclere Stud Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very pleasing. We fancied Running Queen the first day at Newbury but it was a competitive race and she raced on the wing a bit. She seems to have come forward and she did it nicely. She's always stuck her head above the parapet and has come to hand early. She's always looked like an above-average filly, so it's nice to do it and it's for a new owner in the yard too. She'll hopefully have some nice targets throughout the year. I'm sure she'll get six furlongs no problem, but she's quick and we're happy for now keeping her over five - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

runners.name: Sea Emily Run
runners.comment: Considerable improvement is required dropping to 5f for the first time
runners.spotlight: Four runs as a 2yo, all over 6f, showing her best form when fourth in a Newmarket Listed event in November (behind Running Queen); drawn widest and considerable improvement is required.

4:16.race_name: Sergei Prokofiev Standing At Whitsbury Manor Handicap

runners.name: Lil Guff
runners.comment: C&D winner; handles any ground; mixed record fresh but  booking of Oisin Murphy is a plus
runners.spotlight: Seven-time winner on a variety of going, one of the wins coming over C&D (firm); absent for seven months and her record fresh is mixed but the booking of Oisin Murphy suggests she'll be ready to go.

quotes.race: Do Not Miss Live Music Nights Handicap
quotes.quote: We've spent all year trying to get Lil Guff to win. Oisin had us worried halfway through. They were going too quickly and he was right to take back. He just needed the gap and you always need a bit of luck against that rail. She's won seven times so you can't complain but she needs quick ground and she's just never really had it this year. She's in at Ascot but we'll see how she is in the morning - Daniel Kubler, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She ran as well as expected in a Listed race at Bath recently when she was a bit unlucky in running and the ground was slower than ideal. She's a fun type for fillies' handicaps or Racing League and Sunday Series races as she's tough and hardy. It seems she's better on quicker ground now, while we might look at getting some black type again down the line. She runs over 5f at Ascot today. 02-05-24

runners.name: Miss Show Off
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who drops in grade and can build on her recent C&D return; interesting
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo; won a 6f fillies' novice (good ground) at Newbury as a juvenile and she made a fine seasonal return last summer when a close fourth at Sandown off a 3lb higher mark than today's; didn't run as badly as a 5l defeat might suggest here 16 days ago and she is eased in grade this time; still capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: She's a very lightly raced filly who won a nice Newbury novice on her final run as a two-year-old in 2023, but ran just twice last year. She returned at Bath this month and finished sixth, but she met trouble in running, so should improve on that. 17-04-25

She's a sweet filly who won last time out at Newbury - her third run - when beating Al Hujaija in determined fashion. She has been given a rating of 85, but we liked her enough to give her an entry in the Princess Margaret Stakes at Ascot last weekend, although she didn't go there in the end. She wants good ground and any rain would weaken her chances. 02-08-23

runners.name: Alexi Boy
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs J Davis & P Mitchell B'Stock
runners.comment: Promising on AW as a 3yo; gelded/hooded for stable debut; something to prove on turf
runners.spotlight: Promise as a 3yo for Michael Bell, including a wide-margin maiden win at Lingfield (5f, AW); showed he could be competitive off this sort of mark in November 2023 but he has been absent since a disappointing run 500 days ago; gelded/changed yard since and the addition of a hood looks a good move; the absence aside, the return to turf is a concern as he was well beaten in two previous attempts.

runners.name: Tan Rapido
runners.comment: Promising return at Southwell and dropped 2lb since; could still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Turf winner as a 2yo; yet to win a handicap but he made an encouraging seasonal return at Southwell last month; 2lb drop in the weights helps; may yet do better.

runners.name: Cloud King
runners.comment: Bits of form suggest he's a cut above this level; below best on return; cheekpieces now
runners.spotlight: Threatened to be a bit better than this level on occasions last season, looking good when winning at Haydock last July (5f, good); disappointing at Southwell on his return to action last month but the run may have been needed after six months off; the fitting of cheekpieces could sharpen him up too and he's high on the list.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Cloud King would enjoy a bit of dig in the ground. There's a good enough headwind out there and they went a good gallop, and looking around waiting, I thought I had everything covered - Rossa Ryan, rider.

runners.name: The Thames Boatman
runners.comment: 8lb lower mark on turf but recent AW efforts short of his best too; others look safer
runners.spotlight: Dangerous mark on his useful AW best and he has run to form on turf, for all he's 0-10 on it; he hasn't been at his best in recent outings though and others look safer; cheekpieces tried last time are quickly dispensed with.

quotes.race: It's Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: The Thames Boatman needs pace in his races and looking at this race beforehand I knew he'd get that today, so that was an advantage. He's at his best when he has something to aim at, but he made life harder for himself by hanging in the last half a furlong. We do think he's a smart horse, especially on the all-weather - Finley Marsh, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He was brilliant at Lingfield on Saturday, taking his record at the track to 3-3. He just got there over 5f and we might see an ounce of improvement if we go to 6f. He loves Lingfield, so we'll probably stick to there for now. 18-09-24

runners.name: Kiss And Run
runners.comment: Prominent racer; 2nd on this card on last year's return; versatile groundwise; chance
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; three handicap wins to her name, including at this track (5.5f, soft), and she's not handicapped out of things on last year's best; seems to handle any ground and she ran well when second at this meeting on last season's reappearance; shouldn't underestimate.

runners.name: Phoenix Beach
runners.comment: Arrives in top form but he is up in class and is still seeking a first turf success
runners.spotlight: All six wins have come on AW but he has shown promise on turf and he couldn't be in better form, winning three of his last four starts; back up on the weights though and could be found out upped to Class 4.

runners.name: Connies Rose
runners.comment: Condtions no problem and should step forward from this month's seasonal return
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins to her name; dropped away on this month's return to action (5f, good to firm; first run after wind surgery) but a 2lb drop helps and she's not discounted.

quotes.race: HAC Plumbing Supplies Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Connie's Rose loves racing - there is no mare tougher.  She has a good routine at home - she doesn't do a lot or see another horse - and she's a joy to train.  I'm still undecided if she prefers 5f.  We thought she was going to be a 1m-plus horse as she was slow, green and didn't know how to gallop at all, but she got a lot quicker at home.  Would we get more improvement holding her up at 1m?  We don't know.  We may try it in future but we don't want to change anything that's working at the moment - Grace Harris, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: So Smart
runners.comment: Infrequent winner but one of his victories came over C&D; fair return but needs more today
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but one of his successes was achieved over C&D; sharper for his recent return to action but others appeal more at this level.

quotes.race: Betting.Bet Live Racing Results Handicap
quotes.quote: He pinged the gates but did find the ground on the quick side, So Smart changed leads a couple of times but got away with it in the end. He likes to front-run because when he's in behind he doesn't do a whole lot, if something comes to him he goes again. He's an older horse so it's good to change things (headgear) and it's worked tonight - Kieran O'Neill, jockey, speaking to Sky Racing.

2:31.race_name: Havana Grey Standing At Whitsbury Manor Handicap

runners.name: Cavalry Call
runners.comment: Back to form in going down by a neck when upped to 1m2f at Chelmsford (AW) on latest start
runners.spotlight: Sole win (15 races) was over 1m on good to firm at Yarmouth last September; wore cheekpieces on last three starts, back to form in going down by a neck when upped to 1m2f at Chelmsford (AW) latest; back in the picture.

runners.name: Polling Day
runners.comment: Sole Flat race on turf was a heavy defeat one year ago; on the premises on AW this winter
runners.spotlight: Started his career with two wins on AW in 2021; 0-14 since (five races over hurdles) and his only Flat race on turf was a heavy defeat on good to soft one year ago, but he has been on the premises on AW this winter on his only two starts for new yard.

runners.name: Sir Edward Lear
runners.comment: Won the first of two starts last season; handicap debutant who could be capable of better
runners.spotlight: Green but well on top late on to justify 5-4 favouritism in a five-runner restricted maiden at Ripon (1m2f, good) last August on debut; not so good at Redcar (1m2f, soft) two months later but this handicap debutant could clearly still be capable of better after just two starts.

quotes.race: Harrogate Theatre Panto Tickets Now On-Sale Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a lovely introduction. I've never been to Ripon before but I had a walk round and it's quite undulating. Sir Edward Lear was learning on the job, Sean gave him a lovely ride - James Owen, trainer.

runners.name: Golden Circet
runners.owner: W Trenchard, A Coupland & If Only Ptn
runners.comment: 20-1 and tongue tied on yard debut (Cavalry Call second) and shaped okay in fifth of nine
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent during light career in Ireland for Willie McCreery but he won a 9.5f maiden at Clonmel (good) last September; 20-1 and tongue tied on stable debut at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW; Cavalry Call second) 17 days ago and shaped okay in fifth of nine; considered.

quotes.race: Slievenamon Maiden
quotes.quote: Golden Circet came on the bridle in the straight and quickened up well. He galloped all the way to the line in spite of going left, I just didn't want to break his stride and I let him come across - Billy Lee, rider.

runners.name: Caelan
runners.comment: Late headway last two runs (1m3f/8.6f); he's been hanging left too but needs a close look
runners.spotlight: 2-7 for Marco Botti; hasn't matched that form in his four starts for new yard but he caught the eye of the stewards on penultimate start (1m3f) and again made some headway from rear on latest (8.6f); he's also been hanging left in the closing stages but needs a close look.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Caelan is still a big, raw horse. He won first-time out but ended up being quite immature and he was running a bit free but today he's done everything the right way round, although he wasn't doing a tap in front. He's taken well to all-weather surfaces but I don't see why he won't be just as effective on the grass - Hollie Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Thapa Vc
runners.comment: Rather inconsistent this term; this trip (unraced beyond 8.6f) asks the biggest question
runners.spotlight: 7yo whose 11 wins were all over 7f, including two last year (May/July) off slightly higher marks than this; rather inconsistent this term but today's trip (he's unraced beyond 8.6f) asks the biggest question.

quotes.race: Aalberts IPS Pegler Xpress Handicap
quotes.quote: Thapa Vc is quite a tricky ride, he's got to be produced right, and Jim is just class - Mark Rimell, trainer.

runners.name: Ice Opera
runners.comment: 0-11 for Sheila Lavery in Ireland; 15,000gns buy 18 days ago; the early hood returns
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden in Ireland who stays 1m4f, with peak ratings on good ground and Polytrack; left Sheila Lavery for 15,000gns 18 days ago; hooded last summer for first three starts and again today; player on best form.

runners.name: Chicago Storm
runners.breeder: Ashtown B/S, O B Sarl, E Puerari, G Bozo

prev_owners.owner: Anthony Carey & Martin W Walsh & Derek Dunne
Anthony Carey & Conor Brett & Derek Dunne & M W Walsh

runners.comment: Two Irish Flat wins last year and he's since scored twice on good to soft over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Had Irish Flat wins last August (10.5f) and December (1m4f) and he's scored twice on good to soft from this year's five hurdle races for new yard; that hurdles form compares favourably with this Flat mark.

quotes.race: #90 January & February Hospitality Offer Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Chicago Storm's work has been very good at home, I can't fault him, and he'll probably go on to better things. I have nothing in mind yet, but he's a very straightforward and easy horse, and he has plenty of ability - Daisy Hitchins, trainer.

runners.name: Soi Dao
runners.comment: Finished on heels of the winner over 9.4f (AW) and 1m (here) on her last two outings
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner who has edged back down the weights and finished on the heels of the winner with contrasting tactics over 9.4f (AW) and 1m (here) on her last two outings; soundly beaten on sole start beyond that, however, when trying 1m2f last September.

3:06.race_name: Showcasing Standing At Whitsbury Manor Handicap

runners.name: Kinetic Force
runners.comment: Quiet in two AW runs this winter but return to turf/new tongue-tie could help; contender
runners.spotlight: Promising 2yo, winning on debut (5f, good) and placed in novice company either side of a Listed fourth subsequently; two modest AW runs this winter but dropped 5lb for his troubles and he could prove a different proposition back on turf with a tongue-tie fitted; Silvestre De Sousa back on for the first time since that debut success.

runners.name: Think Of A Name
runners.comment: C&D win on heavy last October; opening mark not an obvious gift; gelded since last run
runners.spotlight: C&D win on heavy ground last October (the only time Oisin Murphy has ridden him); gelded since last seen; improvement required now handicapping after six months off.

runners.name: Sunshine Soul
