runners.comment: Not progressing but the return to turf can help; cheekpieces now added
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who isn't progressing; handicapper easing her burden and she could benefit from the return to turf; cheekpieces join the tongue-tie this afternoon.

runners.name: Alashos
runners.breeder: Scea Marmion Vauville, Ecurie Skymarc Fa
runners.comment: Solid efforts in defeat the last twice but the change of headgear needs to give him a lift
runners.spotlight: Ran right up to his best when third at Nottingham last week, on first run after a gelding operation; more required to defy this mark but a change of headgear could give him a lift.

runners.name: Solar Edge
runners.comment: Two 5f nursery wins last year; dropped away on his return but should last longer today
runners.spotlight: Won 5f nurseries at Chepstow (good to soft) and Lingfield (AW) last year; dropped away tamely on return to action three weeks ago but likely to last longer today.

runners.name: Monomyth
runners.comment: Won off this mark in August; gelded since last start; now hooded; significant rain a query
runners.spotlight: Made a winning nursery debut at Doncaster (6f, good to firm) last August and he's finished runner-up twice since (both on AW); gelded since a lesser run at Lingfield nine weeks ago and now wears a hood for the first time; significant rain would be a query.

runners.name: Beautiful Things
runners.comment: Returns to turf with plenty to prove after two lacklustre AW runs this year
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a disappointing run at Kempton and she's offered little in two AW runs this year; hopes rest on the return to turf sparking a revival (ran well here on heavy last October).

runners.name: Lady Dorchester

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: 0-9 as a 2yo; had a wind op during her 201-day absence; improvement required
runners.spotlight: 0-9 as a 2yo; last seen struggling on heavy ground here on stable debut in October; had a wind op prior to this reappearance; others bring more pressing claims.

runners.name: Toolatetonegotiate
runners.comment: Banging at the door on AW & placed over C&D on debut; latest 2nd looked one that got away
runners.spotlight: Still seeking her first win but she's been banging at the door on AW since October; looked to be launching a winning move at Lingfield three weeks ago but the winner pulled out more; should be just as good on turf and ran well over C&D on her debut; each-way shout.

runners.name: Over Spiced
runners.comment: Went the wrong way on AW over the winter but changed yards and could be revived by turf
runners.spotlight: Went the wrong way for Paul Attwater this winter but she's dropped 13lb in the weights and makes her stable debut (sold 4,600gns this month) at a realistic level; interesting back on turf.

4:51.race_name: Whitsbury Manor Supporting Lope Y Fernandez Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B/C/D) (GBB)

runners.name: Gladiadora
runners.owner: R Coleman, G Glendining, L Glendining
runners.comment: 80-1 and hooded, always behind in Naas maiden (1m, good) last August for Michael Grassick
runners.spotlight: Late foal; 80-1 and hooded, always behind in maiden at Naas (1m, good) last August for Michael Grassick.

runners.name: Tonis Legacy
runners.comment: Remote finishes in two 1m4f races at Ffos Las last summer
runners.spotlight: There's stamina in the pedigree but she had remote finishes in two 1m4f races at Ffos Las last summer.

runners.name: Camino De Santiago
runners.owner: Jim And Claire And Mrs Mary- Anne Parker
runners.comment: Masar half-sister to two winners, including Skysail (6f 2yo/1m; RPR 103); late foal
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; Masar half-sister to winners Skysail (6f 2yo/1m; RPR 103) and Lommerzheim (German 1m1f/1m2f); dam 7f/1m winner (89); late foal; the market moves can guide on debut.

runners.name: Sayidah New Bay
runners.comment: 57,000gns foal, 45,000euros yearling by New Bay; stable has been going very well this year
runners.spotlight: 57,000gns foal, 45,000euros yearling by New Bay; first foal; dam runner-up at 11.4f on turf/1m4f AW (RPR 81), half-sister to 7f/1m Listed winner Doom, out of US 9.5f/1m2f Grade 1 winning half-sister to 1m 2yo Group 1 winner Sulk; her stable has been going well this year and she is very much one to note on debut.

runners.name: Castro Aurum
runners.comment: A leading contender on form and should stay 1m, if taking to the new cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Second at Windsor (6f, good to firm) last July and renewed improvement when third on handicap debut at Yarmouth (7f, good) in September; a leading contender on form and should stay 1m, if taking to the new cheekpieces.

runners.name: Maeva
runners.comment: 14-1 and tongue tied at Kempton (1m, AW) last October, with modest form but some promise
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to connections' useful 1m4f winner Jeremiah; 14-1 and tongue tied in novice at Kempton (1m, AW) last October, with modest form in ninth of 14 but she showed some promise trying to come from behind.

runners.name: Nanino Niyati
runners.comment: By Destino; second foal; dam German 7f winner (including 2yo/Listed; RPR 95)
runners.spotlight: By Destino; second foal; dam German 7f winner (including 2yo/Listed; RPR 95); probably one for later on but she needs a market check.

runners.name: Pave The Way
runners.comment: Staying-on second at Kempton (7f, AW) in October but two backward steps followed last year
runners.spotlight: Sole turf start was debut, when trailing on heavy ground; staying-on second at Kempton (7f, AW; 20-1) in October next time and that form would make her a player today, but two backward steps followed last year.

runners.name: Peace First
runners.comment: By Adaay; dam 1m6f Flat (RPR 62) and 2m hurdle winner, half-sister to useful Zoffee
runners.spotlight: By Adaay; first foal; dam 1m6f Flat (RPR 62) and 2m hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Zoffee (useful 11.4f-2m2f Flat and 2m/2m1f hurdle/chase) and Al Neksh (useful 1m-1m2f), out of 1m4f winner; stable was off the mark for the season recently.

runners.name: Sixteen One
runners.comment: Debut form (sole turf start) has not been repeated but placed on AW on last two outings
runners.spotlight: Pipped on debut (6f, good to firm) last July on sole turf start, form which has not been repeated but she was placed on Lingfield AW (7f/1m) this year on her last two outings; wore cheekpieces for latest; place claims.

2:01.race_name: Dragon Symbol Standing At Whitsbury Manor Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Harlington
runners.comment: Consistent; needs to improve on his turf form to win this but no way is he dismissed
runners.spotlight: In the frame on all three starts at this track (all last year) and his consistent form for current stable (when usually ridden by Taylor Fisher) also includes two autumn wins at Wolverhampton; needs to improve on his turf form to win this but no way is he dismissed.

runners.name: Khangai
runners.comment: Very busy autumn/winter and basically kept his form well but below form on turf latest
runners.spotlight: Free-going sort who had a very busy autumn/winter on AW and basically kept his form well under varied tactics; Mason Paetel had a winner for the yard on Thursday but this 5yo has been below form under him on two of last three starts, including when returned to turf eight days ago.

runners.name: Fiddlers Green
runners.comment: Underperforming since last June but won this (good) last year in fine style off same mark
runners.spotlight: Had three wins in the space of four races last February-April, including this contest (on good) which he took in fine style; back to the same mark today, due to underperforming since last June, but the switch back from AW seemed to do him some good last year, so he needs a second look.

runners.name: Guinness Lad
runners.comment: He's never been beaten less than 10l after nine races but this is his first Flat handicap
runners.spotlight: He's never been beaten less than 10l after nine races but this is his first Flat handicap, so should be more interesting this time in theory.

runners.name: Its Tim
runners.comment: Improved second of 11 at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) last time and that's despite racing wide
runners.spotlight: Tongue tied under Jack Callan for both his handicaps, improved second of 11 at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) last time and that's despite racing wide; this longer trip holds plenty of interest too and he is one to note on turf debut.

runners.name: Angel On High
runners.comment: 2-34 score, last win in 2023; seconds and thirds last May-August give him a form chance
runners.spotlight: 2-34 overall, with his last win in 2023 but he had a dose of seconds and thirds last May-August which give him a form chance; reappearance asks a question and he was soundly beaten on his only two starts on softer than good.

quotes.race: Park Lane Group Handicap
quotes.quote: Relieved is the word - Angel On High has been a little bit frustrating. It's been tough getting to this point and I could scarcely believe he came fifth last time. Maybe the drop back in trip helped him today. His previous form looks like he wants a mile and a half but he's such a strong traveller - perhaps we were barking up the wrong tree with that. He isn't a monkey this horse, he has just had a few issues and maybe he thinks about them a bit. His confidence has been growing the past few months and that will do him the world of good. He had every excuse to down tools but he was very brave - Adrian Wintle, trainer.

runners.name: Miss Dubai
runners.comment: Consistent most of last term; more to prove after 212 days off and on softer than good
runners.spotlight: Not proven on softer than good; consistent over this sort of trip for most of last term, winning one of her handicaps, but there's more for her to prove after the 212 days off and she needs to be at her peak.

runners.name: Formal Address
runners.comment: Going down by 1l at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) on penultimate start stands out in his six races
runners.spotlight: Six races and going down by a length on handicap debut at Lingfield (1m2f, AW) on penultimate start stands out; he didn't get the clearest of runs from off the pace that day and the same was true on turf debut Brighton eight days ago; has raced freely but now steps up in trip.

runners.name: Ladypacksapunch

prev_owners.owner: M Clarke, J Devine, P Munnelly & A Regan

runners.comment: Not the percentage call but sole win was over C&D and close third over C&D 16 days ago
runners.spotlight: Only one win from 36 races and although it was over C&D last August, that's from 19 visits here; while she's not the percentage call, a close third over C&D 16 days ago reiterated that she could be on the premises.

runners.name: Thiscouldbefun
runners.owner: Mrs Wendy Jarrett & J S Moore
runners.comment: Placed in six of her eight starts since handicapping; may not want too much rain
runners.spotlight: Placed in six of her eight starts since handicapping; the last five were over 7f/1m on the AW, but she was third of nine on turf at Newbury (7f, good to firm) last summer; may not want too much rain but a major player otherwise.

stable_tour.quote: Coulsty has been doing well and has produced a couple of nice two-year-olds. She's got plenty of size and scope like most of mine. She's only a couple of weeks off a run. The jockeys who have ridden her absolutely love her but she'll be your seven-furlong type of horse. 04-07-24

runners.name: Red Admiral
runners.comment: Sent off just 15-8 when out of the frame on stable debut at Wolverhampton; watch market
runners.spotlight: 100,000euros yearling; after having been gelded and undergone wind surgery he could only manage fifth of 12 on stable debut at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in February, but was sent off just 15-8; interesting to see if his backers return on handicap debut.

runners.name: Bintshuaa
runners.comment: Makes stable/handicap debut after six months off; 1m on a stiff track not sure to suit
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability in three starts over 6f for William Haggas last year (tongue tied final outing, missing today); makes her stable/handicap debut (same owners) after six months off but her pedigree raises doubts now stepping up to 1m on a stiff track; non-runner.

runners.name: Yellow Card
runners.comment: Makes turf/handicap debut after four months off having been gelded; worth a market check
runners.spotlight: All three starts in AW novices late last year, his best effort when fourth of 12 at Wolverhampton (7f) on his final outing (race has produced winners); makes his turf/handicap debut after four months off having been gelded and well worth a market check.

runners.name: Opening Bat
runners.owner: Mrs R J Mccreery And Richard Craddock
runners.comment: Out of the frame in three starts late last year, but has a striking pedigree; interesting
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in three starts over 7f/1m on turf/AW late last year, but hinted at ability; makes his handicap debut after four months off having been gelded, but he has a striking pedigree and no surprise if he takes a step forward; market revealing.

runners.name: Pay Attention
runners.comment: Fourth on return/stable debut at Yarmouth 15 days ago, but proved inconsistent last year
runners.spotlight: Made a promising return/stable debut when fourth of 12 at Yarmouth (1m, good) 15 days ago; considered if building on that, but he proved inconsistent for Tom Ward last year so wouldn't be certain to back it up.

runners.name: Sheephavenbaystory
runners.comment: Placed once in four starts last year; watch market on handicap debut after five months off
runners.spotlight: Best effort in four starts over 7f last year when third of 11 at Wolverhampton (AW; first-time hood) in October, but ran moderately at Chelmsford on her final outing; watch market on handicap debut after five months off; non-runner.

runners.name: Phaedra
runners.comment: Out of the frame in four starts last year; needs to have progressed after five months off
runners.spotlight: Didn't improve much when fifth of 12 on nursery debut at Southwell (7f, AW) on her fourth and final start last year; needs to have progressed after five months off; market useful.

runners.name: Belabambina
runners.comment: Out of the frame in all four starts including on handicap debut; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Beaten under 2l into sixth of 11 on last month's Wolverhampton return (7f, AW; 150-1), but the form didn't look solid and she didn't back it up on handicap debut at Lingfield last time; others preferred.

runners.name: Captain Cess
runners.comment: Third in a Newmarket seller last August, the form of which worked out well; watch market
runners.spotlight: Best of his three efforts last year when third of seven in a Newmarket seller (7f, good) on his final outing in August; not seen since, but the form of that race worked out really well and Tom Marquand an eyecatching booking; well worth monitoring in the market on handicap debut; stable also runs Havana Club.

runners.name: Beaune
runners.comment: Modest form at Dundalk during the winter; improvement needed on stable/turf debut
runners.spotlight: Modest form in four starts over 7f/1m at Dundalk (AW) during the winter; makes his stable/turf debut having been gelded since last seen; improvement needed.

runners.name: Havana Club
runners.comment: Made the frame four times last year; each-way claims if reappearance has brought him on
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in all four nurseries for Warren Greatrex last year but made a low-key return/stable debut at Wolverhampton (9.5f, AW) last month; each-way claims on his best form if the run has brought him on.

5:45.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Decrelot
runners.owner: Hk Football Club Horse Racing Syndicate
runners.comment: A little more promise last time (5f) but unplaced on all six starts; new trip and surface
runners.spotlight: He has finished no better than eighth in his six appearances; they have all come on turf but over three different trips at each of the Honk Kong venues; looked to run his best race yet on his latest outing (5f) to be beaten under 3l; pedigree says trip could be okay but he failed miserably when raced over 7f; plenty to prove on dirt debut but drops into Class 5 for the first time.

runners.name: Meepmeep
runners.comment: Has gone well both dirt starts; placed twice from three runs under Purton; chance
runners.spotlight: In the money on both ventures into dirt racing, with his track-and-trip third to Shanghai Style a fair effort in the context of this event; now on a 2lb lower mark than for that and the booking of Zac Purton (placed twice from three rides on this 5yo) won't hinder his obvious claims.

runners.name: En Perfecto
runners.breeder: H Mackley No 1 Trust & Haunui Blood
runners.owner: Jason Sung, James Mathew Fong Et Al
runners.comment: First-time blinkers and the switch to dirt need to have a major impact is he is to figure
runners.spotlight: Cheekpieces are removed in favour of first-time blinkers; has managed a single fourth place in nine career appearances, all of which have been on turf; dropped to this level for the first time last month without great encouragement; switch to dirt needs to make a dramatic difference if he is to shine.

runners.name: The Prime
runners.comment: Encouragement has been sparse during his compilation of a 0-9 record, including on dirt
runners.spotlight: Encouragement has been sparse as he has compiled a record of 0-9; failled to get involved and beaten more than 7l on his first taste of this surface last time out (6f); beaten more than 8l on sole start at this trip; difficult to make a case for.

runners.name: Colourful Baron
runners.comment: One win and 47% rate of making the frame in 17 runs on dirt; poor on both starts this year
runners.spotlight: By far the most experienced dirt performer in the field, with one win and a 47% rate of making the frame from 17 starts on this track; both career wins have come over 1m1f and he arrives on the back of two dismal efforts this year; safer to look elsewhere.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Supporting Irish Champions Weekend (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Cornman is a lovely horse. He was always going to improve for a run and Colin says he will improve again. He was always going to be a three-year-old. He is one to look forward to - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer

runners.name: Perfect Peach
runners.comment: Return to dirt and this longer trip may help him build on a hint of recent promise on turf
runners.spotlight: There are entries on his CV which provide hope that he can play a part in this sort of contest; in May last year he was beaten just over one length over this course and distance off a similar mark; his last two turf runs have seen him staying on at the end of 7f without landing a blow; return to dirt and this trip may prompt a return to form.

runners.name: Super Treasure
runners.owner: Martin Yung Ping Fai & Kwok Yi Chit
runners.comment: Nothing he has done in seven starts can lead to any positive comment regarding his chance
runners.spotlight: He has been a big outsider in all of his seven starts and in being unplaced every time, has crossed the line at least 7l adrift of the winner on each occasion; hard to consider.

runners.name: Tattenham

prev_owners.owner: T G Heptinstall, Ms N J Cruickshank Et Al

runners.comment: Signs are that he can see out this trip but makes dirt debut after a four-month break
runners.spotlight: Successful once in 25 Hong Kong outings, over 6f at Happy Valley; his win in Australia came over a similar distance, but there is a stamina influence in his pedigree and he has been placed once over 1m; not disgraced all five runs this term, but starts on dirt for the first time after more than four months off and he doesn't have much of a record when fresh.

runners.name: Tradition
runners.comment: He's in good heart and has form on the surface and over this trip; looks to be a contender
runners.spotlight: Tackled dirt for the first time two runs ago, staying on late to be a never-nearer fourth behind Yoda's Choice (1m1f); subsequently beaten just over one length when filling second at Happy Valley over this trip; not one to discount as he's in good heart and has form on the surface.

runners.name: Family Fortune
runners.owner: Tony Stradmoor, Billy Li Sze Kuen Et Al
runners.comment: Good run last time to be a close third (7f); yet to shine either on dirt or over this trip
runners.spotlight: On the plus side is his latest one-length third to Regency Happy Star here (7f); that reads well but it came on turf; has failed to make the frame either time he has competed on dirt and on both occasions he has tackled this distance.

runners.name: Silver Destiny
runners.breeder: Mrs D R Andersen & A A K Leander
runners.comment: Likely to sit close to the pace and bred to stay; fairly treated on best form; claims
runners.spotlight: Although he is 0-12, was unplaced on his only previous encounter with dirt and has yet to compete over the distance, so there are some positives; likely to sit close to the pace given his speed for 6f and that's no bad thing on this circuit; has made the frame three times and is nicely treated on those efforts; pedigree suggests he can handle the distance; each-way prospects.

runners.name: So Awesome
runners.owner: Eddie Law Kar Chung, Ada Ng Wai Hing Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Eddie Law Kar Chung, Ada Ng Wai Hing & Edwin Law Pok Hin

runners.comment: Running well on turf; proven on this surface despite not tackling it in four years; player
runners.spotlight: Has the draw and the early pace to suggest he can set the fractions; twice in the money from three runs on this surface and has finished runner-up over course and distance; however, he has not contested a dirt race since July 2021; running well on turf and with proven ability on this course, is one to consider.

runners.name: Harrys Hero
runners.comment: Unplaced in 21 of his 24 appearances since moving to Hong Kong, including all six on dirt
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all six times he has been asked to perform on this dirt course, including three over track and trip; won over 7f on turf here in December, but he has been unplaced in 21 of his 24 appearances since moving to Hong Kong.

runners.name: Yeaboi
runners.owner: Ting Ping Sing, David Ting Chi Ho & Ting Mei Wan
runners.comment: Developing into a dirt specialist; had five of these behind him last time; major player
runners.spotlight: Has found his feet on this dirt track, with a win (1m1f) and three places on his last four appearances; five of these rivals were behind him last time (including leading contender Meepmeep) and he is on the same handicap mark; major chance.

runners.name: Smart Beauty
runners.comment: Below-par all eight starts this term; comprehensively beaten all three tries on dirt
runners.spotlight: Proved a progressive performer last season with four wins at 1m or 1m1f; way below-par on all eight starts this term and has been comprehensively beaten in all three tries on dirt.

runners.name: Link
runners.comment: Connections put him on dirt for the first time to try and improve on a little turf promise
runners.spotlight: There have been a couple of runs which suggest he has some ability, but far more to raise concerns about his consistency; connections put him on dirt for the first time to try and bring about a positive response.

10:50.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Juneau Pride
runners.comment: Very progressive 3yo who has won three of his last four over C&D; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Very progressive 3yo who has won three of his last four over C&D; up another 7lb since last month's cosy success and drawn wider today but still commands respect.

runners.name: Another World
runners.comment: Won comfortably over C&D last month and is now 3-7; probably still on the upgrade
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who look suited by the drop back in trip when winning comfortably over C&D three weeks ago and is now 3-7; probably still has more improvement to come; likely contender.

runners.name: Absolute Honour

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but safely held on first two Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but safely held on first two Hong Kong starts (both 6f); today's return to 7f will suit but others have much stronger claims.

quotes.race: Tipperary Races Median Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Surpass is a work in progress, he's still very babyish and when he puts it all together he has the makings of a lovely horse. He could go for a race like the Tyros Stakes now - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

runners.name: Beauty Crescent
runners.comment: Frustrating 5yo who has been placed several times over C&D this season but is 0-29 in HK
runners.spotlight: Frustrating 5yo who has been placed several times over C&D this season but remains a local maiden after 29 starts; may have to settle for another minor role today.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Colin (Keane) was at his best there and deserves full credit. I debated leaving the blinkers off Beauty Crescent as he ran keen to post at the Curragh and is fresh but Colin did the right thing at the start in pulling him out to think of another day. They've pulled 12 lengths clear so it's a good performance from the front two. His future is in Hong Kong. I'd imagine after speaking to (his owner) Mr (Simon) Kwok that we'll put him into quarantine and send him on - Ger Lyons, trainer.

runners.name: Mega Force

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Very useful when trained in Ireland but soundly beaten on all three Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Very useful when based in Ireland but soundly beaten on first three Hong Kong starts (1m-1m3f) and not sure to be ideally suited by this drop back to 7f.

quotes.race: Pat "The Duke" Leavy Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Gasper De Lemos had a lovely run first day and he will be very happy stepping up to 1m. He is a middle-distance horse for next year. He's more one for the Futurity than the Dewhurst - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden over 7f at the Curragh and finished second in the Zetland Stakes over 1m2f. He's done well and is working nicely at the moment. He'll step into a Derby trial on a nice bit of ground. 03-04-24

runners.name: Ragga Bomb
runners.comment: Always towards rear over C&D when a big-priced outsider for recent Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Showed some useful form in Ireland but was always towards rear over C&D when a big-priced outsider for recent Hong Kong debut.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Gleneagles Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Ragga Bomb is a weak horse and that could be it for this year. He will strengthen up an awful lot for next year and seven is his trip - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Stellar Swift
runners.owner: Lily Chan Li Lei & Marc Chan

prev_owners.owner: Lindsay Park Bloodstock, J S C Chua Et Al

runners.comment: Stayed on strongly for recent 6f win; 7f also suits, but he's up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Stayed on strongly to score at Happy Valley (6f) 11 days ago and will be suited by today's return to 7f but has more on his plate in this higher grade.

runners.name: Target Audience

prev_owners.owner: M Keesom, J Heasley Et Al

runners.comment: Won on debut in NZ last year and made encouraging HK debut this month; a possible
runners.spotlight: Won on debut in New Zealand (6.5f, AW) last June and made quite promising Hong Kong debut a fortnight ago, keeping on for sixth over 6f; could have a say if that recent outing brought him on.

runners.name: Bright Day
runners.comment: Four-time winner when based in Macau but yet to make a splash in Hong Kong
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner when based in Macau but unable to land a telling blow on any of first seven Hong Kong starts (6f-7f); probably needs a drop in grade.

runners.name: New Forest
runners.comment: Ex-Australian 4yo who has made the frame on three of his four Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who has made the frame on three of his four Hong Kong starts (once over C&D); dropped 2lb since last month's fourth on dirt (1m); probably won't be far away.

runners.name: South Star
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo who delivered on earlier promise when eased-down winner over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who delivered on earlier promise when eased-down winner over C&D three weeks ago; moves up in grade today but could easily have a lot more to offer.

runners.name: Call Me Gorgeous
runners.breeder: Grimley B B A Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Kept on for fourth over 6f last month and looks ready for another crack at 7f
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo; yet to be placed after five Hong Kong starts this year but was denied a clear run before keeping on for fourth over 6f here last month and looks ready for another crack at 7f.

runners.name: Sugar Ball
runners.owner: Lau Po Keung, Yee Shun Hung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Carringbush Park, Miss K A Brideoake & Ms L S Dillon

runners.comment: Dual 6f course winner in early part of this season but needs to better his recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f course winner in early part of this season and back on a good mark now but needs to up his game after some below-par recent efforts.

6:15.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: I P O Bros
runners.comment: Well beaten at big odds on all six starts since arriving in Hong Kong and hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Twice a winner in Singapore; well beaten at big odds on all six starts since arriving in Hong Kong; looks in need of further help from the handicapper, although blinkers are now applied.

runners.name: Gallant Epoch
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Simon Suen Siu Man & Chloe Suen
runners.comment: Returns to C&D over which she has a win and two places from four attempts; big chance
runners.spotlight: Moved up to an extended 1m at Happy Valley last time with disastrous results; returns to this track and trip over which she has recorded a win and two places from four attempts; 1lb higher than when beaten half a length by The Auspicious; major player.

runners.name: Top Dragon
runners.owner: Vincent To Wai Keung, K To Kin Ting & R To Yiu Ting
runners.comment: Two narrow 6f defeats give him a major chance; no luck last time and Purton now on board
runners.spotlight: Forget his first tilt at this 7f last time and he holds a major chance; reasons to draw a line through that last effort as he was caught out wide and taken back to last spot and was twice impeded when trying to launch a bid in the straight; twice beaten in photo finishes prior to that (6f) and now has Zac Purton on top for the first time; leading contender wearing a tongue-tie for the first time.

runners.name: Dreaming Winner
runners.comment: His second over 6f here reads well and you can forgive latest lapse; stall 12 is a concern
runners.spotlight: Improvement seems certain from this lightly raced 4yo who caught the eye when a close second to Super Love over 6f here in February; well held over this trip last time but didn't have the clearest of passages and was having a second run in quick time; with a short break behind him, he has to be considered but stall 12 is an issue.

runners.name: Thunder Blink
runners.owner: Cheung Yat Yuen & Yiu King Chuen
runners.comment: Picked up two novice wins (5f/6f) last term; life has been tough since taking in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Picked up a pair of novice wins (5f/6f) last term; life has been tough since moving into handicap company, as six unplaced efforts demonstrate; hood and visor removed in favour of first-time blinkers; others preferred.

runners.name: Golden Luck
runners.owner: Chan Kam Shing, Wu Kai Char Et Al
runners.comment: Likely front-runner; does his winning at Happy Valley; needs to prove himself over 7f
runners.spotlight: Likely to set up the race from the front; triple 6f winner but those victories have all come at Happy Valley; that's not to say he doesn't act here, having recorded a third place over 5f; bred to relish 7f but has to prove that on the track.

runners.name: Fortune Star
runners.owner: Kelvin Chan Kam Kei & Eddie Chan Kam Kong
runners.comment: Showed promise on sole start; there is better to come over this extra furlong; place hopes
runners.spotlight: Ran better on debut than his triple-digit odds suggested, keeping on through the line to finish fifth behind Jumbo Treasure; this extra furlong is in his favour and he is worth a second look.

runners.name: Jubilant Winner
runners.comment: Races from the same mark as when beaten a neck over C&D in October; serious contender
runners.spotlight: Looking to break his duck at the seventh attempt; it would be no surprise if he did, with three good placed efforts on his record (6f/7f); races from the same mark as for his neck second over C&D; on the shortlist.

runners.name: Regency Win Win
runners.comment: Noted keeping on nicely in the second half of his debut (6f); bred to stay at least 7f
runners.spotlight: There was little in his trials to recommend his chance on debut but, having been given time to find his stride early, was noted keeping on nicely in the second half of his debut (6f); bred to stay at least this far and has a future; first-time cheekpieces take the eye.

runners.name: Sandman
runners.comment: Has not shown enough in trials to think a winning debut is imminent; bred to stay further
runners.spotlight: Has not caused much of a stir on the morning trial grounds; his sire won five times (1m2f/1m4f) and there is more staying blood on his dam's side (although she won at 7f); cheekpieces might not be enough to encourage debut support.

runners.name: Strathpeffer
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; has run well enough most starts this term; place hopes off this mark
runners.spotlight: Dual course-and-distance winner which stands him in good stead; not disgraced on last two appearances and more than capable of making the frame of this mark (5lb above last winning rung in the handicap).

runners.name: Arden
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs James Tien Pei Chun
runners.comment: Well beaten all three runs at big odds; first-time blinkers and an extra furlong now tried
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on all three outings, being sent off at big odds each time; moves up a furlong in first-time blinkers with plenty to prove.

runners.name: Jolly Jumper
runners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate
runners.comment: Failed on dirt last time; 8lb lower than his close C&D fourth to Juneau Pride; player
runners.spotlight: Ran as if disliking the transfer to dirt last time; although he is 0-7, there have been efforts over both 6f and 7f which deserve plenty of credit; down 3lb from his last run and 8lb lower than when a close fourth to Juneau Pride over C&D in January; contender.

runners.name: Shine Bright
runners.comment: Latest fourth was his best yet but stall 14 makes stepping up again a tough assignment
runners.spotlight: Has needed experience to find some form and latest outing was his best, a fourth behind Super Express; set the gallop that day but might find a repeat difficult from stall 14.

runners.name: Bucephalas
runners.comment: Has shown enough in four Hong Kong outings to think there is better to come in time
runners.spotlight: Winner in Australia (6f) where he stayed 1m; hood removed; has shown enough in four Hong Kong outings to think there is more to come; he has dropped another 2lb but may need to head a little further south in the ratings.

runners.name: Smart Fighter
runners.comment: Has made the frame (without winning) in six of his 12 starts at this venue; fairly treated
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame (without winning) in six of his 12 starts at this venue, but both of his wins have come at Happy Valley (6f); seems to stay 7f and fairly treated at the weights.

6:45.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Solid Shalaa
runners.comment: C&D scorer who made highly promising return after 11 months off three weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Returned from a long absence to finish 0.5l second to California Star over this C&D three weeks ago; now 6lb better off with the winner and should come on for that run.

runners.name: Natural High
runners.comment: In good form in four similar C&D events this year; chance again though draw not ideal.
runners.spotlight: Has posted four good C&D efforts already this year, most recently when 0.75l fourth to California Star; is 6lb better off with that rival here but again must overcome wide draw; likes to race prominently.

runners.name: Candlelight Dinner
runners.comment: Front-runner who needs to improve upon the form of his first seven runs; might prefer 5f.
runners.spotlight: Trailblazing front-runner who has failed to last home in seven unplaced career starts; would have some claims on the form of his 3.25l 5f fourth off 8lb higher mark in January.

runners.name: Jolly Companion
runners.comment: Inconsistent; twice a C&D hero at double-figure odds but other recent form is modest.
runners.spotlight: Has already registered two C&D triumphs this season but is 6lb above his highest winning mark and his last three starts have all been below par.

runners.name: Handsome Blond
runners.comment: Well-related newcomer who has not shown enough in trial races to make him a likely winner.
runners.spotlight: Eleventh foal of an unplaced dam who is a half-brother to seven winners and cost AUS$80,000 as a yearling; placed just once in five local trial races so may struggle off his opening handicap mark.

runners.name: Sugar Queen Prawn
runners.comment: Unplaced in all six trial race starts so it will be a shock if he manages a debut victory.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a four-time sprint winner who cost NZ$75,000 as a 2yo; has not impressed in six local trial races so it is hard to see him being ready for a debut success.

runners.name: Golden Friendship
runners.owner: Janet Wong Hoi Shan, John Yuen Se Kit Et Al
runners.comment: Has shown ability in three starts (all 6f, turf); down 2lb and new surface could suit.
runners.spotlight: Raced prominently in his first two starts, then made the running last time; beaten by 3l or less on all three occasions; now trying dirt; switch to more patient tactics might also help.

runners.name: Fun N Fun Together
runners.comment: Front-runner who has been placed in four of nine runs; blinkers added and Purton booked.
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden (five top-four finishes) who likes to force the pace but has been unable to last home; last two starts less encouraging; blinkers replacing cheekpieces and Purton up for the first time.

runners.name: Autumn Delight
runners.comment: Two modest runs last season then injured a tendon; off since July; won two recent trials.
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at long odds in two starts before suffering tendon injury last July; has won two recent trial races, so it would be no surprise if he were no make a great leap forward.

runners.name: California Star
runners.breeder: Mme Julie Mestrallet, Mme Francine Mestrallet Mercier & Mme

prev_owners.owner: The Exors Of The Estate Of The Late Howard Liang Yum Shing

runners.comment: Surprise C&D winner last time after five modest efforts; more on his plate upped 6lb here.
runners.spotlight: Left previous form well behind when overcoming slow start to grab 19-1 C&D victory three weeks ago; upped 6lb for that success and needs to prove that is was no fluke.

runners.name: Robot Knight
runners.comment: Irregular winner (1-17 strike rate); victory was over C&D; edging down the weights.
runners.spotlight: Only victory from 17 tries came off 2lb lower mark over C&D in October; has largely struggled in six subsequent runs, though C&D third of 12 (off 5lb higher) in February was a good effort.

runners.name: Yeah Buddy
runners.comment: Off the mark at 17th try over this C&D last month; 6lb higher here in a competitive race.
runners.spotlight: Has shown improved form since switching to dirt five starts ago and finally broke his duck at the 17th attempt over this C&D three weeks ago; now 6lb higher and this looks a competitive affair.

runners.name: Magniac

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J Andrews, R F Drage Et Al

runners.comment: Has won over C&D off a much higher rating but is badly out of form; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Successful off a 17lb higher mark over C&D 15 months ago but has been unplaced in all 13 runs since.

runners.name: Rising Force
runners.owner: Tai Woon Shing & Chan Koon Man
runners.comment: Up 8lb following easy C&D debut success as favourite 25 days ago; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism when, following a cosy trial race win, scoring by a comfortable 2l on last months C&D debut; raised 8lb; big player if late scratching allows him a place in the field.

7:15.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Etalon Or
runners.comment: His been expensive to follow (nine losses); good 7f second latest and now upped to 1m
runners.spotlight: Usually strong in the betting market but still without a win after nine attempts; stayed on well from rear to finish a half-length second over 7f a fortnight ago; upped to 1m for the first time.

runners.name: Beauty Live
runners.comment: Class 2 winner over C&D in his pomp but badly out of form at present
runners.spotlight: Has posted four course victories, including one over C&D off a 33lb higher mark, but has suffered 22 consecutive losses since then; no sign of a revival in recent outings.

runners.name: He Was Me

prev_owners.owner: Price Bloodstock Management Ltd & Farmhouse Holdings P/L

runners.comment: Has been disappointing thus far; latest 4.5l fifth was marginally better; up from 7f
runners.spotlight: Has started at 62-1 or bigger and failed to finish in the top six in all six runs since arriving from Australia; slight improvement when visored last time; now upped from 7f.

runners.name: Mister Dapper
runners.owner: P Chan Pak Hou, J Chan Chi Kwong & J Chan Chon San
runners.comment: Switched trainer, then began the year with two fine C&D runs; flopped last time
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D scorer, including in second start for this trainer off 8lb higher mark in February; flopped badly when favourite again last time; chance if that run is forgotten.

runners.name: Blue Baron
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Mark Fong Chung, Matthew Fong & Victoria Fong

prev_owners.owner: Mark Fong Chung, Matthew Fong & Victoria Fong

runners.comment: Lightly raced and has shown ability on both outings four months apart; possible outsider
runners.spotlight: Made encouraging start when just under 3l fourth over 6f on November debut; beaten just under 4l when ninth over 1m on only other start a month ago; still has time on his side.

runners.name: Bright Inheritance
runners.owner: 23/24 Dennis C H Yip Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Darby Racing, A R Burfoot Et Al
Darby Racing, G Bachell Et Al

runners.comment: On a long losing run but best recent efforts and only win have been over C&D; interesting
runners.spotlight: Only victory from 16 local tries came off 9lb higher over C&D 11 months ago; back to his favoured distance here and down to a good mark, so merits respect.

runners.name: Silver Up
runners.owner: E C H Wong & Ms A S C Chu
runners.comment: Back from 11-week absence; form has been regressive; another new trainer here
runners.spotlight: No better than third in 13 local starts and is having his first outing for a fourth different trainer; mucus in lungs when last seen 11 weeks ago; up against it from wide draw.

runners.name: Fortune Boy
runners.owner: Ricky Wong Kin Chat & Helen Leung Yee Wan
runners.comment: His last two runs have been his best and first try at 1m could bring more improvement
runners.spotlight: Four-race career (three at 6f then one at 7f) has been one of steady progression, and notched his first placing when just under 3l third four weeks ago; may improve again upped in trip.

runners.name: Raging Rapids
runners.comment: Got to within 1l of victory when upped to 7f a fortnight go; could go well if 1m suits
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability in all four starts to date, especially last time when beaten by 1l upped to 7f; has another furlong to travel here so may continue on a upward curve.

runners.name: The Auspicious
runners.comment: Has run poorly six times and well once (7f win at odds of 132-1); now tries 1m
runners.spotlight: 132-1 victory over 7f here last month was a bolt from the blue but his other six runs have been at a much lower standard, including when beaten just under 5l last time; first try at 1m.

runners.name: Gale Saga
runners.comment: Has run moderately four times since winning over 7f here off 3lb higher mark in February
runners.spotlight: Highly inconsistent; has registered two 7f victories here but has failed to make the top five in his other 12 career starts; hard to predict and this trip maybe further than is ideal.

runners.name: Double Win
runners.owner: Dr Kelvin Chong Man Yuk & Ma Yuen Yu
runners.comment: 11-race maiden; has shown little this season; blinkers may prompt a change of fortune
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up off higher marks than today's but still a maiden after 11 tries; form has been regressive of late and ran poorly on return from a layoff last time; blinkers applied.

runners.name: Dragon Sunrise
runners.owner: Sunny Wong Chi Tat & Wong Tsz Wah
runners.comment: First sign of talent when 2.5l sixth over 7f last time; might improve again upped to 1m
runners.spotlight: Showed more than in any of his four earlier outings when staying on into sixth (beaten just over 2l) over 7f here last month as a 91-1 chance; needs to back that up on first 1m start.

runners.name: Happy Universe
runners.comment: First sign of ability when runner-up over 7f last time; that may have been a poor race
runners.spotlight: Made the top five for the first time in eight career outings when beaten just over a length into second over 7f here three weeks ago; needs to build on that run off a 1lb higher mark.

runners.name: Carryon Smiling
runners.owner: Charley Chan Wing Chin & Li Kit
runners.comment: Ran just ok off this mark (some trouble in running) last time after shock 7f win; reserve
runners.spotlight: Pulled off an 84-1 shock over 7f here in February following five poor runs to start his career; beaten by less than 4l and had troubled passage off this mark on only subsequent run.

runners.name: Celtic Times
runners.comment: Has a C&D success to his name but seems badly out of sorts this season; reserve
runners.spotlight: C&D winner off 9lb higher mark a year ago but has run poorly on all seven starts this season.

8:10.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Chill Kaka
runners.comment: Wide margin winner of a similar event 25 days ago; may be up to defying 9lb rise
runners.spotlight: Stormed clear to get off the mark by nearly 4l, with five of these rivals behind, over this C&D on his fifth career start three weeks ago; raised 9lb but likely to progress again.

runners.name: Precision Goal
runners.comment: Front-runner who is enjoying a profitable season (three C&D wins); blinkers now added
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is a dual C&D scorer already this year; now 6lb better off for the just over 2l he was beaten by Fashion Legend last time; blinkers applied.

runners.name: Fashion Legend
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.comment: Broke Hong Kong duck at 18th attempt on dirt debut over C&D last time; now 6lb higher
runners.spotlight: Has been raised 6lb in the ratings following his C&D success by just over a length (beating four of today's opponents) 25 days ago; should improve further, though his Hong Kong strike rate is just 1-18.

runners.name: Forever Folks
runners.comment: Needs to reverse C&D form with three of these rivals; good 1m1f second on previous run
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D scorer who finished behind three of these last time out; runner-up over 1m1f on previous start; remains 2lb above his highest winning mark.

runners.name: Vulcanus
runners.comment: Would hold solid claims if this were a 6f race, this trip likely to stretch his stamina
runners.spotlight: Three times a runner-up over 6f on dirt since a victory over that C&D in early December; has won off this kind of mark but likely to find this trip too far.

runners.name: All Are Mine
runners.comment: Badly out of form and held by Fashion Legend and Precision Goal from recent C&D run
runners.spotlight: Scored over 1m1f on this dirt track in December 2023, but his form has been on a downward spiral since then and was almost 5l behind Fashion Legend last time.

runners.name: Gallant Crown
runners.comment: Old-timer who is hard to fancy on his first ever run on dirt
runners.spotlight: Making a belated dirt debut after 63 turf outings; did win a Class 5 in February but would have surely tried this surface sooner if it were likely to suit.

runners.name: Run Run Timing
runners.breeder: G W Holdings A T F The Edwina Trust
runners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

runners.comment: Front-runner; just under 4l behind Chill Kaka on dirt debut last time; 9lb better off
runners.spotlight: Posted a solid first dirt run when beaten just under 4l into second by Chill Kaka over C&D last month; has a 9lb swing in the weights; well drawn for a possible front-runner.

runners.name: Viva Chaleur

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: Last two runs have been poor and still looking for a first local win after 26 starts
runners.spotlight: Still searching for his first Hong Kong victory after 26 attempts and is held on form by four of these from a recent C&D meeting.

runners.name: Lucky Banner
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Stephen Ho Wai Man, F Ho Ka Chun & D Ho Ka Chung
runners.comment: Lacks recent form but a repetition of his three autumn C&D runs would put him in the mix
runners.spotlight: Disappointing in his only two 2025 outings, though was found to be lame after latest run; would have a good shout if back to the form that brought him three C&D placings in the autumn.

runners.name: Spangle Fortune
runners.comment: Would be in with a shout on his autumn form (including C&D win); has run poorly of late
runners.spotlight: Successful over C&D in November, then runner-up off 1lb lower mark than today the following month; needs to bounce back after three modest 2025 runs.

runners.name: Phantom Cyclone
runners.breeder: Mrs J M & T M Henderson

prev_owners.owner: A Best, K Best Et Al

runners.comment: Much improved effort last time; will need further progress if he is to grab a first win
runners.spotlight: Finally showed some sparkle after ten straight down-the-field runs when third to Chill Kaka over C&D last time; needs a bit more if he is to break his duck.

runners.name: Lucky Impact
runners.comment: Displayed slight improvement last time; needs more if he is to get involved in the finish
runners.spotlight: Showed marginal improvement after a string of poor efforts when beaten just over 6l into seventh over C&D last time, but is held by a couple of today's rivals even on that form.

runners.name: Young Horizon
runners.comment: Has gone off the boil of late and unlikely to be suited by this trip or surface
runners.spotlight: Started the season well but, one third place apart, his form has since taken a turn for the worse; unproven over either this far or on this surface.

runners.name: Amazing Run
runners.comment: Has won off a 1lb higher mark; his form is on turf and over shorter; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Dirt debutant; started this season with a 7f win followed by a number of good efforts in defeat; his three 2025 starts have all been well below his best.

runners.name: Patch Of Time
runners.comment: Only beaten by half a length last time but that was over 6f; unlikely to stay 1m; reserve
runners.spotlight: Made a solid dirt debut when beaten half a length into third here last month, but both that and all his best previous form came over 6f, so today's trip is a big worry.

8:40.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Five G Patch
runners.comment: On a long losing run but usually contests Group races; eased in grade today; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but was not beaten far in two Group 3 handicaps in January (one over C&D), and his Group 1 defeat in February is easily overlooked; drops out of Group company for first time in over a year and is on a workable mark; shortlisted.

quotes.race: Donate To The Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle In Honour Of Pat Smullen Race
quotes.quote: I know Joseph always thought Collins Street was a really nice horse. You could say that the other horse has thrown it away but Declan (McDonogh) said that, if anything, Max Mayhem hampered him a little. Once Collin Street picked Max up he galloped all the way to the line. Another furlong or two would suit - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Collins Street is a lovely horse. He was a bit backward last year but he has come to life. They went a good gallop and Shane thinks he could be exciting. He could do no more than win the way he did - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

runners.name: Helene Feeling
runners.comment: Placed all four starts since G3 handicap win in January; probably in the shake-up again
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win 1m1f Group 3 handicap at Happy Valley in January and has been placed on all four subsequent appearances (1m-1m1f); holds no secrets from the handicapper but is likely to be on the premises again.

quotes.race: Cambion Electronics Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We thought Indian Dream was a nice horse at the start of the year but his tackle ruined his head and he's coming on now since he's been gelded. He made hard work of it but kept staying on and should go on from this - Ian Smith, travelling head lad.

runners.name: La City Blanche
runners.comment: On a good mark now but has become very inconsistent this season
runners.spotlight: Finished well for close third behind Helene Feeling in 1m1f Group 3 handicap at Happy Valley in January, but has become very inconsistent this season and is not the percentage call.

runners.name: Voyage Samurai
runners.comment: Seized chance to dominate from the front over 1m here this month; 6lb higher now, though
runners.spotlight: Seized the chance to dominate from the front when winning readily over 1m here a fortnight ago, but went up 6lb for that and may not have things all his own way today.

runners.name: Winning Dragon
runners.owner: Alexander Yeung Kwok Kai, Edward Yeung Et Al
runners.comment: Did not have race run to suit when third to Voyage Samurai over 1m recently; can do better
runners.spotlight: Excelled himself when fourth in 1m2f Group 1 here in February and would probably have preferred a stronger pace to aim at when keeping-on third behind Voyage Samurai in 1m handicap here a fortnight ago; will be suited by today's move back up in trip; respected.

runners.name: C P Brave
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Leung Lun, Paul Leung Yuk Hung & K Leung Yuk Wai
runners.comment: Triple C&D winner last season; below best lately but can't be ruled out off current mark
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing 8yo who won three times over C&D last season; below form on last couple of outings but on a good mark now and can't be ruled out.

quotes.race: Berkshire Youth Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: Piranesi has done well, I think a mile is his trip. He seemed to handle the ground, I think he handled the ground at Newbury last time but I'm not sure he quite stayed so we've come back to a mile today, it looks about right. He's still a big baby and he's still learning. When he went to go, he lugged off to the right a bit. When the other horse came to him that really helped him, pushed him on and straightened him up - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Bundle Award
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Colin Lo Chor Cheong
runners.comment: Won readily over C&D last month and subsequently ran well in Hong Kong Derby; big player
runners.spotlight: Took form to new level when staying on strongly for ready C&D success last month, his fifth Hong Kong start, and was very respectable seventh in Hong Kong Derby (1m2f) a fortnight later; back in a handicap today and should still have further improvement to come.

runners.name: Steps Ahead
runners.owner: Yeung Sing Tung, Sunny Yeung Wah Hon & Janice Yeung Wah Kei
runners.comment: C&D winner on latest handicap start and not discredited in two prestigious races since
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D on latest handicap start in February and probably bettered that performance when fifth in C&D Classic Cup last month; not beaten far when ninth in Hong Kong Derby last time; likely contender.

runners.name: Bravehearts
runners.comment: 3-5 for new stable this season and may still have more improvement to come
runners.spotlight: Took a while to strike form in Hong Kong but is 3-5 for new stable this season; just a respectable fifth off today's mark here (1m2f) in January and absent for three months since, but further progress remains possible.

runners.name: Californiatotality
runners.comment: Three wins this season; safely held in Classic Cup/Derby; can to be more competitive today
runners.spotlight: Three handicap wins this season, the last two over C&D; seemed to have limitations exposed in Classic Cup/Hong Kong Derby on last two outings but ought to be more competitive now back at this level.

runners.name: Pray For Mir
runners.owner: Chris So Chun Hung & Alexander So

prev_owners.owner: TFI & Kia Ora Stud W S

runners.comment: Game front-runner; in good form but faces tough task from 4lb out of weights
runners.spotlight: Game front-runner who came second on consecutive starts here (1m1f/1m2f) in February/March; also ran well when fifth over C&D four weeks ago but faces tough task from 4lb out of the weights in this higher grade.

9:10.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Copartner Prance
runners.comment: Very consistent over 6f on turf this year; makes his dirt debut today.
runners.spotlight: Very consistent in 6f turf handicaps this year and did well to finish fourth of seven in a recent Group 2; contender if able to transfer his best form to dirt.

runners.name: Beauty Waves
runners.comment: 5f Group 3 handicap winner on turf in October; a possible if he takes to this new surface
runners.spotlight: Career highlight when winning 5f Group 3 handicap on turf here in October; largely in good form over 5f/6f on turf since and easily excused his Group 1 defeat in January; makes dirt debut after three-month absence but has an Irish Polytrack win on his CV; a possible if he takes to this surface.

runners.name: Capital Delight
runners.comment: Finished strongly to lead on the post over C&D last time; may be vulnerable off new mark
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner this season, latterly when finishing strongly to lead on the post two months ago; might be a shade vulnerable after latest 6lb rise, though.

runners.name: Bottomuptogether
runners.comment: 4-10 on turf; runner-up off today's mark last month; major player on this dirt debut
runners.spotlight: 4-10 on turf; no threat to exciting prospect when second off today's mark three weeks ago, but that was still a good effort and he features very prominently in calculations on this dirt debut.

runners.name: Self Improvement
runners.owner: Wong Chung Yin & Wong Lai Ngor
runners.comment: Rallied gamely for narrow C&D win last month but disappointed when last in action
runners.spotlight: Rallied gamely for narrow C&D win last month, his second dirt success this season, but his next run was disappointing and he still needs to prove he can cope with a mark this high.

runners.name: Sing Dragon
runners.owner: The Rotary Club Of Gd-Hk-Ma-Gba Syndicate
runners.comment: 4-7 on dirt; had tough draw when only fifth last month; each-way claims at least today
runners.spotlight: Has very good 4-7 strike-rate on dirt and looked as good as ever when placed over C&D in February; had tough draw when only fifth here last month and has each-way claims at least today; 1lb wrong.

runners.name: Superb Capitalist
runners.owner: Li Cham Kuen & Li Ming Choi
runners.comment: Placed twice on turf here at start of this season but generally very disappointing since
runners.spotlight: Placed twice on turf here at start of this season but generally very disappointing since; needs to turn a corner; 2lb out of the handicap.

runners.name: Bundle Of Charm
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Colin Lo Chor Cheong
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last season but not firing on all cylinders this term; 4lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last season but not firing on all cylinders this term and competes from 4lb out of the weights today.

runners.name: Stellar Express
runners.comment: Has unconvincing record since 5f turf win in October; 4lb wrong for dirt debut
runners.spotlight: Made all to open Hong Kong account over 5f on turf here in December but has unconvincing record since and is 4lb out of the weights for this dirt debut.

9:40.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Gummy Gummy
runners.owner: Alan Kiang Ping Fai & Joyce Lee

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Placed twice over C&D last month and likely to be right in the thick of things again
runners.spotlight: Without a win since June 2023 but returned to form with two good C&D runs last month and, with Zac Purton enlisted, is likely to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Mask Rider
runners.comment: Already has mixed record in HK after only four starts; contender if on a going day
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo; already has very mixed record in Hong Kong after only four starts, but won over C&D on his local debut and was a close third two starts ago; contender if on a going day.

runners.name: Must Go
runners.comment: Bang-in-form 4yo who has won two of his last three over C&D; must be considered
runners.spotlight: Bang-in-form 4yo who quickened clear for a comfortable success last month and has now won two of his last three over C&D; must be considered in current mood.

runners.name: Super Fortune
runners.comment: On a tough mark now and best suited by 5f on turf
runners.spotlight: Largely in good form over 5f on turf this season but on tough mark now and was soundly beaten over C&D on only previous dirt start (in 2023).

runners.name: Master Champion

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: 6f maiden winner in Australia last August; makes Hong Kong/dirt debut today
runners.spotlight: Ended seven-race career in Australia with 6f maiden win last August, but makes Hong Kong/turf debut after an eight-month absence.

runners.name: Dragon Air Force
runners.owner: Au Kai Kwong & Michelle Jessica Au
runners.comment: Runner-up twice since upped to this grade but wide draw dents appeal today
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in Class 4 in December/January and runner-up twice in this higher grade since; may still have a bit more to offer but wide draw dents his appeal today.

runners.name: Gazeley
runners.owner: Billie Lam Chi Fan, Lee Shek Tang Et Al
runners.comment: Made winning debut in 1m turf maiden in Britain last August; drawn wide for HK debut
runners.spotlight: Made winning debut in 1m turf maiden in Britain last August, but has the outside draw for his Hong Kong debut and faces a different test over this C&D.

runners.name: Genius Baby
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Pang Wai Hak, Frankie Pang Ka Yeung & A Pang Ka Wai
runners.comment: A down-the-field outsider here (6f, turf) on recent Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Made winning debut in 5f AW maiden handicap in Australia last June, but was a down-the-field outsider here (6f, turf) on recent Hong Kong debut.

runners.name: Mojave Desert
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See
runners.comment: Ran poorly on turf last time but generally in good form since C&D win in December
runners.spotlight: Needs to bounce back from a duff effort on turf three weeks ago, but has largely remained in good form since winning over C&D on stable debut in December and is well drawn today.

runners.name: Galaxy Witness
runners.comment: Running respectably over C&D but needs a strong pace to aim at over this trip
runners.spotlight: Better known as a 7f/1m turf performer; all three C&D runs since February have been perfectly respectable, but he probably lacks the early zip to make full use of his inside draw today and his chance may depend on others setting a very strong pace.

runners.name: G Liner
runners.comment: 1m-1m1f winner; soundly beaten when dropped back to 6f for belated seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Won three times on dirt (1m-1m1f) in early part of last year, but found things tougher when upped to this grade in July and was soundly beaten when dropped back to 6f for last month's belated reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice maiden and I think he can get off the mark sooner rather than later. 19-04-21

runners.name: Mr Energia
runners.comment: Dual winner in Class 4 this season but struggled when upped to this grade in February
runners.spotlight: Began season with C&D win in September and added to his tally over 7f on turf in January; struggled when upped to this grade in February, though, and now has a point to prove.

runners.name: Flying Ting Lok
runners.comment: Won over 5.5f in Australia last year but weakened out of contention on first two HK starts
runners.spotlight: Won over 5.5f in Australia last year but weakened out of contention on his first two Hong Kong starts (6f/5f, turf).

runners.spotlight: Finished well for narrow C&D win in October and has remained in good form since; split Triumphant More and Super Infinity when snatching third here last month and will be dangerous if he gets a good pace to aim at.
